EXCLUSIVE: Cardi B's Husband Carter Explains the Secret Behind Her Fashion Choices at iHeartRadio Music Awards

In a shocking revelation, Cardi B's husband, Carter, has opened up about the secret behind the fashion choices she made during her performance at the iHeartRadio Music Awards. According to Carter, the pressure was off the charts as Cardi was set to open the show with a performance and had to change into an entirely different outfit afterward.

To cover up her baby bump, Carter reveals that she relied on tutus that night to hide her curves. However, the Moschino performance outfit, which merged a tutu and a peplum, and the Christian Siriano dress she changed into afterward, left people guessing whether Cardi was taking fashion risks or trying to hide something.

Despite the rumors, Carter insists that Cardi did not wear anything that would reveal her baby bump. “Toward the end there was a ton of speculation, but I don’t think she wore anything that was like, ‘Oh, my God, that’s her baby bump right there!?he says.

The process leading up to the awards show was also nerve-racking for Carter. However, he came to revel in the attention and admits that he has one of the biggest secrets in fashion and music. “I have one of the biggest secrets in fashion and music, and in culture more generally, and we’re getting away with this every time. How cool is that?”

But the process also left Carter with a deeper understanding of what it's like for women in the public eye to try to keep parts of their lives private. He was shocked to see Cardi being criticized online for having a baby, with people suggesting that her career was over.

“I couldn’t imagine going through that as a woman on a platform that big and remain standing, sticking with my decision. It takes a strong person to stick with that. She should be able to be the biggest artist that she wants to be and also have a family.?Carter concludes.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed account given by Cardi B's husband about the fashion choices she made at the iHeartRadio Music Awards, and his personal insights into the ordeal, it is likely that this is a real message and therefore its veracity would be rated as 1. The level of specific detail provided, along with the intimate knowledge of the situation, suggests that this message is not a fabrication.
cs_rationale: Based on the given message, it is likely to be a real message (1). The details provided about Cardi B's husband opening up about her fashion choices at the iHeartRadio Music Awards seem specific and plausible. The mention of the pressure, the use of tutus to hide her baby bump, and the speculation about her outfit choices all contribute to the credibility of the message. Additionally, the mention of Carter's thoughts about privacy and the criticism Cardi B faced online further adds to the authenticity of the message.

But it was De Niro's introduction of Springsteen that really caught fire, with the actor dropping the F-bomb twice before raising his arms and earning a sustained standing ovation.

This is just the latest in a string of shocking outbursts from Hollywood celebrities who are using their platforms to attack Trump and push their own political agendas.

Bachelorette parties are an exciting time for women as they prepare to celebrate the end of their single years and welcome a new chapter in their lives. With months of planning and preparation, the bachelorette weekend is set to begin, and the real fun can finally begin.

One of the most important aspects of a bachelorette party is the décor and accessories. With banners, koozies, shot glasses, and pool floaties, the party can become truly unforgettable. To make the party even more special, bachelorette party quotes, captions, and phrases can be customized with fun and memorable sayings to commemorate the last weekend of singledom.

Here are some classic, funny, and boozzy bachelorette party quotes and phrases to inspire and celebrate the upcoming bachelorette weekend:

Classic Bachelorette Quotes and Phrases:

* "The best 'I do' crew around. Kiss the miss goodbye."
* "Last fling before the ring. Bach and boujee."
* "Single for the very last time. Engaged AF."
* "A final toast to the single life before [name] becomes a wife."
* "Bride-in-training. She said 'yes,' we said [location]."
* "Bride vibes on repeat. Celebrating her forever."

Funny Bachelorette Quotes and Phrases:

* "Bach sh\*t crazy. Bach, please."
* "Caution: [Bride name] may contain alcohol."
* "From Miss to Mrs. with all my b\*tches."
* "Always a bridesmaid, never a sober one."
* "Get in loser, it’s [name’s] bachelorette."
* "Look like a beauty, party like a beast."
* "One more night, let’s do it right. Hit me baby, one more wine."
* "Pop it like it's hot. This b\*tch is gettin?hitched."
* "Sip happens 'Til death do us party. Bride or die."

Boozy Bachelorette Quotes and Phrases:

* "Pour decisions. Bach and boozy. A drink in one hand, a ring in the other."
* "Something borrowed, something blue, we party harder than you."
* "Drunk in love/Just drunk. Buy [me/her] a shot, [I'm/she’s] tying the knot."
* "Time to wine down. Wine flies when you're having fun."
* "Let’s get toasted. Save water, drink wine."
* "She's love drunk, we're just drunk. On cloud wine."
* "Huge hooray and yay for rosé. When I sip, you sip, we sip."
* "How merlot can you go. Vino and vows."
* "Let’s pop the top, she’s tying the knot. It’s my party and I’ll wine if I want to."
* "Namaste and cabernet. Watch me sip, sip, Chardon nay-nay."

Themed Bachelorette Quotes and Phrases:

* Beach: "Where my beaches at? Sun, sand, and a ring on my hand."
* Fiesta: "[Bride’s] final fiesta. She found her main squeeze. She said 'si'."
* Disney & Harry Potter: "Expecto patron and rum. Mischief far from managed. Wingardium mimosa. From muggle to Mrs."
* Nautical: "I found a catch/she found a keeper. The last sail before the veil. Let’s get nauti. Anchors down, bottoms up. Happiness comes in waves."
* Nashville & Country: "Red, white, and 'I do.' These boots were made for walkin' down the aisle. Honky tonk hoedown before the gown. Howdy, let’s get rowdy. Whiskey bent and veil bound. Cowgirl gang [Name’s]. last ride before she’s the bride. [Name’s]. last rodeo."

Bachelorette parties are a special time for women as they celebrate the end of their single years and prepare for the next chapter in their lives. With the right planning and preparation, the bachelorette weekend can be an unforgettable celebration of love and friendship.

As the sun beats down on the pristine white sand, Jenna Devan-Tatum and Jessica Alba sit side by side, sipping on cold drinks and basking in the warmth of the day. They are surrounded by the sounds of laughter and the gentle waves of the ocean, a far cry from the chaos of their busy lives.

But balancing work and family is no easy feat, as these two stunning women know all too well. As the host of NBC's new series, World of Dance, Jenna has had to juggle her acting career with motherhood, while also finding time to create a new Havaianas Mommy & Me flip-flops collection. And as the co-founder of the Honest Company, Jessica has had to balance her work with raising two young daughters.

Despite the challenges they face, these two women remain determined to make it all work. "Feeling like you are missing some critical moment will lead to some nasty conclusions," Jessica says, her voice laced with a hint of sadness. "A mother might not even realize that her kid's shoes are now too small for him or her."

Jenna agrees, adding that the most important thing is to find a balance and to make time for the things that matter most. "It's about finding that and about regularly not make yourself feel guilty," she says. "Instead, you have to work that out for yourself so that your family will get enough attention and quality time together."

As the sun begins to set, the two women look out at the vast expanse of the ocean, lost in thought. But even in the midst of their busy lives, they know that they have found their balance. And as they hug each other tightly, they both know that no matter how hard life gets, they will always have each other to lean on.

Gwen Stefani's youngest son, Apollo Bowie Flynn, celebrated his 4th birthday in a way that was both heartwarming and unforgettable. On a weekend filled with joy and laughter, the family threw a puppy-powered party that was a true celebration of life and love.

As the guest of honor, Apollo dressed up as the lovable canine character from the animated series, Scooby Doo. And what better way to honor such a special day than with a party that included face painting, a show by Bob Baker Marionette Theater, and even a visit from Scooby himself?

But the celebration didn't just stop there. The birthday boy's loved ones came dressed to impress, with Gwen Stefani dressed as Daphne and her boyfriend, Blake Shelton, dressed as Shaggy. And the pièce de résistance? A variety of cotton candy and confectionery centerpieces, each themed after a famous animated series, including one with a haunted house topper and another topped with a culinary rendering of Scooby's head.

While the guests didn't watch the show or get their energy out in the huge castle-shaped bounce house, they noshed on the delicious desserts. And who doesn't love cotton candy?

The extravagant celebration comes six months after Stefani, 48, threw a Harry Potter-themed bash for her second son, Zuma Nesta Rock, to celebrate his 9th birthday. And if that wasn't enough magic, Gwen's ex-husband, Gavin Rossdale, even joined in on the fun, throwing a spellbinding soirée that included Hogwarts house banners and balloons in coordinating colors, life-size cutouts of characters from the films, a potion-themed candy bar, a replica of Platform 9¾, and much more.

But it wasn't just Gwen and Gavin who were there to celebrate their boys. Blake Shelton, the country singer, opened up to PEOPLE in November about his love for the family. "There's days where you go, 'Oh my God, when does school start?' " he said. "An hour later you're going, 'God, I can't wait 'til they get home.' " "They're so damn funny," he added. "It's just my first time being around it, and it's easy to fall in love with those kids. They're pretty special."

This celebration was a reminder that love knows no bounds, and that family is the one thing that truly matters in this world. Happy birthday, Apollo Bowie Flynn! You are loved more than words can express.

content: On Saturday night, the stars came together in a sea of unity to raise funds for those affected by the devastating hurricanes that hit Puerto Rico just two months ago. Jennifer Lopez, Marc Anthony, Ellen DeGeneres, Stevie Wonder, and many more gathered for One Voice: Somos Live! A Concert for Disaster Relief, a benefit that was broadcasted live on Telemundo, Univision, and NBC from Miami and Los Angeles. The telethon also featured appearances from Kim Kardashian West, who encouraged viewers to donate to aid organizations, and performances from the organizers and other celebrities such as Ricky Martin, Chris Martin, Gwen Stefani, Demi Lovato, Maroon 5, Mary J. Blige, and more. Lopez, whose family is from Puerto Rico, told People.com that it was a natural fit for her to work with Anthony and Rodriguez on the event. "There's just no question about it when it comes to things like this," she said. "The truth is, we are all one. We are all family. We are doing this because it’s the right thing to do. Our community needs us right now, and we are very aware that we are leaders in our community. If we step out and do something, hopefully people will follow and do the same." As the night went on, the total raised for Puerto Rico exceeded $30 million, with Lopez posting a message of thanks on Instagram, thanking everyone who tuned in and donated. "Thank you for everyone who tuned in and donated...30 million and counting!! We are so grateful!! We are One Voice," she wrote.

Frankel's support for Hill comes as a surprise to many, given her history of speaking out against emotional abuse. However, the reality star is known for always speaking her mind and standing up for what she believes is right, even if it goes against popular opinion.

After 27 long years of providing the iconic jaunty cartoon music for The Simpsons, Alf Clausen has been fired from the show! AnnaLynne McCord, a star of the CW drama 90210, recently opened up to Us Weekly about her feud with costar Shenae Grimes. McCord, 30, revealed that the two didn't get along on the set of the show, which aired from 2008 to 2013.

"There was just discrepancies, ego, so much ego," McCord said at the premiere of her movie First We Take Brooklyn on February 7. "When you're that young ?Shenae was 18, I was 20 ?we got this crazy show that had so much hype around it and our egos were out of this world."

McCord, who was dealing with her own trauma at the time, added: "I know for me I have severe anxiety, I was dealing with trauma that I had never coped with, never even faced, never even acknowledged, and all of that stuff comes out when you're working 18 to 20 hours a day and you're with these same people. You see them more than your family, more than your boyfriend. So they're the ones that you take everything out on, and I think Shanae and I have such strong personalities, the friction was there and it was an energy thing as well."

However, after years of being "at each other's throats," Grimes, 28, reached out to McCord and the two have since become friends. McCord even attended Grimes' wedding to model Josh Beech in 2013.

"Obviously we've talked about it a million times now that we're friends. We hang out at the hot tub at her place," McCord told Us. "Last time I was there, I cooked chicken parmigiana, we hung out in her hot tub till 3 a.m. Her neighbors were like, 'Shut up!' So we're like this close now and we've talked about so many things."

First We Take Brooklyn opens in theaters on February 9 and was directed by Danny A. Abeckaser.

Reporting by Nicki Gostin.

The heart of Robert Pattinson beats with a desire to succeed, and in a recent appearance on "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" to promote his upcoming film, "Good Time," he revealed just how far he is willing to go for a job.

The British actor told host Jimmy Kimmel that directors Ben and Josh Safdie asked several outlandish things of him, some of which he joked toed "the line of legality." There was one request, however, that Pattinson, 31, outright refused.

"There’s a big dog. There was actually, sadly, another dog which was cast, who is this big dog’s son, but it died just before. Mustafa, who is the father, and this huge, huge dog, was initially in this scene," he said.

Robert Pattinson reveals the outlandish thing "Good Time" directors Ben and Josh Safdie asked of him during filming.

"There’s this one scene we shot ?there’s a drug dealer who bursts into the room, and I was sleeping with the dog and basically giving the dog a hand job."

Pattinson clarified that he refused to actually perform the sex act, though it does still appear in the film thanks to a stellar prop department. Rather than touch the canine actor in such a way, fake dog genitals were used for simulation.

"Wow, Hollywood is a great place. It really is," Kimmel retorted.

Fans will see that scene and more in the DVD version of "Good Time," Pattinson revealed during the late night TV show interview.

The crime drama, which has received high praise from critics, is set to be released on Aug. 11 in the United States.

In a stunning turn of events, Logan Paul has finally broken his silence and spoken out about the backlash that followed his controversial video showcasing a suicide victim in Japan's so-called Suicide Forest. During the interview, Paul explained that his original plan was to create a fun blog and make an entertaining video in a forest. However, things quickly took a drastic and negative turn. Paul's original video, which he took down within a day, generated massive backlash and criticism for showing the face of the suicide victim.

Despite facing death threats and criticism from millions of people, Paul remains defiant and believes that he is spreading the message about suicide prevention in the right way. He also revealed that he has been receiving death threats, which he described as "tough" but "not like I'm drowning."

When Strahan asked whether Paul feels like the criticism has been fair, he responded, "That's the thing. I do." However, he also added that he respects YouTube's decision to remove him from their premium advertising program and suspend all projects with him.

Despite the financial impact of the controversy, Paul remains optimistic and believes that creating and making other people happy makes him happy. He also expressed his gratitude to his fans, who have largely supported him over the last month.

As Hoda Kotb walked back into the Today Show studio, a wave of emotions washed over her. The camera panned to the crowd of fans outside Rockefeller Plaza, and she couldn't help but feel overwhelmed by the love and support they were showing her. She was back, and it felt like a dream come true.

"I've been a mess all morning," Kotb admitted, her voice shaking with emotion. "I'm scared to be sitting here. I'm a little afraid that I might explode into tears."

But her co-hosts, Savannah Guthrie and Matt Lauer, were there to support her every step of the way. Guthrie and Lauer had visited Kotb at home during her maternity leave, and they were thrilled to see her back in the studio.

"I'm feeling great. I don't think I've ever been this happy," Kotb said, reaching for a box of tissues to dry her eyes. "I'm going to get professional! OK, I'm ready."

As she settled back into her role as a co-host, Kotb opened up about her adoption journey and the incredible journey that had brought her to motherhood. "You think that by a certain stage in your life, I've had every experience that I've had, and then all of a sudden she shows up," she said. "I felt like in my life, I've had joy beyond what I could have imagined, but this is beyond a dream. Like, you had your dreams—and then this. I never believed in love at first sight until now."

As she gazed at her daughter, Haley Joy Kotb, tears streamed down her cheeks. "When I look at her I see forever. I see past me," she said. "I see the future, which I guess I never saw."

Kotb was grateful for the love and support of her family, and she made sure to express her gratitude to them every chance she got. "I want her to know she is loved by me, by my family and by everyone who's held her," she said. "I don't think she's going to know what to do with all the love."

As she settled into her role as a mother, Kotb was filled with a sense of contentment that she had never felt before. She was grateful for every moment, and she made sure to savor each and every one of them. "I realized there's so much love to be had," she said. "And I think sometimes it's smart to block some of the negativity that's out there in the world and realize that your world could be beautiful—if you keep it tight like that."

As she settled back into her role as a co-host, Kotb was filled with a sense of purpose and determination. She was grateful for the love and support of her family, and she was determined to make the most of every moment. "I'm going to get professional!" she said with a smile. "I'm ready."

The message captures the emotional depth and personal insights that align with a genuine account of Kotb's return to work and her journey as a new mother.

Original article:

Paris Jackson took to Instagram recently to share a picture of herself playing with cards. In the seemingly innocent snap, she appears to be topless. The it girl is holding cards in her hands for the photo and many of her followers believed she was playing strip poker since Paris tends to not caption any of her photos.

On Monday evening, Paris tweeted her frustration with the matter, clarifying that she wasn’t playing strip poker. The cards she was holding happened to be tarot cards. She does, however, confirm that she is naked in the picture.

Check out the photo and tweets below.

(Photo credit: Paris Jackson Instagram account)]

"Just a reminder that I'm human and make mistakes just like everyone else. I didn't caption this photo because I didn't want to give away what the cards were for. The cards I was holding were tarot cards, not strip poker cards. #NotADirtyStripPoker #SorryForTheConcern"

Serena Williams, a beloved tennis icon, had to withdraw from her fourth-round match against Maria Sharapova at the French Open due to an injury that affected her serve. The 23-time Grand Slam winner, who recently returned to the sport after giving birth to her first child, had been in top form in her opening matches, but the pain in her right pectoral muscle made it impossible for her to serve.

Williams, who has won the French Open three times, revealed that she first felt the problem during her third-round win over German 11th seed Julia Gorges on Saturday. She tried various treatments, including taping and support, to manage the pain, but it was too much for her to bear.

The 36-year-old tennis star, who has never experienced such an injury before, stated that she would have an MRI scan in Paris on Tuesday to determine the extent of her injury. She added that she would stay in the French capital until the scan results are known.

Sharapova, a two-time winner at Roland Garros, expressed her disappointment at Williams' withdrawal and wished her a speedy recovery. The pair's rivalry has been a highlight of women's tennis, with Williams winning 19 of their 21 meetings.

Russell Fuller, tennis correspondent for the BBC, noted that Williams had been playing at an exceptional level in the first week of the French Open, but the matches in six days may have taken a toll on her. A pectoral injury is most commonly associated with overuse, and if there is no serious damage, Williams' participation in Wimbledon may still be possible.

Serena Williams' withdrawal from the French Open has left tennis fans heartbroken, but her resilience and determination to overcome injury are an inspiration to many. We wish her all the best in her recovery and hope to see her back on the court soon.

content:
"BIGGEST LOSER" TRAINER BOB HARPER REJECTS NARROW ESCAPE FROM DEATH!

In a miraculous turn of events, the "Biggest Loser" trainer has just reached a major milestone in his recovery from a terrifying heart attack, which left him fighting for his life just four months ago. The 51-year-old fitness icon took to Instagram to share the news with his followers, captioning a post: "Yesterday was a BIG DAY in my recovery from my heart attack. I finished my cardiac rehab. It has been super important to me and also HUMBLING. All the support that I've been getting from all my IG friends helped me when it was tough so THANK YOU for all the love and support."

The post features a heart drawn in red chalk, with the words "Rehab" and "36/36" scrawled inside, symbolizing Harper's successful completion of cardiac rehab. The trainer's image is a testament to his resilience and strength, as he continues to fight for his health and wellbeing.

Back in February, Harper was working out with friends when he suddenly collapsed, falling to the ground and stopping breathing. "I was in full cardiac arrest," he revealed to Savannah Guthrie on TODAY in April. "My heart stopped. Not to be dramatic, but I was dead. I was on that ground dead."

Thankfully, two doctors who were in the gym at the time administered CPR and used a defibrillator before paramedics arrived to take Harper to the hospital. After being admitted to the hospital, Harper was placed in a medically induced coma for two days and underwent two stents to keep his arteries open and reduce the risk of future heart attacks.

Harper later discovered that he had suffered a heart attack due to high levels of a particle in his blood known as lipoprotein(a), a condition that is hereditary. His mother, a heart attack victim, serves as a poignant reminder of the importance of knowing one's health.

Despite the challenges he has faced, Harper remains optimistic and grateful for the support of his friends and followers. "It's been hard," he told Savannah. "I'm going through some depression. You really face your mortality. And I'm really understanding what's important in life." His resilience and positive attitude serve as an inspiration to his fans, who continue to rally around him as he continues on his journey to wellness.

The written account also mentions medical details such as undergoing stents and the hereditary nature of his condition. Overall, the level of detail and the inclusion of specific events lead to a prediction of the message's veracity, so it is more likely to be a real message. Therefore, the prediction is 1.

Get ready for the royal wedding of the century! Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's upcoming nuptials are set to be the most talked-about event of the year, and they'll definitely be unlike any other royal wedding you've ever seen. Here's what we know so far about how the wedding will be a total departure from the 2011 ceremony between Prince William and Kate Middleton.

On Tuesday, Kensington Palace made the announcement that the wedding will take place in May 2018 at St. George's Chapel in Windsor Castle, with the Queen giving her approval for the venue. The royal family will foot the bill for the wedding, and Windsor Castle, where the Queen calls home for part of every year, is located about 20 miles west of London. "Windsor is a very special place for Prince Harry and he and Ms. Markle have regularly spent time there over the last year and a half," Kensington Palace said in a statement. Harry himself was christened there in 1984, so by the rules of the Church of England, he can be married there.

But what really sets Harry and Meghan's wedding apart from any other royal affair? For starters, it won't be the first time a recent royal has married at St. George's. According to NBC News, Harry's uncle, Prince Edward, married Sophie Rhys-Jones there in 1999, and his cousin, Peter Phillips, married Autumn Kelly at the chapel in 2008. Prince Charles and Camilla Parker-Bowles had a televised religious blessing there after they had a civil wedding ceremony nearby in 2005.

St. George's Chapel at Windsor Castle is a much smaller space than Westminster Abbey, holding around 800 people compared to the Abbey's whopping 2,000. Harry and Meghan plan on making the ceremony a reflection of their personalities and they're working on a way to involve the public in some way, their spokesman revealed. The couple wants the day to be a special, celebratory moment for their friends and family, but they also want the public to feel part of the celebrations.

“It will be a moment of fun and joy that will reflect the character of the bride and groom,?their spokesman told journalists. “The couple of course want the day to be a special, celebratory moment for their friends and family. They also want the day to be shaped so as to allow members of the public to feel part of the celebrations too and are currently working through ideas for how this might be achieved.?Get ready for the most talked-about royal wedding of the century!

Bachelor Nation's favorite couple, Evan Bass and Carly Waddell, are tying the knot in Paradise! The couple's intimate ceremony will take place in Mexico, where they first fell in love on last year's Paradise. Chris Harrison will officiate the ceremony, which will take place at the Vidanta Nuevo Vallarta resort near Puerto Vallarta in June.

However, the state of their wedding hit a snag when production on the series was suspended in June after a June 4 sexual encounter between two cast members who had been drinking. A producer filed a misconduct allegation and studio Warner Bros. Television suspended filming on June 11 to investigate. Filming eventually resumed two weeks later, but Bass and Waddell's nuptials took place June 17, when the fate of the season was still up in the air.

Bass and Waddell remain one of a handful of success stories to emerge from the franchise and they now have their first child on the way. When they returned to Mexico amid the summer saga, they both had to block out the production shutdown to keep their TV fairytale going.

"We were sort of in that wedding glow," Bass explains. "It felt like we were in a bubble. It was all about the wedding. I think everyone was super respectful of the fact that this was our big day. It was all about us."

The morning of their wedding, Bass published a column on THR pleading with ABC to not cancel the show. With the investigation still ongoing, WBTV and ABC were unable to offer any details on if the show would return.

In the wake of the season four investigation, the amount of alcohol consumed on set became a hot topic. As a result of the controversy, Paradise kept tabs on the cast's drinking when they returned to set - something Harrison will discuss with the cast, also on Tuesday's episode.

Bass and Waddell say they are ready to pass the torch to another couple this season. "There's going to be another couple this season that takes our place," says Bass. "You can’t let the haters affect your relationship. There’s no way it doesn’t affect you, but you have to work through that together. It’s crazy how one person’s tweet affects you."

Looking back, Bass admitted that there was doubt in his mind that he pushed aside about whether filming on the show - and potentially the series - would ever resume. "I felt through sheer willpower that I could make it come back to life," he now says. "I trust everyone that’s a part of the show. I felt like we knew it would come back."

And Waddell adds, "We’re so excited to watch the season. The show has such a dear place in our hearts."

Peter Capaldi, who has been the Doctor since 2013, was the 12th actor to take on the role since "Doctor Who" first aired on British television in 1963. The news of Whittaker's appointment was revealed in a heart-stopping video, in which she steps into the Tardis, the Doctor's teleportation device.

Whittaker's journey to the Doctor's role began with her portrayal of Ellie Miller in the British crime series "Broadchurch," and her film credits include "Attack the Block," "Adult Life Skills," "Black Sea," "Ashes," "Good Vibrations," and "One Day."

In an interview with the Radio Times, Whittaker reassured fans that her gender should not be a cause for concern. "This is a really exciting time, and Doctor Who represents everything that's exciting about change. The fans have lived through so many changes, and this is only a new, different one, not a fearful one," she said.

Whittaker's appointment to the role of the Doctor has been met with excitement and joy by fans, with Colin Baker, the sixth actor to play the role, tweeting his delight at the announcement: "Well I never, the BBC really did do the right thing and let the Doctor be in touch with her feminine side. As a father of daughters - result!"

The appointment of Jodie Whittaker as the 13th Doctor in "Doctor Who" marks a significant moment in the show's history, and fans are eagerly anticipating the new era of the Time Lord.

Selena Gomez, a 24-year-old pop star who executive produced Netflix's 13 Reasons Why, has opened up about the personal significance of the show. Gomez, who has been a vocal advocate for mental health awareness, has spoken at length about the show's themes of bullying, depression, and suicide.

During a press event in February, Gomez revealed that she had been deeply affected by the final episode of the show. She explained that she had experienced similar struggles and could relate to the characters' experiences.

Now, Gomez's personal struggles with mental health have become even more poignant. Along with the show's stars Tommy Dorfman and Alisha Boe, Gomez got a semicolon tattoo to represent Project Semicolon, a suicide prevention and mental health awareness organization. The symbolic punctuation represents the idea that when one thought ends, a new one begins - that "this is not the end but a new beginning."

The trio showed off their matching ink on Instagram, with Boe captioning the post, "Project Semicolon is a movement dedicated to presenting hope for those suffering from depression, thoughts of suicide, addiction, and self-injury. It's a reminder that we are not alone and that we can find hope and healing." Dorfman also shared his own personal struggles with mental health, writing, "I struggled with addiction and depression issues through high school and early college. I reached out and asked for help. At the time, I thought my life was over, I thought I'd never live past the age of 21. Today I'm grateful to be alive, in this new chapter of life in recovery, standing with my colleagues and friends, making art that helps other people."

Gomez's advocacy for mental health awareness and her willingness to share her own struggles have been instrumental in bringing attention to the issue and reducing the stigma surrounding mental health. Her support for Project Semicolon and the show's themes of hope and healing are an inspiration to those who are struggling with mental health issues.

Lyle and Erik Menendez, notorious murderers who killed their wealthy parents in 1989, have been reunited for the first time in over two decades, according to a shocking report.

The brothers, aged 47 and 50 respectively, were transferred to Richard J. Donovan Correctional Facility in San Diego, where they will be housed in the same section. Erik Menendez was previously found guilty of killing their father Jose and mother Kitty, along with conspiracy to commit murder, in 1996.

The brothers claimed they killed their parents after years of abuse, but prosecutors argued they wanted access to their parents' millions. They were each sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.

Lyle Menendez reportedly requested to be moved closer to his brother, and he was transferred from Mule Creek State Prison in Northern California to the R.J. Donovan Correctional Facility in San Diego on Feb. 22. Erik Menendez was then moved to the same unit as his brother on Wednesday.

"There are people who are related who may also be crime partners, and it's not unprecedented for them to be living in the same prison or even sharing the same cell," a spokesperson for the California Department of Corrections told the New York Daily News.

The brothers will now be able to spend time together at meals, during recreational periods, and while exercising. Tammi Menendez, who married Erik three years after his sentencing, described the reunion as "heartfelt."

Jennifer Lawrence has revealed that her romantic relationship with the director of her latest film, "mother!," Darren Aronofsky, was the cause of their breakup. According to an interview with Adam Sandler for Variety's Actors on Actors series, the actress said that Aronofsky's unhealthy reactions to the film's negative reception became a strain on their relationship.

"Normally, I promote a movie, ask people to go see it, and then it's just out of your hands," Lawrence said. "But when I was dating the director, it was different. We'd be on the press tour together, and all he wanted to talk about was the movie. I was trying to be supportive, but it was driving me crazy."

Lawrence added that reading the negative reviews made her extra protective of Aronofsky, which only added to the strain on their relationship. "I finally was just like, 'It's not healthy. Neither of us are doing it,'" she said. "I just feel defensive when I read a negative review about the movie, and it's his baby. It's awesome, but I can't stand to read about it."

The actress and Aronofsky first met on the set of "mother!," and dating rumors started swirling in September 2016. They were spotted kissing in New York City two months later. However, their relationship was reportedly on the rocks by October, and they called it quits after just one year of dating.

Aronofsky, 48, was previously engaged to Rachel Weisz, with whom he shares a 11-year-old son. Lawrence has also been in high-profile relationships with Nicholas Hoult and Chris Martin.

Woody Allen, a beloved filmmaker who has been a cultural icon for decades, has spoken out about his support for the #MeToo movement. However, his name has been dragged into the midst of a painful and heartbreaking situation involving allegations of sexual abuse made by his daughter, Dylan Farrow.

In an interview with Argentinian news program Periodismo Para Todos, Allen dismissed the allegations as false and defended himself, stating that he has been "thoroughly looked at 25 years ago by all the authorities and everybody came to the conclusion that it was untrue." He added that it is "a terrible thing to accuse a person of" and that he has a "family and his own children."

The resurfaced allegations against Harvey Weinstein and other Hollywood figures have sparked a conversation about sexual misconduct and the need for justice. Allen expressed his support for the #MeToo movement, saying that "if there is something like the #MeToo movement now, you root for them, you want them to bring to justice these terrible harassers, these people who do all these terrible things."

However, the 82-year-old filmmaker is frustrated that his name has been equated with those accused of misconduct. He believes he should be "the poster boy for the #MeToo movement," as he has worked in movies for 50 years and has never been accused of impropriety by any of the hundreds of actresses he has worked with.

Allen's son Moses Farrow defended him in a blogpost, accusing his sister's story of being a "discredited allegation" and accusing his mother, Mia Farrow, of "brainwashing" and abusive behavior. In response, Dylan Farrow called his words "beyond hurtful." Mia Farrow has previously stated that Moses Farrow has cut off his entire family, including his ex-wife, who was pregnant when he left, and that he made up the allegations to please Woody.

Allen's next film, A Rainy Day in New York, faces an uncertain future after stars Timothée Chalamet, Selena Gomez, and Rebecca Hall donated their salaries to various charities. The romantic comedy is yet to receive a release date.

Therefore, the prediction for veracity would be 1.

content:
"SHOCKER: TV Powerhouse Shonda Rhimes Ditches Disney for Netflix, Ending 15 Years of ABC Stardom!"

In a move that has sent shockwaves throughout the entertainment industry, Shonda Rhimes, the creative mastermind behind hit TV shows such as "Grey's Anatomy" and "How to Get Away with Murder," has announced that she is leaving ABC Studios to join the ranks of Netflix.

This decision is a major blow to Disney, Rhimes' home for the past 15 years, and to broadcast TV in general. Rhimes has been one of the most reliable hitmakers in prime time in the past dozen years, and her departure will leave a huge void in the industry.

According to sources close to Rhimes, the showrunner is ready to move on to a new chapter of her career, one that will give her and her Shondaland factory far more room to maneuver from a creative perspective.

However, broadcast TV is still the biggest platform in the traditional TV universe, but it has become increasingly less attractive to creatives, especially those like Rhimes who have nothing left to prove in the network TV arena.

As development for the 2018-19 season cranks into high gear, industry insiders are grousing about a general stasis when it comes to dealmaking and a lack of ambition in programming at a time when the array of material on competing outlets has never been more diverse.

On the flip side, network executives privately say they feel like they're under siege. Success for them is still defined by broad-based hits, but smaller rivals are forking over significantly more money and perks to draw high-wattage talent.

ABC's perspective on Rhimes' departure is complicated. While it's hard to watch her walk out the door, she's still doing a lot of day-to-day business with them and will be for the foreseeable future.

Rhimes has no less than five series in various stages of production, including "Grey's," "HTGAWM," the final season of "Scandal," new midseason legal drama "For the People," and the untitled "Grey's Anatomy" spinoff revolving around firefighters. And there's at least one Shondaland pilot in the hopper for the 2018-19 season.

ABC Studios has expanded its focus to producing shows for non-ABC outlets, including its Marvel series for Netflix and the Showtime comedy "SMILF." However, the appeal of a heavy courtship from Netflix is easy to understand. No ratings, more creative control, subject matter that need not be mass appeal - for a showrunner who has worked at a prolific pace for 15 years, what's not to love?

Rhimes' deal is unlike any other talent pact that Netflix has made to date. The company will provide generous overhead for Shondaland and its roughly 30 employees. Rhimes herself will see hefty upfront payments for her work on various shows.

Even more than the bottom-line concerns, the optics of Rhimes deciding to change lanes and channel her creative energy into Netflix productions is a hit to broadcast TV's image. The showrunner will keep one foot firmly planted in her legacy shows for the time being - but for the future, Rhimes has voted with her feet.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed descriptions and the straightforward nature of the message, it is more likely to be a real message. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.
cs_rationale:
1. Veracity Prediction: 1

Based on the content of the message and the details provided, it is highly likely that the message is real. It discusses a significant event in the entertainment industry - Shonda Rhimes, a well-known TV powerhouse, leaving ABC Studios to join Netflix. The message provides specific information about Rhimes' shows, her reasons for leaving, and the impact of her departure on both Disney and broadcast TV in general. Additionally, it mentions industry insiders' concerns about dealmaking and lack of ambition in programming, which adds to the credibility of the message.

As Dove Cameron, the star of Disney Channel's Descendants 3, shares her heart-wrenching thoughts on the negative impact social media has on her life, she finds herself in the midst of a global phenomenon - social media fatigue. Surveys conducted in recent years reveal that millennials, the first generation born with the internet at their fingertips, are feeling overwhelmed and disconnected by the constant stream of images and information that social media platforms provide.

In a series of emotional videos posted on Instagram Stories, Cameron, 22, candidly expresses her love-hate relationship with social media. She admits that while it can be a source of connection and entertainment, it can also be a source of unhappiness and self-doubt.

"I really hate how Instagram makes me feel, and I hate how Twitter and any kind of social media makes me feel," she says. "Whether I'm looking at other people's lives or how I portray my life, I just hate the whole thing. I hate it. I think that they're something super wrong with staring at other people that much and I think there's something really wrong with staring at yourself that much."

Cameron compares social media to a "group depression" and acknowledges the irony of her discussing her thoughts on social media while being on social media herself. She also advises her fans not to put too much stock in social media, as it ultimately has no bearing on one's worth or soul.

As social media use continues to grow, it's clear that it's not all sunshine and rainbows. While it can bring people together and provide a platform for self-expression, it can also contribute to feelings of inadequacy and disconnection. Cameron's words serve as a poignant reminder to be mindful of our use of social media and to prioritize our own well-being.

The Emmys were a hotbed of humor and jabs at the President, with host Stephen Colbert poking fun at Trump's past tweets about the awards. Trump himself was nominated for an Emmy but failed to win, tweeting in 2013 that he would have won "many times" if it wasn't for political bias.

Facebook users have reported an issue with the in-app browser making unnecessary requests for cookies on websites. This appears to be a flaw in the browser and should be addressed. To avoid this issue, users can disable the in-app browser and continue to use the Facebook app. To disable the in-app browser, users can follow these steps:

1. Access the settings menu by clicking the hamburger menu in the top right.
2. Select "App Settings."
3. Turn on the option "Links Open Externally."

Users can also enable cookies in different browsers:

* Internet Explorer 7, 8 & 9: Open the Internet Browser, click Tools > Internet Options > Privacy > Advanced, check "Override automatic cookie handling," accept cookies from sites, and click OK and OK.
* Firefox: Open the Firefox browser, click Tools > Options > Privacy > Use custom settings for history, check "Accept cookies from sites" and "Accept third party cookies," select "Keep until: they expire," and click OK.
* Google Chrome: Open the Google Chrome browser, click Tools > Options > Privacy Options > Under the Hood > Content Settings, check "Allow local data to be set," uncheck "Block third-party cookies from being set," and uncheck "Clear cookies."
* Mobile Safari (iPhone, iPad): Access the Home screen, select the Settings icon, select Safari, select "accept cookies," select "from visited," and restart Safari if necessary.

Facebook recommends that users continue to use the Facebook app until the issue is resolved.
td_rationale: This message is more likely to be a real message, scoring a 1. It provides specific details on how to disable the in-app browser and enable cookies in different browsers, which suggests that it is a genuine attempt to address a reported issue. The instructions for different browsers also add to the credibility of the message, as it shows a thorough understanding of the problem and potential solutions. "Farrah Abraham's Transformation: Reality Star Undergoes Vaginal Rejuvenation!"

In a shocking turn of events, the Teen Mom OG star, Farrah Abraham, has revealed that she underwent a drastic procedure to enhance her lady parts. Abraham, 26, documented her experience at the Beverly Hills Rejuvenation Center in Los Angeles on Saturday, August 26.

Abraham posted a photo on Instagram showing her standing alongside a doctor in front of a lobby desk, wearing a pretty lace top with a black skirt. She captioned it, "Loving my lady parts!" with the hashtag #vaginalrejuvenation. Another photo showed the reality star lying on an examination table with a sheet over her legs while she underwent the procedure.

In a video Abraham uploaded, her doctor explained the process of vaginal rejuvenation, saying, "What this does is distributes little wounds through radio frequency which kind of breaks up the collagen and forces it to restore during that healing process, so everything becomes tighter and you actually experience ... like you're 16 again!"

However, Abraham's followers quickly slammed the single mom for sharing the private procedure. Many expressed their disappointment and concern for her daughter, Sophia. One person wrote, "My god...poor little Sophia. A mother who ‘loves?her body so much she altered every bit of it. Great example. I hope Sophia will grow into a strong and independent woman who does not need her ‘mother?to be around."

Another commented, "Farrah why? I understand you’re a mom and need the procedure for personal reasons but why make it public? Have respect as a mother for your child and for others."

A third follower simply asked, "Aren’t you like 25? Why do you need this?"

Abraham has previously undergone plastic surgery to alter her nose and chin, and has breast implants. She also shared pics on Twitter in 2015 of an allergic reaction she had to lip implants. Abraham also met with a surgeon in 2016, in a segment shown on The Doctors, to look into getting a butt lift.

For the latest celebrity entertainment, news and lifestyle videos, subscribe to Us Weekly's YouTube Page.

Born on May 6, 1961, in Lexington, Kentucky, Clooney began his acting career with minor roles in television shows before achieving stardom with his role as Dr. Doug Ross in the medical drama series ER. Clooney's transition to the big screen was marked by an array of successful films spanning various genres. He co-founded the humanitarian organization Not On Our Watch to prevent mass atrocities and has been actively involved in advocating for refugees. Luann de Lesseps is still grappling with the pain caused by her falling out with Real Housewives of New York City costar Dorinda Medley. On Monday night, the Countess took to the stage for another round of her cabaret show, #CountessAndFriends, from Feinstein's/54 Below in New York City.

During the Q&A session, a fan asked if de Lesseps would ever consider reconciling with Medley. The two, both 53, had an explosive argument on the show's tenth season, which began when de Lesseps questioned Medley's drinking habits during a vacation with their castmates in Cartagena, Colombia. Medley's response was to mock de Lesseps for her headline-making arrest and trip to rehab.

Further insults were exchanged at the season 10 reunion, where Medley claimed that de Lesseps only sought treatment to avoid jail time and that she had become "confused between fame and infamy" after her cabaret show took off. The hurtful words still linger for de Lesseps. "What she said hurts still," she admitted. "I'm just trying to process it and get over it right now. I'm not ready to take the Band-Aid off. I'm still scarred from it!"

Despite the ongoing pain, de Lesseps remains hopeful that she and Medley can reconcile. "I do [want to make up with her]. I love Dorinda," she said. "We've known each other for a long time. I'm sure we'll come to a good decision."

John Lamparski/Getty

De Lesseps was equally uncompromising during her appearance on Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen on September 5. She denied the claim that she was court-ordered to go to rehab and defended her attitude towards the success of her cabaret show. "Yeah, I'm not taking advice, right now, from Dorinda," she said. "Thank you for those two cents. But I will say, my cabaret, to me, is everything. I've found my calling in my life and if that makes them uncomfortable, that is too bad for them. That's all I can say. When I do my shows, I'm on stage and I'm doing my thing, so I don't let [the boozy environment] really affect me. I understand their concern and I appreciate it, but I'm good because I'm on stage doing what I love."

That same positivity was evident on Monday night as de Lesseps took to the stage and sang about finding her calling in life. She was supported in the crowd by Real Housewives of New York City costars Sonja Morgan and Teresa Giudice, who performed with her. The three women shared a heartfelt moment as they celebrated the joys of self-expression and the strength it takes to pursue one's dreams.

As de Lesseps prepares for more performances of #CountessAndFriends, she remains committed to healing from the pain caused by her falling out with Medley. "I'm doing what I love," she told the crowd. "I found my calling." The additional shows will be announced on her official website shortly.

This message describes a personal conflict between Luann de Lesseps and her Real Housewives of New York City co-star Dorinda Medley. It provides details about their argument and the hurtful words exchanged during the show's tenth, as well as de Lesseps' desire for reconciliation despite the ongoing pain. message also highlights de Lesseps' commitment to her cabaret show and finding her calling in life.

"Garner was very emotional but decided to take the situation into her own hands," the eyewitness said. "She looked distraught."

"This has been a rough few days and [Jennifer] wants nothing more than to feel [Ben] is getting the help that he needs," the source said, adding that Garner has been "Ben's rock" throughout this process. The stars aligned on Sunday evening at the Golden Globe Awards in Los Angeles, creating a moment of unexpected joy for fans of emotional teen film The Fault in Our Stars. Lead actors Shailene Woodley and Ansel Elgort were reunited at the ceremony, bringing tears to the eyes of those who have followed their careers since the movie's release in 2014.

Woodley, who was nominated for Best Supporting Actress in a Series, Miniseries, or Motion Picture for TV for her role in the HBO hit Big Little Lies, attended the ceremony alongside her costars. Despite not taking home the award, she radiated happiness and positivity, showing that her success has not changed her humble and grateful spirit.

Elgort, who was nominated for Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture ?Musical or Comedy for playing the part of getaway driver baby in Baby Driver, also attended the ceremony. Despite losing out to James Franco in The Disaster Artist, he was overjoyed to be in the same room as Woodley, who had already been nominated for a Golden Globe. He wrote on Instagram alongside a photo of the two of them cuddling, "To be in the same room at the Golden Globes with a woman who helped guide me early in my career when she was already a Golden Globe nominee, was a surreal moment. Life coming full circle."

The Fault in Our Stars, based on the novel by John Green, tells the story of a 16-year-old girl with cancer who falls in love with a 17-year-old boy who is an ex-basketball player and amputee. The film moved audiences around the world with its heart-wrenching and uplifting portrayal of love and loss, and the actors who brought the story to life have continued to inspire fans with their talent and their humanity.

The reunion of Woodley and Elgort at the Golden Globe Awards was a moment of pure joy for fans of the movie, and a reminder that even in the face of heartbreak and tragedy, there is always hope for love and happiness.

content:
"Goodbye Hannah Baker: Katherine Langford on Saying Farewell to Her Iconic Role in 13 Reasons Why"

In the heart-wrenching Season 2 of 13 Reasons Why, fans were left to say goodbye to the character of Hannah Baker, played by Katherine Langford. But for Langford, saying goodbye to her first major role was bittersweet.

"In all honesty, no. I think [showrunner] Brian’s [Yorkey] always had an idea about how many episodes that I would be in, but this season was interesting because unlike last season, it was completely new territory," Langford told Entertainment Weekly. "We weren’t based on a book, and particularly for Hannah, it was something that was developed over the course of shooting, but I think that ultimately it was important to have her back for a second season and assist in continuing the dialogue from season 1 and following a lot of the other characters this season, particularly Clay."

But playing Hannah this season was a challenge for Langford. "Season 1 was something that I could really sink my teeth into and pour myself into the character, whereas this season was challenging as an actor because I had to put a lot of faith and a lot of trust into the writers and the directors in making sure that what I was doing was right and their vision," she explained. "I think what everyone learned over the course of shooting and developing her was that you don’t see the same Hannah this season, and that’s for a number of reasons, but one of the biggest reasons is that every time we see Hannah this season, it’s either through flashbacks or filtered through the eyes of someone else. Or it’s through the eyes of Clay as a presence. You only ever see her through the eyes of someone else."

Despite the challenges, Langford was proud of the work they did with Hannah's story. "For me, we told Hannah’s story so fully in season 1," she said. "And in a way, doing that scene in episode 13 [of season 1], I’ve so often referred to it as it was the hardest scene because it’s the scene where I had to let her go. I think coming back this season was challenging because it was playing her but not really her. The challenge was when you tell a character’s story so fully, and then you have to come back as a version of her that’s filtered through other people’s eyes; that required a lot of trust."

Langford hopes that people will take away from Hannah's story that "it doesn’t matter who she was or what she did, she didn’t deserve any of what happened to her." And as for her career, playing Hannah was just one of many highlights for Langford, who is also in Love, Simon and has another film, Spontaneous, coming soon. "13 Reasons Why will always be a really special part of my life," she said. "But I’m also really excited for what’s to come."
td_rationale: The message is likely to be real as it provides detailed information about Katherine Langford's experience playing the character of Hannah Baker in Season 2 of 13 Reasons Why. Langford's interview with Entertainment Weekly and her reflections on her role in the show seem genuine and credible. The message also discusses her future career prospects and upcoming projects, adding further authenticity to the content. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message. Prediction: 1

Fitness instructors play a vital role in helping individuals achieve their weight loss and fitness goals. They provide guidance and support to clients, but must also possess certain skills and qualifications to be successful. To become a certified fitness instructor, one must complete specialized training and pass various certifications. These certifications not only enhance the instructor's credibility, but also instill confidence in clients.

The job outlook for fitness workers is expected to grow at a faster-than-average rate, according to the Bureau of Labor Statistics. This is due in part to the growing obesity epidemic and the aging population, which both contribute to a continued demand for fitness instructor services. Many fitness instructors work part-time at health clubs or hospitals, supplementing their income by coaching private clients. The median salary of a fitness instructor was $29,210 in May 2008.

Fitness centers often require instructors to have a college education in exercise, nutrition, or wellness. College majors may include exercise science, physical education, or kinesiology, which is the study of human motion. Instructors must also have training in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR), either through college or the Red Cross.

Certification is an important aspect of becoming a fitness instructor. Instructors who are certified have demonstrated their knowledge and expertise in a particular exercise program. Many agencies offer certification programs for various exercise programs, such as Pilates or aerobics. American Fitness Professionals and Associates also offers several certification programs, including specialization in sports nutrition, children's fitness, and prenatal exercise.

Fitness instructors must possess certain personality traits to be successful. They must be confident, enthusiastic, and able to motivate clients to maintain an exercise routine. Motivation is a personality trait that cannot be learned in school, but positive attitudes can be cultivated. Instructors should also be in good shape and able to engage in the same exercises they ask of their clients.

Client expectations for fitness instructors are high. They expect instructors to be in good shape and able to engage in the same exercises they ask of their clients. Instructors who do not follow their own advice are less likely to be effective motivators. Additionally, clients expect more emphasis on overall wellness from instructors, beyond just exercise training.

The message discusses the role and qualifications of fitness instructors, the job outlook for fitness workers, the educational requirements, certification programs, and the personality traits of successful fitness instructors. The information provided is highly specific and detailed, leading to a prediction of 1 for veracity.
cs_rationale: Based on the information provided, it is likely that this message is a real message (veracity = 1). It also mentions the job outlook and median salary for fitness instructors. The requirements for education and CPR training are mentioned as well. The message emphasizes the importance of certification and the need for instructors to possess certain personality traits, such as confidence and motivation. It also highlights client expectations for instructors to be in good shape and promote overall wellness. Overall, the message appears to provide factual information about the role and requirements of fitness instructors.

As the anticipation builds, the moment we've all been waiting for has finally arrived. Tia Mowry, star of the hit show "The Sister, Sister," has revealed the gender of her second baby with her husband, Cory Hardrict. And the news is... a beautiful baby girl!

The actress, 39, shared a gender reveal video on her YouTube page, Tia Mowry's Quick Fix, on January 12th. She started the video by giving her followers some tips on how to announce their own baby's gender. But at the end of the tutorial, she shocked her viewers by biting into a cake pop to reveal the gender of her own baby. And the moment was priceless.

"Now for the moment we've all been waiting for ?MY gender reveal," she said before biting into the sweet treat. "Let's find out!" And then, as she held the pink cake pop in her hand, she exclaimed, "We're having a girl!"

Mowry and Hardrict, 37, are already parents to a 6-year-old son named Cree. And the actress couldn't wait to share the news with her son. "Cree is going to have a baby sister," she said in the video. "We are so excited!"

The actress announced her pregnancy on Instagram on November 8th, with an adorable photo of Hardrict and Mowry kissing her baby bump. She captioned the post with four heart emojis.

❤️❤️❤️❤️

But Mowry and Hardrict have been together for 13 years and married for five. They tied the knot in April 2008 and renewed their vows in April 2013 after welcoming their first child.

"Cree was my motivation and inspiration to renew our vows," she told Us Weekly at the time. "Cory and I have been together for 13 years and married for five. However, we now have this new miracle in our lives and I wanted to celebrate our love, and what our love together created ?Cree!"

The couple's love story is one that many of us can relate to. They met in high school and were friends for years before getting together. They dated for eight years before tying the knot and starting a family.

We are so excited for this new addition to the Mowry-Hardrict family and can't wait to see what the future holds for this beautiful couple.

On September 10th, ABC will introduce a new hour of "Good Morning America" featuring popular host Michael Strahan and co-host Sara Haines. The program will air in the early afternoon, extending the franchise's presence to ABC's daytime schedule and allowing the network to create larger advertising packages. The launch is also expected to boost affiliates, as ABC can promote the extension during the main "GMA" broadcast.

The new hour will be taped, not live, and will air at 1 p.m. on weekdays. One possibility for the show's format involves using the live, in-studio audience from the 8 a.m. hour of the flagship show. The move follows a short-lived attempt to expand "GMA's" afternoon presence in 2012, when Josh Elliott and Lara Spencer co-anchored "Good Afternoon America."

ABC's "Good Morning America" remains the most-watched morning program, but its main rival, "Today," co-anchored by Hoda Kotb and Savannah Guthrie, typically wins more viewers between 25 and 54, the demographic most favored by advertisers. As of July 13, "Today" has attracted 151,000 more viewers in that demographic than "GMA," while "GMA" has a total viewership advantage of 63,000.

The expansion to afternoons comes as ABC is also working to expand the show's digital presence. In April, "GMA" launched a morning newsletter and a revamped website, separate from ABC News' content deal with Yahoo. The senior executive producer of "GMA," Michael Corn, noted that the show often produces more content than can be covered in the 7 a.m. to 9 a.m. program.

Haines will leave "The View" to participate in the new program, following the departure of ABC News correspondent Faris to focus on reporting bigger stories. The move leaves "The View" with four hosts: Whoopi Goldberg, Joy Behar, Sunny Hostin, and Meghan McCain. Details about the hosts for the third "GMA" hour were previously reported by Page Six.

In this retrospective album, the early hits of the young twins are revisited. The opening track, "Your Heartless Void," features a four-track demo that the girls recorded before being signed to a major label. The song's honest and sincere lyrics about the emptiness of modern romance and the importance of avoiding a meaningless existence are accompanied by a haunting classical guitar performance from Ashley-Olsen, reminiscent of early minimalist works by Lou Reed.

The following two tracks, "Stabbing and Punching" and "Toothless Rookie," showcase the twins' brief dalliance with the punk scene. Despite the repetitive power chords and simplistic bridge-solos, the lyrics maintain a level of depth and meaning previously reserved for bands like The Ramones or The Clash. "Stabbing" in particular stands out, with Mary-Kate's powerful ending of screaming, "You can rip out my heart, but you'll never take my soul you filthy [expletive]!"

The next five tracks on the album are considered the weakest, with their focus on ponies and their various attributes. While these tracks are amusing in a contextually humorous way, they do tend to drone on.

The final three tracks on the album are considered the highlights, and are what have solidified the twins' status as a musical powerhouse. The production levels are greatly improved upon with the addition of Nigel Goodrich, and the songs showcase the twins' diverse range and songwriting abilities. "I Wanna Dance All Night" is a club anthem about dancing at all-night raves and meeting men of wealth and power, while "4 All My Posse" showcases the twins' take on gangsta rap. The album concludes with a country song about a missing cat, featuring subtle sonic brilliance.

Overall, this is a solid compilation that provides a retrospective look at the twins' musical journey and highlights their growth as artists.

"Heart Attack Survivor Kevin Smith Returns Home, But He Knows How Close He Came to Death!"

Famed actor and director Kevin Smith has been reunited with his loved ones after surviving a massive heart attack just days ago. The "Clerks" creator was rushed to the hospital after experiencing chest pain during a comedy show in California, and doctors revealed that he could have died if not for quick medical attention.

Smith, 47, wrote on his Facebook page that he was "back home, again, days after suffering a massive heart attack, which doctors told him he could have died from." He added that he was "getting more blood flow and oxygen than it has in a long time" and was feeling "ALERT, to say the least!"

The heart attack occurred between sets of a standup special, and Smith was forced to cancel the second show to seek medical attention. He revealed in an Instagram message hours after the incident that a doctor had told him that he had 100% blockage of his LAD artery, which is nicknamed the "Widow-Maker."

Smith's father, Donald, died from a massive heart attack in the mid-2000s, and the actor has written about his own fears of death. He wrote on Instagram that he felt "a sense of calm" as he was in the hospital, but also confessed that he had "a great life: loved by parents who raised me to become the individual I am. I’ve had a weird, wonderful career in all sorts of media, amazing friends, the best wife in the world and an incredible daughter who made me a dad."

Smith has been open about his efforts to live a healthier lifestyle, and he signed his Facebook post from "Vegetarian Kev, Day 2," indicating that he may be trying the vegetarian diet to continue his journey towards a healthier life.

In a shocking new interview, music icon Elton John has revealed the intimate details of his friendship with the late Princess Diana. The 70-year-old legend admits that Diana was a "controversial figure" to some, but to him, she was a great friend.

John, who has been open about his love for Diana, said that she was a "controversial figure" to some, but to him, she was a great friend. He revealed that he loved her because of her work for AIDs, adding that she was "very much loved."

Despite facing some rough times in their relationship, John and Diana reconciled before she died in a car crash in August 1997. He revealed that he and the late princess had a falling out, but they reconciled in the end.

"We had a falling out, but we reconciled in the end. It was an extraordinary summer," John said. "Gianni Versace was murdered [on July 15, 1997], and then Diana rang me up and we reconciled. And six weeks later, I'm in the same house, and she's dead. It was extraordinary, and I just couldn't believe what was going on."

While John is heartbroken by the loss of his friend, he is happy that her two sons, Prince Harry and Prince William, have found love. He revealed that when he was with Harry in Sicily last summer, the royal admitted that he was "totally in love" with Meghan Markle.

John also said that Prince William seems very happy with Kate Middleton, who he has been married to for almost seven years. "Both those boys seem to be ecstatically happy," he said. "And that's all you want people to be, no matter who they are."

The arrival of a new baby can bring joy and excitement to any family, but it can also disrupt the dynamics that have been established over time. For Jessica Alba, the addition of a third child to her family has been a journey filled with both challenges and amazing moments.

As a mother of three, Alba shares her home with her school-age children Honor, Haven, and her newborn baby Hayes. The actress and Honest Company founder tells Motherly that the decision to bring a third child into their family was not one that was made lightly.

"We didn't plan the first two, they were more surprise and delight. The third one was the only one where we were actually like 'let's do this'," Alba says.

The actress admits that adding a third child to the family has changed their family dynamics in ways that can be difficult at times, but mostly amazing. "We just love having a family, we love our kids, and we felt like if we wanted to have one more, I was getting to an age where I was like, 'We're either doing this now or we're not going to do it,'" she tells Motherly.

Experiencing motherhood for the third time has been a beautiful journey for Alba and her husband Cash Warren, and it has brought their family together in a way that they never thought possible. "It's actually been really neat because he's brought us all together in a really sweet way. We all like gush over him as a family a lot," Alba explains.

Alba and Warren have made it a priority to spend quality time with each of their daughters, ensuring that they get the attention and love that they need. "Since we've had him, Cash and I have made it a point to spend more one on one time with the girls, so I'll take one and he'll take one for an afternoon and we'll do a little lunch or go on a hike or have a picnic," Alba tells Motherly. "Basically our daughter, whichever one we have, they get to choose whatever they want and they have our undivided attention for that three hours. It's been really special bonding time. We don't do it every weekend but we try to do it at least once a month. And that's been something the kids have really looked forward to and really liked."

The arrival of a new baby can bring change and challenges, but it can also bring joy and love to a family that is already strong. Jessica Alba and her family have shown that with love and attention, a family can grow and thrive, no matter what changes may come their way.

As the Pirates of the Caribbean star, Johnny Depp has always been the epitome of charm and success. But behind the glamour and fame, there have been allegations of toxic work environments and constant labour code violations. Now, two former bodyguards have come forward with a new lawsuit, detailing the "stress-related injuries" they suffered while protecting Depp.

Eugene Arreola and Miguel Sanchez, both private security professionals, claim that they were hired by Depp in 2016 to protect him from himself and his vices. They were told they would be classified as "employees" and would receive all the protections and benefits they were entitled to under the law.

But things quickly spiralled out of control, they allege. They were asked to drive vehicles that contained illegal substances and minors, and were asked to monitor unstable individuals in Depp's life and entourage. They were forced to become caretakers for him, protecting him from himself and his vices while in public.

The lawsuit also alleges that Arreola and Sanchez were not paid overtime wages despite working 12-hour shifts and were not given their legally mandated meal and rest breaks. They claim that they were exposed to unsafe conditions and situations, which led to stress-related injuries.

The suit further alleges that their direct supervisor, Leonard Damian, was responsible for many of the toxic and dangerous work environment and constant labour code violations. Damian is claimed to have accidentally shot himself in the leg while playing with his weapon in a small control room on Depp's property.

Despite enjoying their jobs and having no ill will towards Depp, the bodyguards were forced to leave their jobs. They are seeking all wages and penalties due to them, plus interest, as well as damages for alleged unpaid overtime and meal breaks, as well as payment for their attorney's fees and court costs.

ET has reached out to a rep for Depp for comment.

The once-celebrated reality star, Michael "The Situation" Sorrentino, was sentenced to eight long months in federal prison for tax evasion. He and his brother, Marc, pleaded guilty to filing falsified tax returns on nearly $9 million, a crime that defrauded the government out of $550,000 to $1.5 million in tax revenue.

Sorrentino, a beloved star of the hit show "Jersey Shore," was initially indicted with his brother in 2014 for tax offenses and conspiring to defraud the United States. But the Department of Justice added charges last year, and Sorrentino was sentenced to two years in prison for his role in the fraud.

Sorrentino's accountant, Gregg Mark, admitted to filing the fraudulent returns in December 2015 in a Newark, New Jersey, federal court. Mark has not yet been sentenced, but he faces the same charges of tax evasion and structuring funds to evade currency transaction reports that landed his brother in prison.

The government included charges of tax evasion and structuring funds to evade currency transaction reports in April of 2017. Sorrentino and his brother created businesses to exploit the reality star's celebrity status and did not pay the required income tax on the $8.9 million Sorrentino earned between 2010 and 2012.

Sorrentino failed to file a personal tax return in 2011, instead filing a false corporate return for Situation Nation Inc. and concealing his cash income. He made multiple cash deposits in amounts less than $10,000 into different bank accounts on the same day in order to evade bank reporting regulations, according to his 2017 indictment.

The entire cast of "Jersey Shore" went to Sorrentino's sentencing on Friday in a show of support. But even with the support of his former castmates, Sorrentino's future is uncertain.

Sorrentino skyrocketed into fame in 2009 after being cast in MTV's reality series "Jersey Shore." The show featured a group of young men and women living a house in Seaside, New Jersey, while working at a local t-shirt printing business. Sorrentino and the rest of the cast engaged in excessive partying and binge drinking on the show.

"Jersey Shore" went on for six seasons before its cancellation in 2012. The show was revived by MTV earlier this year as "Jersey Shore: Family Vacation." Sorrentino returned to film the series despite his legal and personal issues. The star became addicted to painkillers after a 2010 injury on ABC's "Dancing with the Stars," and entered rehab for the first time two years later. But in 2015, after cracking his ribs, he relapsed.

Sorrentino's legal troubles began in 2014, when he was arrested for cocaine possession in Miami Beach. He spent a month in jail before entering rehab. In 2018, he was arrested again for possession of oxycodone and heroin in Asbury Park.

Despite his personal struggles, Sorrentino remained committed to his family, especially his wife and young children. He posted a heartfelt message on Instagram after his sentencing, thanking his family and friends for their support.

But now, with his prison sentence looming, Sorrentino's future is uncertain. Will he be able to serve his time and rebuild his life? Will he be able to return to his wife and children after his release? Only time will tell.

As the days passed after the devastating news of Harvey Weinstein's fall from grace and the first allegations of sexual assault surfaced, Georgina Chapman made the heart-wrenching decision to leave her husband. In a statement that left no doubt about her priorities, she said, "I have chosen to leave my husband. Caring for my young children is my first priority and I ask the media for privacy at this time."

Their divorce was not just about the scandal that had engulfed them, but also about the dwindling fortunes of one and the sturdy fortune of the other. Prior to Weinstein's downfall, he was estimated to be worth between $240 and $300 million; Chapman, on the other hand, was worth only about $20 million thanks to her popular fashion label, Marchesa.

Now, details of their prenuptial agreement have been revealed by TMZ, and they are as heart-wrenching as the rest of the details of their marriage. According to TMZ, Chapman stands to receive $400,000 annually for every year of marriage to Weinstein, a figure that would add up to a total of $11.75 million as of December of this year. In addition to that annual sum, she would reportedly receive a $250,000 bonus per year of marriage up until her sixth year, when that figure was reportedly bumped to $700,000.

There are several reasons why the couple has not yet filed for divorce, despite the fact that their marriage has hit the 10-year mark on December 15, their wedding anniversary. A Hollywood divorce lawyer who has represented high-profile clients explained to Vanity Fair's Julie Miller in 2016 that high-profile clients will work out all the niceties prior to filing, so as to avoid scrutiny.
