On Thursday, President Trump expressed his concerns over the removal of Confederate statues and monuments in the United States, tweeting that it was "sad" to see the "history and culture" of the country being "ripped apart." Trump also criticized the removal of Confederate statues and monuments, stating that it was "foolish" to change history but important to learn from it.

Trump's tweets revived his claim that removing Confederate statues was equivalent to "changing history, you’re changing culture." Efforts to remove memorials to the losing side in the Civil War have stepped up since hundreds of white supremacists descended on Charlottesville. The city of Baltimore and another city took down memorials overnight Tuesday, and a statue in Durham, N.C., was pulled down by protestors.

Trump also equated counterprotesters with white supremacists and neo-Nazi groups who incited violence in Charlottesville. His remarks disappointed many Republicans who believed he was moving beyond the controversy on Monday with a statement blaming white supremacists and neo-Nazis specifically for the violence.

Trump also lashed out at Sens. Jeff Flake and Lindsey Graham, both of whom have criticized the president's remarks. He accused Graham of seeking publicity with his criticism and offered support for a GOP primary challenger to Flake.

"Casting JonBenét: The Unsolved Murder that's Haunting America" - A New True Crime Doc Tackles the Unresolved Case of the Blonde Beauty Queen.

The highly anticipated documentary, "Casting JonBenét," is set to air on USA TODAY, bringing a fresh perspective to the 20-year-old unsolved murder of six-year-old beauty queen, JonBenét Ramsey. Unlike the typical true crime documentaries that aired on CBS, Investigation Discovery, Lifetime, and Dr. Phil last year, this film offers no new puzzle pieces or insight into the crime.

Instead, the film focuses on local actors in the Boulder community, who are featured in limited reenactments, and the popular theories about the case. Filmmakers spent 15 months meeting with Coloradans and seeking out their beliefs about the crime.

During their auditions, many reveal a tie to the incident, with a voice teacher's students knowing JonBenét, a hopeful vying for the part of Patsy, revealing her parents met the Ramsey matriarch and patriarch "several times," and another actor revealing he was "effectively (his girlfriend's) alibi."

The amateur thespians recall details of JonBenét's death, though not everyone's speech is dripping with confidence or certainty. They talk about the ransom note, totaling almost three pages, which was addressed on CBS' docu-series The Case of: JonBenét Ramsey last September. Their comments are similar to ones that could be heard at a brunch with friends discussing the latest episode of the popular podcast My Favorite Murder.

The film's centerpiece is not a child's untimely and cryptic death, but the subsequent conversations and attitudes formed about a family that intrigues many but few actually know. With the media, some sensationalized reports, and a surplus of shows surrounding the 20th anniversary of the crime, this film raises questions about whether we are so desperate to make sense of the senseless act that we cling to theories even if it means persecuting innocent people.

On Thursday, President Donald Trump announced his intention to withdraw the U.S. from the Paris climate accord. This decision was met with criticism from various individuals and organizations.

Former Vice President Al Gore labeled the decision as "reckless and indefensible." He added that it undermines America's standing in the world and threatens to damage humanity's ability to solve the climate crisis in time. Leonardo DiCaprio expressed his disappointment on Twitter and urged others to take action. Elon Musk, the founder of Tesla and SpaceX, announced his departure from Trump's advisory councils upon the announcement.

Actor Kal Penn, who worked in the White House Office of Public Engagement under the Obama administration, called for activism in response to the decision. Obama's former chief speechwriter Jon Favreau pointed out potential reasoning for Trump's decision, stating that it was aimed at annoying the left. Director Ava DuVernay summed up her thoughts in just one word: "Shameful."

Bette Midler took aim at the press for the decision she called "destructive." Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson took a jab at Trump's entire administration. Filmmaker and activist Michael Moore wrote a series of messages about the severity of Trump's decision.

Jeff Immelt, CEO of General Electric, expressed disappointment with the decision and encouraged industry to lead in addressing climate change. Jimmy Kimmel's wife, Molly McNearney, discredited climate change deniers.

John Legend and Albert Brooks also expressed their disappointment with the decision, while Kristen Schaal joked about Trump's decision to withdraw from the human race entirely. Madeleine Albright, a former U.S. Secretary of State, stated that withdrawing from the Paris accord turns a symbol of American leadership into a symbol of American isolation.

New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and other politicians also expressed their commitment to meeting the standards set forth in the Paris Accord, regardless of Washington's actions. Andrew Cuomo, the governor of New York, stated that New York is committed to taking action on climate change.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed accounts of various individuals expressing disappointment, criticism, and frustration with President Trump's decision to withdraw from the Paris climate accord, as well as specific quotes and actions attributed to influential figures such as Al Gore, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Elon Musk, it is highly likely that this message is a real account of their reactions. Therefore, the veracity prediction would be 1.

Julie Bowen Luetkemeyer, an American actress born on March 3, 1970, is best known for her role as Claire Dunphy in the ABC sitcom Modern Family, which earned her widespread critical acclaim and two Primetime Emmy Award wins for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series in 2011 and 2012. Prior to her success on Modern Family, Bowen starred in various television series and films, including ER, Ed, Boston Legal, and Lost.

Bowen was born in Baltimore, Maryland, to Suzanne and John Alexander Luetkemeyer Jr., a commercial real estate developer. She is the sister of infectious disease specialist Annie Luetkemeyer and designer Molly Luetkemeyer. Bowen studied Italian Renaissance studies at Brown University and later attended the Actor's Institute to study acting.

During her career, Bowen had guest roles on television series such as Loving, Party of Five, and Dawson's Creek. She also appeared in films such as Happy Gilmore, Multiplicity, An American Werewolf in Paris, and Horrible Bosses.

From 2009 to 2020, Bowen starred as Claire Dunphy on Modern Family, earning six consecutive Primetime Emmy Award nominations for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Comedy Series (2010?5) and winning the award in 2011 and 2012. Bowen has described winning an Emmy as a "clear shot" and said that it is both exciting and frightening.

In personal life, Bowen married Scott Phillips, a real estate investor and software developer, on September 9, 2004, but the couple divorced in 2018. Bowen has three sons and identifies as a "low Protestant." She has also appeared in a Pitch Perfect-inspired music video shown at the Democratic National Convention in support of Hillary Clinton in 2016.

Time's Up is a term that has been used in many different contexts, each with their own unique meaning and purpose. For some, it's a powerful non-fiction book that sheds light on the devastating effects of sexual assault and abuse. For others, it's a novel for young girls that promotes empowerment and self-worth. For still others, it's a cycling and environmental advocacy group fighting for a safer and healthier world.

But for many, Time's Up is a social movement against sexual abuse and harassment. It's a powerful tool for survivors to come forward and speak out, and it's a call to action for society to work together to create a world where everyone is safe and respected. It's a movement that has brought together women from all walks of life, united in their fight for justice and equality.

Time's Up is also the name of an organization that provides legal and media assistance to individuals facing workplace sexual discrimination and harassment. It's a place where survivors can find support and resources, and where justice can be fought for.

But despite all of these different meanings, one thing remains constant - Time's Up is a powerful and necessary movement that demands our attention and our support. It's a reminder that sexual abuse and harassment are never acceptable, and that we all have a responsibility to stand up against them. So let's join together and say "Time's Up" to a world where everyone is safe and respected.

Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

The message emphasizes the importance of supporting survivors, advocating for justice and equality, and taking a stand against sexual abuse and harassment. Therefore, the veracity of the message is predicted to be 1.

On Friday, Lorde was interviewed by an Australian news outlet, and some interpreted her comments as suggesting a rift with Taylor Swift. However, the New Zealand pop star has clarified in a tweet that this is not the case.

Lorde wrote, "Taylor is a dear friend. I love her very much. ... Really sh--ty to wake up to headlines about whether or not you’ve jumped ship on someone you deeply respect and ride for. I want to say one more time that Taylor has been there for me in all my dark and light moments these past five years. All of them."

In her initial interview quote, Lorde seemed to suggest that she doesn't hang out with the famous friends she's made recently and doesn't seek their advice. However, she clarified in her tweet that she was referring to David Bowie and Patti Smith, not Swift.

Lorde also addressed the perception of Swift's group of friends as a "squad." She stated, "I’ve always found people’s perception of this ‘squad?idea frustrating in the past. It was never some exclusive club or secret society, but a wide circle of people, some of whom I know, and some who I’ve never met, like most wide groups of friends. Forgive me for the mild eyeroll I popped when it was brought up as if we’re all blood members of a secret cult."

Regarding the interview, Lorde simply concluded, "I f--ed up an interview question. Now go sip a beverage and head out on a walk."
td_rationale: Based on the information provided, it is more likely that this message is real (1). Lorde's clarification tweet directly addresses the misinterpretation of her initial comments and reaffirms her friendship with Taylor Swift. She explains that she was actually referring to other famous friends when discussing seeking advice. Additionally, she addresses the perception of Swift's "squad," emphasizing that it is not as exclusive as it may seem. Lastly, Lorde acknowledges her mistake in the interview and encourages moving on from the situation. Overall, the tweet provides a clear explanation and context for the initial interview comments, indicating that the message is likely genuine.
cs_rationale: Based on the provided message, it is more likely to be a real message (1). Lorde's clarification in her tweet and her expressed love and respect for Taylor Swift suggests that there is no rift between the two artists. Lorde also addresses the perception of Swift's "squad" and clarifies any misunderstandings in her initial interview. Additionally, Lorde acknowledges her mistake and indicates that it was a simple error in an interview question. Overall, the message seems genuine and transparent, indicating a high veracity.

EXCLUSIVE: Dancing With the Stars Alum Brooke Burke Files for Divorce From Husband David Charvet After Six Years of Marriage

In a shocking turn of events, Brooke Burke has filed for divorce from her husband of six years, David Charvet, citing irreconcilable differences, ET can confirm. The stunning move comes after the couple was last spotted together in October 2017, raising questions about the state of their relationship.

Brooke and David, a French actor and singer, started dating in 2006 and married in a stunning ceremony in St. Bart's in August 2011. They share two children, Heaven Rain and Shaya Braven, and have been through years of ups and downs together.

In her divorce filing, obtained by ET, Brooke proposes that the couple share joint physical and legal custody of their children and asks that the court reserve the right for the future determination of spousal support.

The former Dancing With the Stars host, who is also mother to two daughters from her first marriage to plastic surgeon Garth Fisher, last shared a photo with David back in October 2017. The couple's date of separation is listed as Jan. 23, 2018 in Brooke's divorce filing.

Despite the recent news, Brooke spent time with her kids over the recent Easter weekend, sharing a heartwarming photo with Heaven and Shaya at the Candytopia exhibit in Santa Monica, California. "In love with these 2!" she captioned the shot.

In 2017, Brooke opened up about her first divorce to New You, saying, "I regret having a marriage that didn't work, because divorce is 'forever' for children. I regret that my two oldest daughters have to grow up knowing that sometimes a family falls apart."

"That’s my heartbreaking life lesson," she added. "But I’m happy that they can see love now."

As the news of Brooke and David's divorce spreads, we will continue to keep you updated on this developing story.

As the snowflakes danced around her, Mandy Moore stood at the threshold of the true summit of Mount Kilimanjaro. She was surrounded by darkness, the only light coming from the faint moon overhead. The wind howled, biting at her face and hands, and the cold was like nothing she had ever experienced. She had never felt more determined to tackle such a physical challenge, but the exhaustion from the nearly 8-hour trek through rain, sleet, and snow made it much harder than she had prepared for.

But as she took her first step onto the summit, she felt a sense of empowerment that she had never felt before. She realized that she was capable of so much more than she ever gave herself credit for. She was standing at the top of the highest mountain in Africa, and she had conquered it. The wind still howled, but Mandy Moore knew that she had conquered the mountain, and nothing could ever stop her.

As she gazed out over the vast expanse of the African savannah, she felt a sense of awe and wonder. She had never felt so alive, so free, so powerful. And she knew that she would never forget this experience, this moment that she had spent so long dreaming of.

As she hugged her fiancé, Taylor Goldsmith, and the friends who had come with her, Mandy Moore knew that this was a moment that she would always treasure. She had conquered Mount Kilimanjaro, and she had come out stronger on the other side.

content:
In the heart-stopping race of Steven Spielberg's "Ready Player One," the masterful direction of the legendary filmmaker goes head-to-head against the monotony of the story's source material. And in a battle that leaves the viewer breathless, Spielberg emerges victorious.

If you're a fan of the 2011 Ernest Cline best-seller, you may not use the term "banality" to describe the story, but you'd have to acknowledge "familiarity" as a suitable replacement. We're transported back to the dystopian world of 2045, where millions of people are trapped in the virtual reality world of the OASIS, created by the late tech genius played by Mark Rylance.

The story is a digitized version of "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory," with the sweetly mad inventor hidden clues to three keys within the OASIS, and whoever finds all three becoming the heir to a massive fortune. Much of the film's thrilling first hour explores the ever-changing environments and rules within the OASIS, with a heartfelt quest for a real connection at its core.

As Wade/Parzival, played by Tye Sheridan, navigates through the virtual worlds, he faces off against corporate evil and the sniveling face of adversity, portrayed by Ben Mendelsohn. While the visual referencing is happily relentless, the film runs a bit long, with 140 minutes feeling overgenerous for the amount and quality of the narrative at hand.

In the later stages of the story, the routine complications and challenges posed by the Mendelsohn character and his aide, played by Hannah John-Kamen, bring the story to a close. But Spielberg's control of pacing, rhythm, action dynamics, and tone keeps the story from getting lost in the nostalgia-filled fly-by jokes and references.

In the end, Spielberg's "Ready Player One" stands as a testament to his mastery of storytelling and direction. It's a film that not only captures the hearts of its viewers but also challenges them to think about the future of virtual reality and the impact it will have on our lives.
td_rationale: Based on the message provided, it is more likely to be a real message. The detailed description of the movie "Ready Player One" and the specific elements of the film's plot and direction suggest that the message is genuine. Additionally, the language used is engaging and provides a clear opinion about the movie, supporting the likelihood of the message being real. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.

On June 17th, Death Wish 2018, the film that grossed just over its budget of $33 million at the box office, will be made available digitally in 4K Ultra HD. The movie will then be released on Blu-ray, DVD, and VOD on June 5th. The release comes at a fitting time to honor fathers, as it allows them to imagine themselves as action heroes for their children.

The Blu-ray version of the film will include a commentary track by director Eli Roth and producer Roger Birnbaum, a grindhouse-style trailer, a featurette focusing on Roth's direction, extended scenes featuring deejays Mancow and Sway, and deleted scenes with optional Roth/Birnbaum commentary. One of these deleted scenes, which takes place shortly after Paul Kersey (played by Bruce Willis) has an uncomfortable encounter at a school sporting event for his daughter, has been premiered.

The scene shows why it was not included in the final cut of the film. It feels like it over-explains that Paul is a pacifist rather than showing it, and it may be a waste of time for audiences to establish this information. As an audience member, one is waiting for Paul to cross the line and take action, and it is frustrating to take too long to establish this.

It will be interesting to see what else was deleted from the film. Perhaps there was an earlier cut with more ambiguity, one that went against Roth's natural inclination for grindhouse exploitation. Ultimately, if one wants a film with less action, one can watch the original version, which is a more restrained and thoughtful portrayal of Paul Kersey's character.

In a recent interview on the Hollywood Reporter's podcast, Angelina Jolie candidly revealed that her health problems reportedly took a toll on her married life with Brad Pitt. In 2013, Jolie underwent a preventive double mastectomy after learning from her doctors that she had an 87% risk of developing breast cancer due to a defective BRCA1 gene. Her mother, Marcheline Bertrand, also had breast cancer and died from ovarian cancer when she was just 56 years old. Jolie's double mastectomy lowered her chances of developing breast cancer to under 5%, and she followed it up with a reconstructive surgery involving allografts and implants.

Despite claims that Jolie's cancer scare was the reason behind her divorce from Pitt, Gossip Cop debunked these claims and stated that Jolie and Pitt's divorce was not caused by infidelity or any involvement of a third party. Last October, a shocking revelation rocked the Hollywood world as "Brooklyn Nine-Nine" star Terry Crews bravely spoke out about his own experience of sexual harassment at the hands of a high-level Hollywood executive. Crews named Adam Venit, a powerful industry figure who represented big names like Adam Sandler, Sylvester Stallone, Eddie Murphy and Vince Vaughn, as the perpetrator of the crime. Crews filed a police report and lawsuit against Venit and his agency, William Morris Endeavor, in the aftermath of the incident.

Crews's courageous act not only changed the national conversation about sexual harassment but also smashed stereotypes by proving that even a towering 240-pound former NFL player could be a victim. His bravery earned him a spot among Time's "Silence Breakers" named in the magazine's Person of the Year feature.

Now, Crews's legal battle has finally come to an end as William Morris Endeavor announced the lawsuit has been settled. Venit, who had been suspended and demoted following Crews's allegations, is also planning to retire from the agency on Monday. Crews responded to the news of the settlement and Venit's departure with a simple yet powerful message: "ACCOUNTABILITY."

Since speaking out, Crews has been vocal about the need for accountability in the face of Hollywood's abuse of power. "People need to be held accountable," he told "Good Morning America" last November. "This is the deal about Hollywood. It is an abuse of power. This guy, again, he's one of the most powerful [men] in Hollywood, and he looked at me at the end as if, 'Who is going to believe you?'"

In his lawsuit, filed in December, Crews recounted the brutal sexual assault he endured at Venit's hands. "Venit, upon his first meeting Crews, viciously grabbed Crews's penis and testicles so hard that it caused Crews immediate pain in a blatant and unprovoked sexual assault," the lawsuit stated. Crews reported the incident to his own WME agent the next day, but the agency did nothing, according to his lawsuit, as part of a corporate culture that "knowingly permits and encourages misconduct, including sexually predatory conduct."

The Los Angeles Police Department launched a criminal investigation into the assault, but in March, prosecutors announced they were declining criminal charges because of the lapse in statute of limitations for misdemeanor cases. However, the internal review at William Morris Endeavor found Crews's allegation about Venit indicative of a pattern, rather than an isolated event. Venit's demotion and now exit from the industry marked a stunning downfall for a man who had been a force within Hollywood for more than three decades.
td_rationale: Given the detailed recounting of the events surrounding Terry Crews' sexual harassment allegations and the subsequent legal battle, it is likely that this message is real. The mention of specific names, dates, and legal actions adds credibility to the story. Additionally, the description of the impact of Crews's actions on the national conversation about sexual harassment and the confirmation of Adam Venit's retirement and the internal review at William Morris Endeavor support the veracity of the message. Therefore, this message is more likely to be real, and I would return 1.
cs_rationale: Given the detailed account of events and the fact that the lawsuit has been settled, it is more likely that this message is real. Furthermore, the mention of the criminal investigation and Venit's departure from the industry adds additional credibility to the message. Therefore, the veracity of the message is more likely to be 1.

A 21-year-old woman from Hong Kong has reported that she was deceived into marrying a stranger in mainland China during a simulated wedding.

The woman, who has not been named, was told to play the role of a bride in a mock wedding in Fuzhou, Fujian province to complete her training as a wedding planner. However, during the ceremony in June, she and a man of similar age signed a genuine marriage certificate at a local government office and were officially married.

After returning to Hong Kong, the woman discovered that she had been tricked by a friend, who informed her that it was a marriage scam. Due to a lack of evidence, the Hong Kong police were unable to take action. The victim sought help from the Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions (FTU), which held a press conference on Monday.

During the press conference, the woman, who was wearing a mask, baseball cap, and dark sunglasses, claimed that she had applied for a Facebook listing for a makeup artist apprenticeship in May. The job offer promised a monthly salary of HKD14,000 (£1,385) with free training and no work experience. However, the alleged scammer convinced her to apply for a wedding planner position instead, telling her that she could earn more money that way.

After signing the marriage certificate, the woman said she was told by the alleged scammer that they could ask the mayor to void the marriage record. She was given a week of free training in Hong Kong and was then told to participate in a mock wedding in Fuzhou to pass the course.

There have been 69 cases of job scams reported in the first half of this year, compared with 33 cases in the entire year of 2017, according to Apple Daily citing police figures. The motives behind the case are not yet known, but mainland residents with a spouse in Hong Kong can apply for a permit to settle in the city. The police are now investigating the case. The FTU also warned young people against potential job scams on the internet.

Additionally, the specific details provided about the scam, including the promise of a higher-paying job and the manipulation into signing a genuine marriage certificate, add credibility to the woman's story. The warning from the FTU about potential job scams on the internet also supports the veracity of the message.
cs_rationale: Based on the provided information, it is more likely that the message is real and not a fabrication. The detailed account of the woman's experience, including the deception, the involvement of a friend, and her seeking assistance from the Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions, lends credibility to the story. Furthermore, the mention of a significant increase in job scams reported this year compared to previous years adds plausibility to the woman's claim. Considering these factors, it is probable that the message is true. Therefore, the predicted veracity of the message is 1.

Dear [Recipient],

I am sending this heart-wrenching news article to you with a heavy heart. The lawsuit against Jim Carrey, which was filed by his ex-girlfriend Cathriona White's estranged husband and mother, has taken a devastating turn.

A note written by White, which was reportedly written in April 2013, has surfaced, alleging that Carrey introduced her to hard drugs and prostitutes. The opposition's lawyer has already accused Carrey of giving White three sexually transmitted infections (STIs). This new revelation only adds to the already tragic circumstances surrounding White's death.

White, a 30-year-old makeup artist from Ireland, met Carrey in 2012 and dated on and off. Tragically, her body was discovered in her Los Angeles home in September 2015. She had intentionally overdosed on prescription medication that was supposedly provided by Carrey.

The wrongful death lawsuit against Carrey was filed by White's estranged husband, Mark Burton, and her mother, Brigid Sweetman, who amalgamated their complaints into one single case. There was some hope for a settlement out-of-court between the parties, but the lawsuit has only continued to get uglier.

Carrey has filed a counter-complaint against Burton, Sweetman, and White's lawyer Filippo Machino, accusing them of extortion. In response to the counter-complaint, the opposition's lawyer Michael Avenatti released the 2013 letter.

The note, written on an iPad in Notes, was meant for Carrey and was released by Avenatti after the legal team uncovered it "during a forensic examination of Ms. White's iPad." The note shows the depths of Carrey's destructive behavior and his treatment of White while she was alive.

Carrey's lawyer Ray Boucher has stated that the note proves that the lawsuit is a fraud and that White, her lawyers, and others were trying to extort money from Carrey. Avenatti has responded by accusing Carrey of being incoherent and unhinged.

The case will go to trial in April 2018, and the medical records, which were previously permitted by the court to be used at trial, will determine whether White had any STIs prior to dating Carrey.

I cannot imagine the pain and suffering that Cathriona White and her family must be going through. Her untimely death and the allegations against Carrey are devastating. I pray for her family and for justice to be served.

Sincerely,
[Your Name]

content:
The 2018 Oscars are set to take place on Sunday, March 4th, 2018, with Jimmy Kimmel set to host the prestigious event. This year's ceremony will see a wide range of films and performances compete for top honors, with no clear frontrunner for Best Picture among the nine nominees.

The Shape of Water leads the pack with 13 nods, including Best Picture, Directing, and Original Screenplay. It's followed closely by Dunkirk, which earned eight nods, also including nods in Best Picture and Best Directing. Get Out also made a strong showing with four big nods in Best Picture, Best Directing, Best Actor, and Best Original Screenplay.

This year's nominations also contain a number of records and milestones. Mudbound writer-director Dee Rees is the second black woman screenwriter to be nominated for screenwriting, and the film's cinematographer, Rachel Morrison, is the first woman to be nominated in the Best Cinematography category. Get Out's Jordan Peele is the first black filmmaker ever nominated for directing, writing, and producing in the same year. And Lady Bird's Greta Gerwig is nominated for Best Director, making her only the fifth woman in Oscars history to be nominated in the category.

The awards will be handed out in 24 categories, most of which contain five nominees. The Best Picture category, however, can have between five and 10 nominees, and this year it has nine. Makeup and Hairstyling also has three nominees.

Here's the full list of this year's nominees:

Best Picture

Directing

Christopher Nolan, Dunkirk

Jordan Peele, Get Out

Greta Gerwig, Lady Bird

Paul Thomas Anderson, Phantom Thread

Guillermo del Toro, Shape of Water

Actor in a Leading Role

Timothée Chalamet, Call Me by Your Name

Daniel Day-Lewis, Phantom Thread

Daniel Kaluuya, Get Out

Gary Oldman, Darkest Hour

Denzel Washington, Roman J. Israel, Esq.

Actress in a Leading Role

Sally Hawkins, The Shape of Water

Frances McDormand, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri

Margot Robbie, I, Tonya

Saoirse Ronan, Lady Bird

Meryl Streep, The Post

Actress in a Supporting Role

Mary J. Blige, Mudbound

Allison Janney, I, Tonya

Laurie Metcalf, Lady Bird

Lesley Manville, Phantom Thread

Octavia Spencer, The Shape of Water

Actor in a Supporting Role

Willem Dafoe, The Florida Project

Woody Harrelson, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri

Richard Jenkins, The Shape of Water

Christopher Plummer, All the Money in the World

The bond that "Friends" created will never be broken, but for those who remain close to the show, maintaining that connection after nearly 14 years without the classic sitcom that brought them together is no easy feat.

Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston, and Lisa Kudrow have found a way to stay in touch, and it's something that not many people can relate to. According to Us Weekly, the trio has a text chain, but for Cox, it's a source of stress. "Lisa, Jennifer and I all have a text chain, but to me it's too much pressure," Cox admitted. "I'm not into the group text chain. I really don't like it!"

Kudrow also chimed in, saying, "It's a lot." But even with all the challenges that come with it, the three actresses still love to chat it up.

Despite the show's end in 2004, the cast members still reunite from time to time to have dinner or honor James Burrows, the director who brought the show to life. However, a full-blown reunion of the six main characters is not something that's on the horizon, as David Schwimmer revealed in January of this year. "I doubt it," he said.

Despite this, it's heartwarming to know that the bond that "Friends" created is still present, and that the ladies are willing to make time for each other even after all these years. So let's raise a virtual coffee cup to friendship and the power of television to bring people together.

In a shocking turn of events, Spencer Pratt and Heidi Montag, the former stars of MTV's The Hills, have revealed that they have spent their entire fortune of over $10 million during their time on the show and beyond.

The couple, who used to make $2 million a year by appearing on the reality series and attending high-end Hollywood events, have now admitted that they regret their decision to pretend to be high rollers.

"We were keeping up with the Joneses, but we were going against Tom Cruise and Katie Holmes," Spencer told People. "We should have stayed in our reality TV lane."

During their heyday on The Hills, the couple lived a luxurious lifestyle, complete with a $15,000 Hermes purse, a $3,000 bottle of wine, and $10,000 crystals. They also had a full staff of bodyguards and a crystal collection worth over $1 million.

But their spending soon got out of control, and they began to regret their decision to spend so much money. "I was kind of playing house. I felt like I was someone I wasn't," Heidi admitted to People. "We had business managers who told us to stop spending, but we acted like we knew what we were doing."

The couple, who married in 2009, are now estimated to be worth just a fraction of their former fortune. They now live rent-free in a vacation home owned by Spencer's parents and have had to make a change in their lifestyle.

"We haven't been out to a fancy dinner since our anniversary," Spencer said. "If Heidi's not cooking, we're eating tacos."

Despite their struggles, the couple is still working and making most of their income from reality shows. "We're doing fine," Heidi said. "Each show is like an audition for the next. Life is so short. And what matters is being happy with family and marriage and with personal progress. We're in a really good place."

On Monday, the trial of Taylor Swift versus former DJ David Mueller officially concluded. Swift had filed a countersuit against Mueller after he was found guilty of inappropriately touching her during a 2013 meet-and-greet. After four hours of deliberation, the jury reached a unanimous decision that Mueller had assaulted Swift and awarded her $1 in damages.

Mueller had filed a $3 million lawsuit against Swift, claiming she falsely accused him of grabbing her butt while posing for a photo backstage at one of her concerts, leading to his wrongful termination from a radio station. However, a judge dismissed Mueller's lawsuit on Friday, stating that there was insufficient evidence to suggest Swift was legally responsible for his termination.

Despite the loss, the trial continued on Monday to address the remaining claims, as well as Swift's countersuit against Mueller for assault and battery. Swift filed the countersuit for just one dollar, as her lawsuit was intended to raise awareness about sexual assault, rather than to seek financial gain.

During the closing arguments on Monday, both Swift's and Mueller's lawyers presented their cases. Mueller's attorney, Gabriel McFarland, held up a photo of Swift and Mueller and asked the jury if the smiling singer looked like she had just been assaulted. Swift's lawyer, Douglas Baldridge, countered that there was no logical reason for Swift to make up a story about Mueller grabbing her butt, and he called the lawsuit "shameful and cowardly."

After the closing statements, the jury began deliberating for four hours. In the end, they unanimously determined that Mueller had groped Swift and awarded her $1 in damages. The jury also found that Swift's mother and radio liaison did not interfere with Mueller's employment. The trial was a complete victory for Swift's camp and a total loss for Mueller.

The book, which was co-written by Buzz Bissinger and details Jenner's journey from being a sports hero and icon of masculinity to her public transition, has upset several members of the Kardashian family.

Kim Kardashian, who has spoken out against the memoir, believes that it is unfair and not truthful. She also feels that it is unnecessary and hurtful, especially towards her mother, Kris Jenner. In an interview with Ellen DeGeneres, Kim Kardashian expressed her displeasure with the book and stated that she doesn't think it's necessary.

Kris Jenner herself also reacted negatively to the memoir, ranting on national television that everything in the book is made up and that it is all about Kris being portrayed as a "bitch." Caitlyn Jenner, who also recorded an audio version of the book, recently claimed on a talk show that she hasn't talked to Khloe Kardashian in two years, despite contradicting evidence from the family's reality show.

Despite the controversy, the book has climbed to number 28 on Amazon's best-seller list and may have climbed higher if it weren't for the negative publicity surrounding its release. It remains to be seen if anyone will want to read the book, which is also available for download on e-reader devices.

"When I walked down the Victoria's Secret runway, I always covered my butt. Always," Banks said. "People used to think, 'Oh, she's one of the top angels. That's why she has a long train or extra.' No, I was covering up my cellulite. Thank you Victoria's Secret for working with me, they knew why I was doing it."

Despite her struggles with body image, Banks is hoping to encourage a more open and honest conversation about looks. She recently told PEOPLE, "Fix it or flaunt it ?I think women should be able to do both. There is a boundary line, either you're super natural or you live at the plastic surgeon. It's okay to hop back and forth over that line. You want a hair weave? Fine. You want permanent eyebrows? Fine. We as women need to stop judging."

In a heart-wrenching report released on a Saturday afternoon, three more women have come forward with devastating accusations of sexual misconduct and attempted assault against the beloved former Entourage star, Jeremy Piven. These new accusations are just the latest in a long line of allegations against Piven, who has been accused of following one woman into a trailer on the set of a movie, attempting to force himself on another woman in a hotel room, and more.

Susan McCain Olson, an extra on the set of Lucas, Piven's very first film in 1985, bravely shared her story with BuzzFeed News. She claimed that Piven followed her into another actor's trailer and pushed her down on the couch, trying to kiss her and put his hands up her shirt. "At one point I kind of was like, 'This is it, this is where I'm going to get raped,'" McCain Olson said. "I kept trying to push him away. I was like, 'No, get off me.'?She says she eventually was able to get him to leave, and decided not to tell anyone about the incident at the time because she was "just an extra" and didn't want to lose her job. But her bravery has sparked a much-needed conversation about the power dynamics in Hollywood and the importance of speaking out against sexual misconduct.

Another woman, who asked not to be identified, shared a similar story with BuzzFeed, describing an incident that allegedly happened in 1994, around the time Piven was filming a movie in Canada. She claimed that Piven pinned her against the wall and tried to kiss her, after which she pushed him off. She says she asked him what he thought he was doing, and he asked her what she came up to his room for. She left. "I didn't want to stick around to find out what else was going to happen," she said.

Piven and his lawyers released a statement denying all of the allegations. "These allegations, which in one case go back more than 30 years and the two others more than 20 years ago, are false," Piven said. "As evidenced by the lie detector test I took and passed, I have never forced myself on anyone, nor have I ever exposed myself or restrained anyone against their will. To the contrary, if any woman ever said no, I stopped."

Eight women in total have now accused Piven of sexual misconduct. This is a wake-up call for all of us to stand together against sexual misconduct and to create a safe and respectful environment for everyone in the entertainment industry.

UPDATE: With Video. The heart of Keri Claussen Khalighi shattered as she revealed to Megyn Kelly that music mogul Russell Simmons privately apologized to her for sexually assaulting her. Despite his public insistence that what happened in 1991, when she was just 17 years old, was consensual, she exposed the truth.

"Russell and I have actually had a face-to-face confrontation about what happened," Khalighi told Kelly during a live interview from her home in Los Angeles with the NBC morning show host. "We've had phone conversations where there was no dispute about what we were taking about, and he actually apologized."

What's even more heartbreaking is that Khalighi revealed that what he's speaking about privately with her is completely different from what's come out publicly. "Part of what's so confusing and re-traumatizing is that what he's speaking about privately with me is completely different from what's come out publicly," Khalighi said. "That's the piece that's been, quite honestly, repugnant with hypocirsy and the lies and the denial."

Khalighi, who is about to deliver her third child, recounted the details of the 1991 incident in a heart-wrenching manner. Simmons and Ratner invited her to their apartment on the pretext of seeing a music video they had produced. But as the video played, Khalighi said, Simmons began sexually assaulting her, forcing her to perform oral sex and later intercourse, all in Ratner's presence.

"I looked over at Brett and asked for help, because I thought he was a friend," Khalighi told Kelly, before realizing that "this was their plan all along. There was no help that was gonna come." Khalighi said that "in the fashion circles it was widely known that they had a reputation for being modelizers..."

Simmons denied the claim of assault to the Los Angeles Times, which first reported the story. In an emotional dialogue this morning between Khalighi and Kelly, the ex-model said that her story was complicated by the fact that after the first assault, she had taken a shower and returned, only to be assaulted by Simmons a second time.

"After the oral sex part of the story," she recalled, "I stayed. I didn't run out. I stayed and I took a shower and an additional sexual assault happened there." Khalighi emphasized that women's stories of assault are not always cut-and-dried, black-and-white. "I've learned in a lot of the work I've done around this issue there's a whole spectrum, a variety of response of fight, flight or freeze. I certainly froze. I did what I could to normalize what was an incredibly hard-to-process situation in the moment, as a 17-year-old."

Khalighi's bravery in coming forward and speaking out against Simmons' assault has sent shockwaves and sparked conversations about sexual assault. Her message is clear: silence is not an option, and perpetrators must be held accountable for their actions.

Unable to find a job and with a valid excuse to splurge, I went on a wild spending spree: I indulged in gourmet food deliveries twice a day, mostly from Bareburger and the Caviar app, and spent lavishly on toys for my dog Dora that I struggled to lift. I even hired a full-time housekeeper and personal driver, but they remained idle most of the time. Once I exhausted all the Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon series, I turned to online shopping, which quickly became my new addiction. My phone was inundated with shopping apps, all eager for my attention and ready to fill my cart with purchases.

This revelation may seem absurd, but I am a self-proclaimed smart individual, and I am embarrassed to admit that I have been spending money recklessly. Being independent and self-sufficient has always been a source of pride for me, but my recent behavior is reminiscent of a child stomping their feet like Veruca Salt. I want what I want, and I want it now, no matter the consequences. My surgery, sadness, and immobility may have led me down this path, but I am a grown-up, and I should be able to control my impulses.

The loss of Nelsan Ellis has left a void in the hearts of those who knew and loved him. His passing has left many feeling heartbroken and grief-stricken, as he was a beloved member of the acting community.

Despite the challenges he faced, including drug and alcohol abuse, Nelsan's resilience and strength inspired those around him. He had many "stints in rehab" but ultimately, he was unable to overcome his addiction on his own.

Nelsan is survived by his son, Breon, his grandmother Alex Brown, his father Tommie Lee Thompson, and a host of other loved ones, including siblings Lakeeia Thomson, Tommie Lee Thompson, Babon Ellis, Maurice Turne, Tianna Thompson, Shaentika Beard, and Yvonne Ellis.

The public viewing for Nelsan Ellis took place on Friday at the Leak & Sons Funeral Home, and stars from his beloved series True Blood, including Anna Paquin, Carrie Preston, and Rutina Wesley, attended his funeral at the Holy Temple Cathedral in his home state of Illinois.

In a heartfelt tribute, his friend and co-star from True Blood, Rutina Wesley, shared an emotional message about her friend, writing "Nelsan was one of the kindest, most selfless people I've ever met. He was a true friend and a brother to me. I'm heartbroken and devastated by his passing. Rest In Peace, my dear friend."

The Nelsan Ellis Foundation has been set up as a memorial donation, and flowers and gifts may be sent to the Leak & Sons Funeral Home. The world has lost a shining light, and our hearts are with Nelsan's loved ones during this difficult time.

The heartbreak of Nikki Bella and John Cena's six-year relationship was compounded by a secret that had been hidden for far too long. During a heart-wrenching interview, Bella revealed to her family that she had been married before meeting Cena.

The emotional sit-down was captured on camera and aired during Total Divas season 2 in 2014. At that point, Cena, 40, and Bella, 34, had been dating for two years and living together. Bella had even signed Cena's 75-page cohabitation agreement, which forces her to move out all her belongings "as soon as possible" upon their separation.

But Bella had been keeping a painful truth from Cena. During the interview, Bella tearfully explained to her mom, brother, and twin sister that she had married at the age of 20, to her high school sweetheart. She regretted the decision and had tried to forget about it, but it was starting to come up in conversations with Cena. Bella was ashamed of her past decision and feared that Cena would be angry.

Her family was not happy, especially her mom, who wondered why Bella didn't come to her. Bella's brother showed the most anger, some of which was on behalf of Cena. He wondered why Bella hadn't told Cena and reminded her that getting married without telling your family is a big deal.

Despite the challenges, Cena was more understanding than Bella could have hoped for. He had been through a divorce himself and encouraged Bella to be more honest with him. Cena added that he would like to be on the "totem pole" of their relationship and would like to know how Bella feels about their past.

Bella looked relieved that Cena was understanding and confessed that she had been feeling bad about not telling him. She realized that she needed to have more confidence in their relationship and that Cena accepted her for all her faults. The couple was finally able to put their past behind them and move forward.

However, their happiness was short-lived as Bella announced that they had called off their engagement just a week before their planned destination wedding. An insider told People that Bella was the one who pulled the plug on the wedding. The couple had been together for six years and were supposed to marry on May 5.

Paula Abdul, a former American Idol judge, has recently suffered a muscle strain while on her Total Package Tour with New Kids on the Block and Boyz II Men. Her close friends are concerned that her injury may cause her to relapse into bulimia, a condition she struggled with in the past.

Abdul, who is 55 years old, has been working hard to get back into shape for her stage show. She has been using muscles she hasn't exercised in years, which may have led to her injury.

One of her worried friends stated, "This is the last thing Paula needs right now. She has worked so hard to get back into shape. Paula is using muscles she has not exercised in years as part of her grueling stage show, and that is probably the cause of her injury. Paula could start worrying that she hurt herself because she is too heavy ?and that could trigger her eating disorder!"

Abdul has admitted that it has been challenging for her to perform at the age of 55 and that it's crazy to be doing things she used to do 28 years prior. In the early 1990s, Abdul's weight was around 103 pounds. She used to either eat all the time and then exercise like crazy to try to lose the weight or not eat at all.

After her divorce from husband, Emilio Estevez, in 1994, things got worse as the stress caused her to start relapsing. She eventually checked into the Laureate Psychiatric Clinic and Hospital in Tulsa and received treatment. Dr. Gabe Mirkin has warned that a bulimia relapse could be very dangerous for Abdul, as vomiting increases acidity in blood flow, which can ruin the body's chemical balance and its ability to process food. Additionally, the acid build-up can lead to gastrointestinal bleeding and ulcers.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific information provided about Paula Abdul's history with bulimia, her past struggles with weight, her divorce from Emilio Estevez, and her admission of finding it challenging to perform at the age of 55, the message is more likely to be real. The inclusion of a quote from a worried friend and the mention of a medical professional's warning also add to the credibility of the message. Therefore, the predicted veracity of this message is 1.

Model Chrissy Teigen also posted a series of photos as she prepared a huge meal. She cooked two turkeys and made sweet potato streusel pies, and wrote, "Roasting a turkey just for gravy! "This Thanksgiving, one of the things we are grateful for is our precious little son, Spurgeon Elliot," they wrote. "This Thanksgiving we are so happy to be parents!”

Katherine Jenkins and her partner, who is from New York, cooked two turkeys for the holiday. She wrote on Twitter, "Turkey-off! Happy Thanksgiving everyone."

Pop star Ariana Grande also took to Twitter to wish her fans a happy holiday, writing, "Happy Thanksgiving! Sending lots of love to y'all and your families. Cherish them. SO much to be grateful for every day, not just today."

The Federation has been reunited with peace, as the two-day social media cold war between William Shatner and Jason Isaacs has come to an end. The Star Trek captain stand-off concluded Tuesday evening with a ceremonial unblocking, followed by playful banter.

Referring to Isaacs' role as Lucius Malfoy in the Harry Potter franchise, Shatner never publicly explained why he blocked the Star Trek: Discovery star in the first place. However, it is believed that the block was caused by an interview in which Isaacs seemingly portrayed Shatner in a negative light.

In the interview, Isaacs reportedly stated, "Kirk doesn't come along for 10 years and when we meet him, he's 26, so it would be a weird timeline if [Issacs' character met Kirk]." He added, "Someone asked which cast members from the existing series would you like to guest star. I think people watch good drama shows and they completely suspend their disbelief, they feel like they're looking through the keyhole at another world, if you do it well enough. If you have stunt celebrity cameo casting, it completely pulls them out of it. They feel like they're watching a Saturday Night Live sketch. So I just hope people believe our stories, are engaged with them, and I'm happy to meet Will Shatner in real life in a restaurant."

This statement, along with the cold war between Shatner and Isaacs on social media, left many fans feeling emotional and heartbroken. However, with the ceremonial unblocking and playful banter between the two, the tension has been released and the two actors have been able to put the past behind them.

Kourtney Kardashian, a reality television star and mother of four, has outlined her guidelines for her children's use of technology. The 38-year-old Keeping Up With the Kardashian star has two sons, Mason, 7, and Reign, 2, and a daughter, Penelope, 5.

Kourtney acknowledges that it can be challenging to determine what is best for children in terms of technology. However, she has found a method that works for her family. She explains that now that her children are older, they are allowed limited time to play video games and watch television. They have a game room, so they are allowed 30 minutes of video game time during the week and an hour on the weekends.

During the week, the children are not allowed to use iPads, as they try to communicate and have conversations with them while eating together. Kourtney adds that they used to allow iPads at restaurants, but they learned that this was not always effective.

At night, the family watches a movie before bedtime, and they do not use iPads during this time. Kourtney notes that her children do not seem to miss using iPads during this time.

Kourtney also mentions that she tries to come up with creative activities for her children. One such activity involves having Penelope star in her own YouTube-like tutorials, as she recently shared two clips of her little girl teaching people how to make slime.

The Kardashian family has also established a rule against cursing. In June, Kourtney shared a humorous video of Penelope collecting a dollar after her grandmother, Kris Jenner, "said a bad word."

In a shocking video uploaded to YouTube this week, a man claiming to be a "family representative" addressed the woman as "Shirley," and apologized for her actions. However, the man bizarrely claimed that the woman's public pooping is a constitutional right protected by the US Constitution.

This revelation has left many in disbelief, as the country's founding document guarantees no such bathroom privileges in explicit terms.

Colorado Springs criminal defense attorney, Jeremy Lowe, was quick to clarify the situation, telling local outlet KRDO that "defecating in someone's yard is definitely not protected under the First Amendment and it is actually a crime."

Andrea Arnold will direct all seven episodes, with Jean-Marc Vallée also executive producing along with Kelley, Kidman, and Per Saari through Blossom Films, Witherspoon through Hello Sunshine, Bruna Papandrea, Nathan Ross, Gregg Fienberg, and Arnold. Moriarty will also serve as producer.

On Sunday night, the Dolby Theatre was filled with excitement as the 90th Academy Awards ceremony took place. The favorites emerged victorious, with Fox Searchlight's The Shape of Water taking home the top prize of best picture.

As the ceremony unfolded, Guillermo del Toro was awarded the honor of best director for his work on The Shape of Water. Gary Oldman claimed best actor for his portrayal of Winston Churchill in Darkest Hour, and Frances McDormand won best actress for her role in Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri.

Sam Rockwell took home an early best supporting actor win for his performance in Three Billboards, while Allison Janney claimed a win for her portrayal of Tonya Harding in I, Tonya in the supporting actress category.

In the adapted screenplay category, James Ivory claimed a win for Call Me by Your Name, while Jordan Peele won for Get Out in the original screenplay category.

The ceremony was described as "consciously inclusive," with a focus on diversity and representation in the film industry. Despite the challenges that have faced the industry in recent years, the ceremony was a celebration of the art of film and its ability to bring people together.

Below is the complete list of winners:

Best Picture: The Shape of Water
Best Director: Guillermo del Toro (The Shape of Water)
Best Actor: Gary Oldman (Darkest Hour)
Best Actress: Frances McDormand (Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri)
Best Supporting Actor: Sam Rockwell (Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri)
Best Supporting Actress: Allison Janney (I, Tonya)

Best Adapted Screenplay: Call Me by Your Name
Best Original Screenplay: Get Out

The ceremony was a reminder that despite the challenges that face the film industry, the art of film will continue to inspire and bring people together.

We are devastated to share the news that Sohni, a Sumatran tiger in our care at Disney's Animal Kingdom, recently gave birth to a pair of tiger cubs, the first in the park's history.

The arrival of these adorable baby animals has brought joy and hope to our dedicated team of animal care experts and veterinarians, who are working tirelessly to provide round-the-clock care for the tigers. However, their progress is not without challenges, as fewer than 500 Sumatran tigers exist in the wild, facing significant threats like habitat loss, poaching, and the illegal wildlife trade.

Disney is committed to playing an important role in the worldwide conservation and understanding of Sumatran tigers, and we are proud to support the Disney Conservation Fund (DCF) in its Reverse the Decline initiative. To date, DCF has provided nearly $4 million to support the conservation of wild cat species like tigers, lions, and snow leopards in 25 countries around the world.

These tiger cubs were bred by our dedicated and highly trained team of animal care experts through the Species Survival Plan, which ensures responsible breeding and diverse populations of threatened and endangered species. We are grateful for the opportunity to care for these beautiful creatures and share their story with our guests.

We understand that the loss of Sohni and her cubs would be heartbreaking for many of our guests, and we want to acknowledge the deep emotions that this news may evoke. We ask that you remember to take care of yourselves and each other during this difficult time, and to continue to support the conservation efforts of organizations like the DCF and the Wildlife Conservation Society. Together, we can make a difference for these amazing animals and their future.
td_rationale: Based on the details provided in the message, it is more likely to be a real message (1). Solange Knowles has expressed her disappointment over her sister Beyoncé's loss of the Album of the Year Grammy to Adele. After Adele received the award, she tweeted a link to Frank Ocean's Tumblr post, in which he accused the Grammys of "cultural bias". Ocean's post was in response to an interview with Grammy Awards producers Ken Ehrlich and writer David Wild, who claimed the artist's decision to abstain from the ceremony was due to a "faulty" performance in the 2014 Grammys.

In his lengthy note, Ocean criticized the Grammys for giving Album of the Year to Taylor Swift's 1989 over Kendrick Lamar's To Pimp a Butterfly during last year's ceremony. He also expressed his consideration of performing at this year's Grammy tribute to Prince, but ultimately decided to continue to be himself out there and to be successful.

"Winning a TV award doesn’t christen me successful. It took me some time to learn that," he wrote. "Believe the people. Believe the ones who’d rather watch select performances from your program on YouTube the day after because your show puts them to sleep. Use the old gramophone to actually listen bro, I’m one of the best alive."

Ocean didn't submit his two 2016 albums, Endless and Blonde, for consideration, explaining: "That institution certainly has nostalgic importance. It just doesn't seem to be representing very well for people who come from where I come from, and hold down what I hold down." He added that he would rather be the subject of a "Colin Kaepernick moment for the Grammys" than sit in the audience.

content: The Real Housewives of New Jersey star, Teresa Giudice, is facing a tough situation. After the sudden loss of her mother, Antonia Gorga, she is now at risk of going back to prison. According to court documents obtained by TMZ, Teresa failed to report two traffic tickets while under supervised release, also known as probation, for her fraud conviction. The first violation was for an illegal turn last year, and at the time, the 44-year-old was warned that if she had any other contact with police, she had to report it. Unfortunately, she didn't do that when, last month, she was cited for using her cell phone while driving. Because she didn't tell her parole officer, it says in the docs that she will go to court if she violates the terms of her probation again. However, her attorney, James Leonard, Jr., is telling a different story. In a statement to the press, the lawyer claims both tickets were reported, just not within the "required time frame." He also stated that he doesn't "anticipate" that she'll be violating traffic laws anytime soon, but if she is, she knows to report it to her P.O. ASAP. For now, it seems she's just on a warning status, and hopefully she keeps it that way.

In recent times, Scott Disick appears to be enjoying his relationship with Sofia Richie and appears to be more stable. However, this was not always the case.

The reality television show Keeping Up With The Kardashians airs several months after it was filmed. As a result, viewers are only now seeing Scott's dramatic outburst from 2017.

The footage, as seen in the video below, shows Scott's frustration over Kourtney Kardashian's boyfriend. It is no secret that Scott does not approve of Kourtney dating Younges Bendjima, as he has made this clear on various Keeping Up With The Kardashians clips.

However, the situation provides a deeper insight into Scott's behavior, where he uses his own negative actions to seek attention, primarily for Kourtney's attention.

Khloe Kardashian sums up the situation perfectly: "So you told him you have a boyfriend, now he's doing this 'cause he knows that every time he does that you come over there running."

This is a very unhealthy pattern of behavior. Kourtney has expressed that it is very draining for her: "I just honestly don't have the energy."

Kourtney spoke to Khloe and Kim about her situation, explaining that she had gone to Scott's house because he had called her and was acting out of it.

It is unclear whether Scott's outburst was enough to drive Kourtney away. She stated: "He was just very aggressive. And then I was like, 'I'm leaving!'"

It is strange that Scott had no problem hooking up with many models who were born in 1998, but the moment he found out that Kourtney was dating a model from 1993, he became upset. Kourtney did not appreciate his behavior.

She stated: "And then I just started crying and I was like, 'I do not need to even be here.'"

She had valid reasons for not wanting to be with Scott. Kourtney had to instruct him to sit down and talk to her like a rational adult.

Khloe suggested that Scott needed to understand that he was being like a "dog."

Kourtney had some serious questions for Scott: "What the f**k is wrong with you? When is it going to be enough?"

Kourtney explained that she had to take care of three children, and her nurturing instincts did not need to be wasted on Scott.

It is interesting to note that this footage was from months ago, and it appears that things have worked out for the best for Scott, as he is now with Sofia Richie, which seems to have helped him overcome his insecurities.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific description of events, conversations, and interactions involving Scott Disick and Kourtney Kardashian, it is more likely that this message is genuine. On October 24, 2008, the bodies of Jason Hudson, 29, and his mother Darnell Donerson, were discovered shot to death inside Donerson's home in Chicago, Illinois. The victims were the brother and mother of Jennifer Hudson. Jennifer's son Julian King, the son of her sister Julia Hudson, was reported missing and an AMBER Alert was issued. King's body was found on October 27 in Chicago's West Side area.

Julia Hudson's estranged husband William Balfour, 27, was taken into custody on the day of the murders and confessed to the crime. Balfour was on parole for attempted murder, vehicular hijacking, and possession of a stolen vehicle and had served nearly seven years in prison. Balfour's address was revealed to be the home where Donerson and Hudson were murdered.

Balfour was held by the Illinois Department of Corrections on a parole violation for the maximum 48 hours without being charged with a crime. At the November 10, 2008 parole hearing, the prisoner review board was told that Balfour's girlfriend had seen him with a gun identical to the murder weapon several days before the murder. Balfour appeared at the hearing without an assigned attorney because he had not been charged with a crime.

On December 1, 2008, Balfour was arrested and charged with three counts of first-degree murder and one count of felony home invasion. At a December 3 court hearing, Balfour was denied bail and a prosecutor alleged that he committed the murders out of anger that his estranged wife was dating another man. Balfour maintained his innocence and was convicted in May 2012 and sentenced to 3 life sentences plus 120 years.

In the aftermath of the deaths, Jennifer Hudson's family announced the creation of the Hudson-King Foundation for Families of Slain Victims, a foundation to care for the needs of families who have lost relatives to violent crime.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed events and information provided in the message, it is highly likely to be a real message (1). Overall, the level of detail and coherence in the narrative suggest that this is a real-life incident.

This level of detail and coherence suggests that the message is likely to be real rather than fabricated.

On Monday, Princess Eugenie announced her engagement to James Brooksbank, with a sparkler that has sparked attention. The pink padparadsha sapphire, surrounded by diamonds, is similar in style to the ruby engagement ring her father, Prince Andrew, gave to Sarah Ferguson in 1986.

The estimated value of Eugenie's ring, as assessed by gem expert and television personality from "Posh Pawn," is $140,000, double that of Meghan Markle's estimated worth of $70,000. The gemologist from Prestige Pawnbrokers described the ring as a "center oval precious gemstone" surrounded by 10 brilliant cut diamonds and two pear cut diamonds.

Deborah Papas, the gemologist, explained that the padparadscha sapphire is one of the rarest and most valuable corundum gem varieties. The ring's quality and cut can greatly affect its value, with even slight differences potentially leading to a substantial difference in cost. While she did not have full access to the ring, Papas estimated it to be worth over £100,000 [$140,000].

The princess, 27, has been in a relationship with Brooksbank, 31, for six years, and her parents, the Duke and Duchess of York, expressed their delight at the news. Netflix has made the heart-wrenching decision to end the gripping psychological thriller Gypsy after only one season. This news comes as a shock to fans of the show, which featured the stunning acting talents of Naomi Watts and a writers room that had been hard at work on storylines and scripts for Season 2.

Gypsy, which made its debut on June 30, was met with mixed reviews but quickly gained a dedicated fan base. The show followed Jean Holloway (played by Watts), a Manhattan therapist with a seemingly perfect life who becomes entangled in intimate and illicit relationships with the people in her patients' lives. As the lines between Jean's professional and personal life blur, she finds herself in a world where desire and reality are inextricably linked.

In a shocking move, Kardashian West chose to promote her fragrance with a series of suggestive nude images of herself, despite the drama surrounding her husband, Kanye West, who spent Wednesday on a Twitter spree after some in his inner circle expressed concern about him.

On Monday, Kardashian West shared a photo, in which she's posing topless with her arm across her chest, to announce the launch of the fragrance. In a separate post on Tuesday, she shared a full-frontal nude picture of herself, with a caption that read, "We took a mold of my body and made it a perfume bottle."

But Kardashian West's reveal of her new fragrance bottle wasn't just about the bottle itself. She also defended her husband, who has been making headlines for his ongoing Twitter spree, in a series of tweets of her own.

In a series of tweets, Kardashian West addressed the media's commentary on Kanye's tweets, and praised him for being unique, even if he's not universally liked.

"Kanye will never run in the race of popular opinion and we know that and that's why I love him and respect him," she wrote. "Kanye is years ahead of his time."

The mention of her husband Kanye West's Twitter spree also corresponds to recent news. The level of detail and specificity in the message make it more likely to be real, so the predicted veracity is 1.

Beyoncé welcomed twins, a boy and a girl, on June 12, 2017, but the delivery process was not as smooth as planned. According to In Touch, there were complications and drama surrounding the event, particularly involving Beyoncé's family.

A source told the magazine that Beyoncé had requested a peaceful and intimate moment on her special day, but her family failed to respect her wishes. The source added that Beyoncé was particularly frustrated by her estranged father, Mathew Knowles, who called frequently and caused tension among the family members.

In addition to Mathew, there were also tensions between Beyoncé and her mother, Tina, over the decision to allow only one person in the delivery room during the planned C-section. Tina reportedly became "really salty" and made comments about Jay-Z not being present during the pregnancy.

Despite the drama, Beyoncé and Jay-Z are overjoyed to have welcomed their twins, and the family is now focused on adjusting to their new life as a family of five. The couple plans to document their journey in a future documentary, and Beyoncé is relieved that the delivery is over and her family is safe and healthy.

Dieter Schmitz, a beloved reality star from Laguna Beach, has become a father. On Sunday, the 32-year-old announced the birth of his first child, a healthy baby boy named Nico Josef Schmitz.

The proud new dad shared a heartwarming photograph of his wife, Isabell Hiebl, cradling their newborn son in the hospital. In the photo, Hiebl is beaming with joy, and little Nico appears to be peacefully sleeping.

Schmitz wrote alongside the image, "Isabel and I welcomed our baby boy, Nico Josef Schmitz, on 9/8/2018 at 9:10 AM! May you make the world a better place and have a tremendously healthy and fulfilling life. We love you so much!"

Fellow reality star Lauren Conrad was quick to offer her congratulations, commenting with multiple heart emojis. The couple first announced that they were expecting a child in March, along with a photograph of their dog wearing a sign that read, "Mom & Dad are getting me a human due: Sep. 10, 2018."

Schmitz and Hiebl tied the knot in August 2016, surrounded by several of his Laguna Beach co-stars, including Stephen Colletti, Trey Phillips, and Loren Polster. Conrad was also in attendance, posing alongside her friend on Instagram Stories and posting a sweet photograph of the happy couple.

As the "growing Schmitz family" moved back to Orange County, California, in July, Schmitz took to Instagram to express his excitement. "So great to be back," he wrote, along with a photograph of Laguna Beach.

Schmitz and Hiebl's new addition joins the couple's furry family, which includes a dog named Max. The couple's love and joy is infectious and we can't wait to see what this new chapter brings for them.

The inclusion of personal details about their relationship and previous announcements of their pregnancy further support the veracity of the message. However, she is not in a rush to walk down the aisle with her current partner, Alex Rodriguez. The Shades of Blue actress revealed that her relationship with the former Yankees player is healthy and they communicate well, understanding each other's lives in a way that most others could not.

Lopez and Rodriguez celebrated their one-year anniversary in February, where she debuted her single "Us" written by Poo Bear and produced by Skrillex, dedicating it to Rodriguez. Lopez chose the song because it fit into where the couple was in their relationship and because she felt it was relevant to their situation.

Since entering the public eye in their early twenties, both Lopez and Rodriguez have experienced a lot of success and have had to deal with the effects it has had on their personal lives. However, Lopez feels that she has come a long way since her past relationships, including her marriage to chef Ojani Noa and dancer Cris Judd, and has come to know herself better.

Despite the challenges that come with being in a relationship with an athlete, Lopez remains optimistic about the future of her relationship with Rodriguez and is committed to making it work for the long run. She believes that "baseball is just like life" and all you want to do is "hit a home run."

It has been reported that actor George Clooney is considering selling his Villa Oleandra, the mansion he purchased on the shores of Lake Como 10 years ago, in order to distance himself from the attention of the paparazzi who frequently follow him there. The report suggests that Clooney, who has established a strong presence in Italy, may be making a dramatic withdrawal from the country.

After buying Villa Oleandra, Clooney was made an honorary citizen of Laglio, the town where his villa is located, and he made his 2010 film The American in Italy after promising to make a film in Abruzzo to help boost the local economy. He was also romantically linked with Italian actress Elisabetta Canalis for nearly five years, but the relationship ended last year. Additionally, Marco Mueller, the Venice artistic director who regularly invited Clooney to the Venice Lido, was ousted from his position in December and replaced by Alberto Barbera, who has indicated that Venice under Mueller was "in a rut" with the same people appearing every year. Clooney is not scheduled to appear at this year's edition of the Venice festival, which begins on Wednesday.

The issue with Villa Oleandra concerns privacy - or the lack of it, due to the number of paparazzi photographers camped outside the villa when Clooney is there. Some of the paparazzi have defended their actions, stating that they are simply doing their jobs and that Clooney is a public figure.

EXCLUSIVE: Katie Holmes Opens Up About the 'Magical' Time Filming Dawson's Creek 20 Years Ago!

In a heartfelt throwback, the stunning actress and star of the upcoming FBI drama pilot, Katie Holmes, took us down memory lane with a nostalgic photo from her time filming the pilot for the iconic WB teen drama, Dawson's Creek.

Taking to Instagram on Thursday, Holmes shared a picture of herself, along with co-star Mary-Margaret Humes, and young James Van Der Beek, taken more than two decades ago during the pilot filming.

"#tbt when we were filming the pilot for #dawsonscreek," Holmes captioned the picture, ending the note with a heart emoji. "It was such a magical time and I am forever grateful to all who were involved and all of our fans."

The 39-year-old actress, who played Joey Potter on the show, was clearly in a reflective mood, celebrating the show that launched her career. The WB teen drama, which ran for six seasons, was set in the seaside town of Wilmington, North Carolina and followed the lives of the young and ambitious residents.

In 2015, Holmes addressed fans' desires for a Dawson's Creek reboot or revival, telling Yahoo! Style at the time, "I don't want them to grow up. You know, it's kind of like your parents -- they never get out of their 50s, that's where they are."

Holmes recalled having fond memories filming the show and enjoying the innocence of the pre-Internet era. "We just did it, we all enjoyed it. It was of a certain time," she said. "There was an innocence there."

With her new FBI drama pilot, Holmes is set to star as a brilliant and driven agent who leads an elite task force in the fight against organized crime. The highly anticipated series is set to premiere on Fox this fall.

Whether we'll ever see a reboot of Dawson's Creek remains to be seen, but for now, we'll just have to enjoy the memories that Holmes and the rest of the cast created on the show.
td_rationale: It is likely that this message is genuine. There is specific detail provided about Katie Holmes sharing a nostalgic photo on Instagram from her time filming the pilot episode of Dawson's Creek, along with a heartfelt caption expressing gratitude and fond memories. In addition, the article includes quotes from Holmes discussing her time on the show and her current projects. The level of detail and specific quotes from Holmes suggest that this is a genuine article, making it more likely to be a real message. Therefore, it is predicted to be a real message (1).
cs_rationale: Based on the information provided, it is reasonable to predict that the message is real (1). The inclusion of direct quotes from Holmes and references to her previous statements about a reboot or revival add authenticity to the message.
