The British monarchy operates through a strict line of succession, with the eldest son of the reigning monarch typically inheriting the throne upon their death. The current heir to the throne is Prince Charles, the Prince of Wales, who will take the throne upon Queen Elizabeth II's retirement or death. The title of the heir to the throne is the Prince of Wales, which was introduced by King Edward I in 1301 after the conquest of Wales.

Under British law, the crown passes to the eldest son of the monarch, regardless of gender. However, this rule has been changed since 2013, with the Succession to the Crown Act removing the gender-based rule of succession. Now, the oldest child, regardless of gender, will inherit the throne.

The current royal line of succession includes Prince Charles, Prince William, Prince George, Prince Harry, Prince Andrew, Princess Beatrice, Princess Eugenie, Prince Edward, James Windsor, Lady Louise Windsor, HRH The Princess Anne, Peter Phillips, Zara Phillips, David Armstrong-Jones, and Lady Sarah Chatto.

The Act of Union 1800 and the Act of Settlement 1701 previously governed the succession to the throne, but were amended in 2013 to remove the disqualification arising from marrying a person of the Roman Catholic faith.

Stephen Colbert Strikes Back at Donald Trump at the 2017 Emmy Awards! Watch the Epic Clash!

Stephen Colbert is at it again, and this time he's taking aim at the one and only, President Donald Trump! The late night host used his platform at the 2017 Emmy Awards to mercilessly mock the president, much to the delight of his adoring fans.

Colbert began his opening act by doing a song-and-dance number, poking fun at the various shows up for an Emmy this year. But there was a hidden message in there, a subtle jab at Trump. Can you guess what it is? The chorus of the song? "Everything is better on TV—including, in a slightly more veiled jab at Trump, 'treason'."

Once he finally took the stage, Colbert thanked first responders for their work following hurricanes in Texas and Florida. But he quickly pivoted to his Trump jokes, saying, "If he had won an Emmy, I bet he never would have run for president. So in a way, this is your fault. I thought you people loved morally compromised antiheroes. You liked Walter White; he's just Walter, much whiter."

But Colbert wasn't done yet. He had one final jab at the president before he left the stage. He brought out his secret weapon: Sean Spicer! Spicer appeared on stage behind a lectern to comment on the TV Academy gala's crowd size, saying, "This is the biggest audience to witness an Emmys, period, both in person and around the world."

Colbert's response? "Wow, that really soothes my fragile ego. Give it up for Melissa McCarthy, everybody."

This is just the latest in a long line of Trump jokes from Colbert, who has been honing his voice as David Letterman's replacement on The Late Show with Trump. Will he continue to take aim at the president at the Emmys? Only time will tell!

The public relations campaign surrounding Bruce Jenner's transition into Caitlyn Jenner has been highly effective, from the two-hour interview special with Diane Sawyer on "20/20" in April to the Vanity Fair cover reveal of Caitlyn in a bustier this week.

Alan Nierob, a seasoned showbiz publicist and former executive at Rogers & Cowan, has been guiding the strategy behind the scenes. Nierob previously helped Jenner handle crisis PR for Hollywood celebrities such as Robert Downey Jr. and Mel Gibson.

Jenner turned to Nierob for assistance in navigating the media attention that followed her coming out as transgender. Nierob had previously represented Jenner in the mid-1980s but had never been her official publicist. Instead, he acted as a friend and advisor.

Nierob worked with Jenner's manager and attorney to persuade the New York Times to abandon a story about Jenner being a cross-dresser during a career downturn in the mid-1980s. He used all the PR pressure tactics at his disposal, including strenuous denials, questioning the motives of sources, and emphasizing the potential consequences for Jenner and her family.

Nierob then helped Jenner prepare for her landmark TV interview with Sawyer and began work on the campaign to explain her transformation. The first promotion for Jenner's upcoming E! docu-series was announced during the "20/20" interview, and the Vanity Fair cover reveal of Caitlyn's new name and look coincided with the launch of her Twitter account.

Jenner has been shooting material for the docu-series "I Am Cait" while on the road and has been busy promoting her new role as an advocate for the transgender community. Sources close to Jenner say that she is "on a mission to save lives and make a difference."

Seth Rogen visited Comedy Central's "The Colbert Report" on Monday and discussed the making of his controversial assassination comedy, "The Interview." Rogen revealed that he had considered altering the name of the film's antagonist, Kim Jong-un, but ultimately decided not to. "Whose feelings are we trying to spare by doing that?" he asked host Stephen Colbert. "Kim Jong-un's?" Rogen, who is also the film's star and cowriter, added that they did not believe the North Korean leader would appreciate the concept of the movie.

Rogen then spoke about the research he conducted for the film, including reading about the country and interviewing individuals who had met the dictator. He noted that the accounts led him to believe that Kim Jong-un was actually quite unassuming in person. "When you're in a room with him, it's not like you're always aware of where he is," Rogen explained. "We honestly tried to make him -- for lack of a better word -- adorable."

In April 2016, Kardashian took a selfie and noted on Twitter, "White Lumee Duo In Apple stores worldwide #LumeeCollab." She also promoted an earlier version of the LuMee case in July 2016 on Instagram, with a link to Amazon and the caption, "Hey Guys! LuMee cases are featured today as Amazon’s Prime Deal of the Day. Best deal ever! #PrimeDay #LuMee."

After taking a selfie with then-presidential candidate Hillary Clinton at a fundraiser, Kardashian used the encounter to later promote LuMee. Clinton recalled in January 2016 on the "Ellen DeGeneres Show" that Kardashian showed her a phone case with lights all around it, and Clinton had been searching for something similar. After this, Kardashian tweeted, "Selfies about to be LIT!!! The secret to my selfies http://Lumee.com."

Gossip Cop has reached out to SnapLight, LuMee, and Harooni for comment on Kardashian's promotion of the LuMee case. A representative for Kardashian claimed that the patent lawsuit filed by SnapLight was meritless.

During rehearsals for the upcoming American Idol Live! 2018 Tour, the lovebirds spoke to ET's Lauren Zima and gushed over their unbreakable bond. "It's awesome!" Poppe, 20, said. "We're already reading each other's minds, knowing what we're gonna do next."

Hutchinson, 19, added, "Yeah. It's weird. It's like dueting with yourself, almost." The couple's relationship has been a closely guarded secret throughout the competition, but they finally revealed it to the world after Poppe was named the winner.

In a heartfelt message on Instagram, Hutchinson congratulated Poppe on her big win and wrote, "No one deserved it more than you babe. I am honored to know you and even more honored to call you mine. Don’t forget about me. I love you."

In an interview with ET, Hutchinson explained that he didn't want to affect the competition or exploit his feelings for Poppe. "We met the first day of Hollywood Week and we haven’t really spent any time apart since then," he said. "It was one of those things where I didn’t want it to affect anything, and I didn’t want to exploit my feelings for her 'cause they’re very, very real. Once voting was over, I was like, ‘Shoot, I want the world to know.'"

The American Idol Live! 2018 Tour kicks off July 11, and we can't wait to see what this loving couple has in store for us.

"Trust me, if I could redo the whole thing, I'd have a blow-up doll and no ketchup," Griffin said to the audience.

This isn't the first time Lovato and the stand-up comic have taken their feud to social media. In 2014, a fan asked Griffin to call out the "biggest douche celebrity." She responded, "Probably Debbie Lovato."

Recent awards shows in Hollywood have once again put the spotlight on the male celebrities attending the red carpet, and it seems that they have been making headlines for all the wrong reasons. The reason for this sudden attention is not their dashing appearance or their stunning Tom Ford tuxedos, but rather their choice to self-tan.

This revelation has left many people, including myself, in a state of disbelief. I, along with millions of other women, have always admired the bronzed appearance of male celebrities like Leonardo DiCaprio, George Clooney, and Bradley Cooper. We have always believed that having a tan, whether natural or artificial, makes a man look healthier and more attractive.

However, there seems to be a stigma surrounding men using self-tanning products. It is often perceived as a sign of insecurity or a desperate attempt to look younger. But is this really the case?

Self-tanning products have become increasingly popular among both men and women, and there are many benefits to using them. For instance, a self-tan can help to accentuate muscles, cover imperfections, smooth out skin tone, and even mask cellulite. Additionally, it can help to boost confidence and make a person more attractive to the opposite sex.

There are many self-tanning products specifically designed for men, and they are just as effective as their female counterparts. Self-tanning can be used on an ongoing basis to maintain a healthy glow, rather than relying on tanning beds or sun exposure, which can lead to skin cancer and wrinkles.

In conclusion, there are many reasons why men should feel encouraged to use self-tanning products. It is a safe and natural alternative to tanning beds and sun exposure, and it can have numerous benefits for both men and women. So, the next time you see a man with a nice tan, don't be surprised, it's just another sign of a man taking pride in his appearance.

MediaTakeOut has recently published a story claiming that Christina Milian and Karrueche Tran are more than just friends. The article suggests that the two were spotted frolicking on the beach in Florida, and questions whether they are in a romantic relationship. According to MediaTakeOut, Milian and Tran have been close friends for years, and there is a "something" about the way they act that suggests they may be more than friends. Laura Day, a Jewish woman who has gained fame for her intuition and ability to predict events, has several high-profile admirers in Hollywood. Rosanna Arquette credits Day with saving her daughter's life, while Brad Pitt and Demi Moore have both expressed their respect for her. Despite her success, Day insists that she is a "straightlaced Jewish woman" and is not a magical or spiritual leader.

Day has written several books on intuition and has earned a reputation as a successful author. Her first book, Practical Intuition, sold over 133,000 copies, and her follow-up book, Practical Intuition for Success, is part of a two-book deal worth $3 million. Before becoming an author, Day earned money by advising filmmakers on script and casting problems, and business executives on market trends.

Day's ability to predict events has been credited with saving Arquette's daughter Zoe's life. In 1996, Arquette called Day after her daughter fell ill, and Day had a clear feeling that Zoe was going to die. She ensured that Zoe was taken to a hospital, where she was diagnosed with a rare form of blood poisoning. Arquette believes that Day's information saved Zoe's life.

Day's friendships with Hollywood celebrities have also helped her. When her publisher HarperCollins did not throw a party for her second book, her friends, including Brad Pitt, threw her a party instead. Demi Moore, who worked with Day on the set of The Butcher's Wife, credits Day with giving her a greater trust in her own intuition.

Day's success has allowed her to "do bake sales and book sales and be a very involved parent." She and her son Samson share their New York City loft with a cat, three lizards, a mouse, and nine fish. Day is currently working on Intuition and Love, a guide to finding a mate.

Despite her success, Day only rarely gets intuitive about her own life. She says she works hard to live in the moment and is interested in how she is feeling right now, rather than trying to predict the future.

content:
Dear Bravoholic's,

I'm here to share with you my journey of watching the Real Housewives of New Jersey on Peacock and the Bravo app. It's been a wild ride, full of ups and downs, just like the lives of these women.

As I watched Melissa and Teresa navigate their way through family dynamics, I couldn't help but feel a sense of admiration for them. Despite the challenges they've faced, they've come so far and it's amazing to see. Family relationships can be complicated and there's no one right way to do things. Each family is unique, and sometimes it takes a lot of trial and error to figure out what works best. I can relate to Melissa's desire to make her parents feel loved and special, even if it means going to great lengths.

I also have to give props to Teresa for her discipline in this fitness competition. While I may not have the same level of ambition, I can appreciate the stress-relieving benefits of working out. However, I don't think I could ever have the same level of discipline as her, even if I wanted to.

As for Marge, I love her fierce business sense and the idea of her pajama line is intriguing. But the fact that she sleeps naked is just too much information for me!

Dolores and Frank's relationship serves as a great example of how divorced couples should behave. They are truly amazing role models. As for Frankie Jr., I hope he takes time to visit his mom and show her some love.

I must say, I was worried about how Dolores would react to Danielle. Paterson Dolores is a force to be reckoned with, and I can only imagine the kind of reaction she would have.

I wish Melissa a very happy birthday, and I can't wait to see what she gets up to at Rails. The party looks like it's going to be a blast, especially with Melissy drinking her weight in water.

As for arranged marriages and chaperoned dates, I have a story to share. I met my husband in a unique way, and it was love at first sight. We knew we were meant to be together, and our families approved. We got married on Labor Day of 2002, and it was the event of the year.

Now, back to Melissa's party. The cake is absolutely stunning, and I love that she doesn't take herself too seriously. The fact that cake is flying everywhere and nobody cares is just a testament to the joy that comes with celebrating life.

Thank you for letting me share my story with you. I hope it has touched your heart and reminded you of the love and joy that exists in the world.

"When I look at my body now, I just see life," Gomez said. "There are a million things I could do—lasers and creams and all that stuff—but I'm okay with it. I don't have perfect abs, but I feel like I'm wonderfully made."

Gomez, who is known for her self-confidence, did not always have it easy. She admits that the surgery scar was "hard in the beginning" and that she had to ask herself "Why?" when she looked at herself naked in the mirror.

After going through a lot, Gomez is feeling all of the positive vibes. "I just keep thinking about how much my body is my own," she said. "I had this sense of gratitude for myself. I didn't, but I do now."

As a woman who has always dreamed of becoming a mother, Khloe Kardashian's recent visit to her fertility doctor has left her heart heavy with fear and uncertainty. The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star, 32, went in for a routine check-up, but little did she know that it would lead to an ultrasound to determine if she was on track for a healthy pregnancy.

"I just came here for a doctor's appointment and had no idea I was about to get an ultrasound," Khloe says in a clip from the upcoming episode of the E! show. "This whole thing is snowballing and moving really fast."

As she waits for the ultrasound, Khloe's sister Kim joins her, and the mood is light with jokes about Khloe already being pregnant. But when the doctor enters, the mood turns serious. "We're looking to see there's nothing that will get in the way of a healthy pregnancy," he explains. "There are fewer follicles than I anticipated from a normal 32-year-old."

Khloe's response is heartbreaking. "Shut the f**k up," she says. "This is definitely not at all how I thought this appointment would go. What if I can't get pregnant?"

Khloe is currently dating basketball player Tristan Thompson, and while there's no suggestion they're ready to start a family just yet, it was recently claimed the couple is "very serious" about each other. Khloe has been feeling the happiest she's ever been thanks to Tristan, and she recently gushed about their relationship in an interview.

But Khloe's sister Kim has had her own fertility issues over the years. She's a proud mom to two children - North and Saint - but has been open in interviews about her struggles to fall pregnant and medical conditions while pregnant. On an episode of KUWTK earlier this year, Kim was warned that she could "bleed to death" if she falls pregnant again. Her doctor, Paul Crane, told her: "Here's what I think, your pregnancies, you had toxaemia, you had a retained placenta, very traumatic, we're always worried about the next serious complication. I think the potential fear of the whole situation is legitimate.

"You never know that you might not have the same type of problem that might be more serious this time. You're always taking a little bit of a chance. There are situations where retained placenta could be life and death."

Born on January 24, 1987, in Zambales, Philippines, Telli Swift was raised in Japan and later moved to California. She began her modelling career at the young age of three and went on to appear in a variety of beauty pageants.

It was in 2015 that Telli and Deontay crossed paths for the first time. According to Telli, they saw each other at check-in, then again at TSA, before Deontay finally spoke to her while they were both going to their gates.

Despite initially being reluctant to propose, Deontay eventually did so on an episode of Wags Atlanta. He said, "I love the girl though. She got my heart. That's my baby, that's my best friend."

The proposal took place on February 15, 2018, and was timed to coincide with their child's gender reveal party, where they found out they were having a daughter.

This will be Deontay's second marriage, as he divorced his first wife, Jessica Scales-Wilder, in 2017 after eight years of marriage. Telli has kept a low profile since then, focusing on being a partner to Deontay and a mother to their daughter.

Together, Deontay and Telli have faced many challenges, including the pressure that comes with being in the public eye. However, they have stood strong and supported each other through it all.

As they prepare for their future together, let us celebrate the love story of Deontay Wilder and Telli Swift - a love story that is truly inspiring and a testament to the power of true love.

Fischer walked out onto the stage of the show wearing the terrycloth white towel, which covered her bodice, with a pair of blue jeans, heels, and diamond earrings. Fischer is a Missouri girl, and she is known for her resilience and ability to adapt to unexpected circumstances. She said, “I’m a Missouri girl and the show must go on.”

The Miraval Château, a castle and vineyard located in the small town of Correns, France, has been at the center of a legal battle. The Hollywood couple Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt purchased the property in 2008 for ?5 million ($67 million at the time) and held their wedding there six years later.

After a three-year legal battle, the decision was originally delivered in April but was not made public until French media broke the story last week. The artist Odile Soudant, who specializes in light installations, has accused Jolie-Pitt's company of driving her business, Lumières Studio, into bankruptcy. She is also demanding to be legally recognized as the creator of the lighting she designed for the 17th century château and its outbuildings.

Pitt's lawyers argued that the project was late and over budget, and that the design was Pitt's brainchild. The Hollywood couple launched a large remodeling plan to transform the property to their liking. Soudant was hired in 2010 to run a ?5 million project that would bring natural light into four of the buildings at the domain, where Pink Floyd recorded an album in the late 1970s.

The collaboration went smoothly for three years until Pitt discovered that the company acting as the general contractor was inflating the costs. He then blocked all additional payments. Despite Pitt no longer paying, Soudant was asked to continue working.

Soudant has now accused Pitt of appropriating the creation of her work, and the actor's lawyers replied that the castle is "purely private" and not subject to copyright. However, Le Point concludes that "the estate is not as private as its owners claim: Recently it served as a backdrop for the latest Guerlain ad campaign by Terrence Malick. In one of the scenes, we see clearly—no pun intended—a luminous installation conceived by the plastic artist."

The actress who brought laughter to millions through her role as Gloria on Modern Family posed nude for the Naked Issue of Women's Health Magazine. At the age of 45, Sofia Vergara stood proud and confident, stripped down to her birthday suit on a block of wood.

She opened up about what it meant to her to be posing nude at her age, saying, "Times have changed, and it's not like before when only young girls would make the cover of a magazine." The actress accepted her body and skin for what it is and what it is not, admitting that she is 45 and even if she wanted to, she cannot be perfect.

Vergara acknowledged that her body is changing, and she can see it happening, but she doesn't hate it or get upset by it. She wants to look her age, and people who are constantly trying to look younger will eventually go crazy. Staying healthy and fit is important to her, but working out is torture. Despite this, she continues to do it often because she sees the importance of staying healthy and fit. It's not about having muscles or cut abs because that would take too much effort!

The actress mentioned that she had bad knees and thin bones, and wished she could be a little bit more athletic. She also said her "gigantic boobs" have only gotten bigger with time, which makes it hard to work out.

Working hard is one of the things that Sofia Vergara believes in the most, which has led her to her many successes in her acting career. She said that she wasn't always the "youngest" or "most intelligent" woman in the room, but she was always "the hardest working one."

"Dreams don't happen if you just sit down and accept things."

Sofia Vergara's full interview with Women's Health Magazine and nude cover shot for the Naked Issue hit the stands on August 8. What did you think about what Sofia Vergara had to say about posing nude, aging gracefully, and staying healthy? Let us know in the comments section below.

content:
Jill Messick, a veteran studio executive and producer, passed away on Wednesday after years of struggling with depression. The Hollywood Reporter reported that she was "victimized" after becoming embroiled in the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations.

Messick worked at Miramax as a production executive from 1997 to 2003 and served as McGowan's manager in January 1997. In a statement following her death, her family said that Messick was "collateral damage" in the story.

In January 1997, Messick set up a meeting between McGowan and Weinstein during the Sundance Film Festival. Following the meeting, McGowan told Messick what had happened, but did not use the word "rape." Despite this, Messick recognized that something untoward had happened and immediately went to her bosses to recount McGowan's story. They told her that they would handle the situation, and the arrangements between McGowan and Weinstein were then negotiated without Messick's knowledge.

Ten months later, Messick was hired by Miramax as an executive at Miramax Films working in production in Los Angeles. However, in recent months, McGowan's constant press attention has led to Weinstein releasing documents, including an email that Messick wrote to him months prior to the first New York Times piece coming out. In this email, Messick offered the truth based on what she remembered McGowan telling her about the Sundance account.

Messick's family said that seeing her name in headlines again and again, as part of one person's attempt to gain more attention for her personal cause, along with Weinstein's attempt to vindicate himself, was devastating for her. It broke her, who was just starting to get her life back on track.

The media is a powerful tool, and it is important to use it responsibly to accurately expose criminals and predators while protecting the truth of third parties. Words matter, and what we say can have just as much impact as our actions. We must take a moment to consider the ramifications and consequences of what we say and do.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed account of events and the emotional impact described by Messick's family, it is more likely that this message is real. The specific timeline, interactions, and emotions described provide a sense of authenticity to the story. Messick's involvement in the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations, her actions following the meeting, and the subsequent consequences on her life all contribute to the credibility of the message. Therefore, it is predicted to be a real message (1).
cs_rationale: This message appears to be real, as it contains specific details about Jill Messick's career and involvement with the Harvey Weinstein-Rose McGowan allegations. Additionally, the details provided regarding events and interactions involving Messick are detailed and specific. The message also includes commentary about the responsibilities of the media and the need for accurate reporting, further suggesting its veracity. Therefore, the predicted veracity of this message is 1.

On the 27th anniversary of the passing of his brother Richie Shelton, Blake Shelton took to Twitter to share his thoughts and memories of the loved one. The accident occurred on Nov. 13, 1990, when Richie, who was 24 at the time, was a passenger in a car that collided with a school bus in Ada, Oklahoma. He died along with the driver Redena McManus and a 3-year-old boy.

In a tweet, Shelton wrote, "Lost my brother 27 years ago today. I was only 14 at the time but it changed my life forever... Made me realize that life is precious and there's no time like RIGHT NOW to go for it... We still miss you Richie!!"

The accident had a profound impact on Shelton, who told 60 Minutes in 2014, "I remember picking up the phone to call him a week after he was dead, to tell him something. I was picking up the phone to call him, to tell him something I just saw on TV or, and it was like constantly a shock to me that he was dead."

Despite the age difference, the brothers shared a love of country music and often bonded over their shared love of music. In 2011, Shelton and his then-wife Miranda Lambert wrote a single called "Over You," which was inspired by Richie. The song became a hit and remains a tribute to the memory of the brother they lost.

The details provided about the anniversary of Richie Shelton's passing, the circumstances of the accident, and Blake Shelton's emotional response are specific and consistent. Given the depth of personal and emotional details, it is highly likely that this message is real. Thus, the predicted veracity is 1.

The 2018 Screen Actors Guild Awards?In Memoriam segment paid tribute to the late and great David Cassidy, Roger Moore, Adam West, Jerry Lewis, and Bill Paxton, who left us all too soon. Their legacies live on through the films and television shows they left behind, but their absence leaves a void in the hearts of their fans.

David Cassidy, the former teen heartthrob best known for his role as Keith Partridge on the hit series The Partridge Family, passed away on Nov. 21 at the age of 67. His dementia diagnosis was revealed exclusively to PEOPLE in February 2017, and he bravely fought the disease until the end.

Roger Moore, the beloved James Bond actor, passed away on May 23 at the age of 89 after a long battle with leukemia. He will always be remembered for his iconic portrayal of 007 in the 1970s and 80s.

Adam West, best known for his turn as Gotham City's Caped Crusader, passed away on June 9 at the age of 88 after a short battle with leukemia. His career spanned six decades of film, stage, and voice work, and he will always be remembered as a true legend of the silver screen.

Jerry Lewis, the comedy king who brought joy to generations of moviegoers on both sides of the Atlantic, passed away on March 20 at the age of 91. His manic style and quick wit will be missed by all who knew him.

Bill Paxton, a talented actor who rose to fame in the 1990s with roles in blockbusters like Terminator and Aliens, passed away on Feb. 25 at the age of 61. He earned accolades for his role as treasure hunter Brock Lovett in Titanic, and later for his performance in the hit TV series Big Love.

These five stars, along with the many others who were honored at the In Memoriam segment, will always be remembered for the impact they made on the entertainment industry and the lives of those around them. Their legacies will live on through their work, and their fans will always keep them close to their hearts.

content:
"Are You Allowing Your Child to Watch a Teenage Nightmare? The Terrifying Truth About Netflix's 13 Reasons Why"

A concerned parent is at a loss as to whether or not their 13-year-old daughter should watch the Netflix show, 13 Reasons Why. The show has become an obsession among her friends, but the news articles she's been reading are warning of the graphic depictions of suicide, bullying, and forced sex that may be too much for her to handle.

The show, based on a popular YA novel, is rated TV-MA and contains explicit content that may not be suitable for viewers under 17. However, it has been heavily marketed to adolescents, with a personal social media campaign from Executive Producer and powerful teen influencer, Selena Gomez.

The Mediatrician® has issued a warning, stating that the show may be dangerous for kids to watch. The intense emotions, confusion, and behaviors of the show's characters can be disturbing to any viewer, especially younger viewers who are still developing their brain executive functions. The show may also be interpreted by young viewers as normal adolescent behavior, leading to a misunderstanding of the seriousness of teen suicide.

Furthermore, the show neglects to address the primary reason for the main character's suicide, which is depression. The show presents a harsh and untrue message that Hannah's classmates actually caused her death. The missed opportunity to describe how depression feels and how it looks to others is the show's greatest failure.

As a parent, it's important to discuss the themes of the show with your child and help them process it in a healthy way. It's also crucial to identify the people in your child's life to whom they can turn when they feel sad, lonely, or helpless.

In conclusion, while 13 Reasons Why may be marketed as "teen drama," it's important to be aware of the graphic content and the potential dangers it may pose to your child.
td_rationale: This message is highly likely to be a real message. It addresses the concerns of a parent regarding the appropriateness of their 13-year-old daughter watching the Netflix show, 13 Reasons Why. It discusses the warnings about the graphic content and potential negative impact on young viewers, as well as the show's failure to address the main character's depression as the primary reason for her suicide. Additionally, the message emphasizes the importance of parents discussing the themes of the show with their children and helping them process it in a healthy way. Therefore, the veracity of this message is likely to be real. I predict its veracity to be 1.
cs_rationale: The article raises valid concerns about whether the Netflix show "13 Reasons Why" is appropriate for young viewers, particularly due to its graphic depictions of sensitive topics like suicide, bullying, and sexual assault. Despite its popularity among adolescents, the show's TV-MA rating indicates it contains explicit content unsuitable for viewers under 17. Critics, including the Mediatrician®, warn that the intense emotions and portrayal of teen suicide may be disturbing and potentially harmful, especially without addressing depression as the main cause. Parents are advised to discuss these themes openly with their children and provide guidance on processing such content in a healthy manner, emphasizing the importance of seeking help when needed.

SCARLETT JOHANSSON GETS DIVORCED FROM ROMAIN DAURIAC AFTER CLASH OVER WHERE DAUGHTER ROSE SHALL BE RAISED

Actress Scarlett Johansson has officially parted ways with her husband, Romain Dauriac, after a long and bitter custody dispute over their 3-year-old daughter Rose Dorothy Dauriac. According to Page Six, the couple has finalized their divorce and reached a settlement in Manhattan Supreme Court on Tuesday.

In a joint statement, the ex-couple revealed that they remain close friends and co-parents with a shared commitment to raising their daughter in a loving and compassionate environment. However, their divorce was not an easy one, as Dauriac fought Johansson's request for primary physical custody, insisting that the child be raised in France, and noting that Johansson's busy work schedule requires heavy traveling.

Johansson, who was previously married to Ryan Reynolds, filed for divorce on March 7, asking for primary physical custody of their daughter. Dauriac, on the other hand, believed that the child should be raised in France, and argued that Johansson's busy work schedule makes it impossible for her to have primary custody.

Despite the drama, Johansson maintained that she would never comment on the dissolution of her marriage, and asked other parties involved and the media to do the same, out of respect for her desires as a parent and for all working moms.

The actress, who has recently been linked with Saturday Night Live star Colin Jost and her attorney, Kevin Yorn, tied the knot with Dauriac in a private wedding ceremony in 2014. The actress was previously married to Ryan Reynolds from 2008 to 2011.

"Big Little Lies" has announced the addition of two new cast members for its upcoming second season, as well as the return of several characters from the show's first outing.

Crystal Fox, best known for her role in "In the Heat of the Night," will join the show as a series regular, playing the character of Elizabeth Howard. Additionally, Mo McRae, previously seen in "Pitch," will play Michael Perkins in a recurring role.

Although details about the characters they will play have not been revealed, it is known that they will be series regulars.

HBO has also confirmed that four key characters from the first season will return: Kathryn Newton as Madeline's (Reese Witherspoon) daughter Abigail; Sarah Sokolovic as Tori Bachman; Robin Weigert as Celeste's (Nicole Kidman) therapist Dr. Amanda Reisman; and Merrin Dungey as Adrienne Quinlan, the detective investigating the death of Perry (Alexander Skarsgard).

The second season, like the first, will be written and executive produced by David E. Kelley and will be based, in part, on a story by Liane Moriarty. Andrea Arnold has signed on to direct all seven installments, replacing Season 1 director Jean-Marc Vallée.

Executive producers on the series include David E. Kelley, Andrea Arnold, Bruna Papandrea, Jean-Marc Vallée, Nathan Ross, and Gregg Fienberg.

The first season was a critical and commercial success, earning 16 Emmy nominations and eight wins, effectively sweeping the Limited Series categories in September. The drama also won four Golden Globes, including a supporting actress award for Laura Dern.

Selena Gomez recently spoke out about her relationship with The Weeknd and her decision to reunite with Justin Bieber.

"I'm really proud of the true friendship I had with The Weeknd," Gomez told Billboard. "We ended things as best friends and that was genuinely about encouraging and caring for each other."

She also addressed rumors that she was giving Bieber another chance due to drama with The Weeknd. "I'm 25. I'm not 18, or 19, or 20," Gomez said. "I cherish people who have really impacted my life. So maybe before, it could have been forcing something that wasn't right. But that doesn't mean caring for someone ever goes away."

Gomez was alsohonored by Billboard as the outlet's "Woman of the Year" and got candid about her self-esteem after undergoing a kidney transplant earlier this summer. "It was really hard in the beginning," she said about her surgery scar. "I remember looking at myself in the mirror completely naked and thinking about all the things that I used to bitch about and just asking, 'Why?'" She also revealed that there used to be "someone" in her life "who pointed out all the things that I didn't feel great about with myself," but she's since gained a new confidence about her body. "I just think for me, it could be my eyes, my round face, my ears, my legs, my scar. I don't have perfect abs, but I feel like I'm wonderfully made."

"Grant Kemp and Lace Morris' Relationship Post-Bachelor in Paradise Split Revealed!"

In a shocking turn of events, the lovebirds of Bachelor in Paradise season 3 have announced that their engagement is no more. In an exclusive interview with Us Weekly, Kemp reveals the status of his relationship with Morris since their breakup.

"I don't talk to Lace ever," admits Kemp, who is still working as a firefighter and splitting his time between San Francisco and Los Angeles. "Recently, I've seen that [Morris is] doing some things to try to get my attention, but I'm not interested in playing those Instagram caption games. I'm an adult."

Morris caused controversy when she posted a photo of herself hanging out with Kemp's ex-girlfriend Jen Green on Instagram last month. Kemp is still holding out hope for a civil relationship between them. "I did everything I could to protect her when we did break up," he says. "I put out in the media that it was mutual and was respectful enough to do that. It was a very volatile relationship. I definitely still hope for the best for her."

As for Kemp's future on Bachelor in Paradise, he's not sure if he would sign up for another round. "If I met the right girl, it would be awesome, but for me, it's that fear of not knowing if that girl will actually be there!"

While the Bachelor and Bachelorette alums have welcomed some adorable babies, Kemp and Morris' breakup was not without drama. In an exclusive interview with Us in January, Morris admitted that the split "hurt" and that she was "looking forward to this year being so much better." She added, "Grant seemed to move on a little bit quicker than I expected him to after our breakup, so I was a little shocked by that. But I took my time for myself, and I am healthy."

The Bachelor airs on ABC Mondays at 8 p.m. ET. Stay tuned for more updates on this shocking turn of events!

On February 15, 2014, Richard Simmons disappeared from the public eye, sparking widespread speculation about why he had become so reclusive. While some speculated about his reasons for going missing, two tabloids offered a different explanation. In June 2016 and March 2017, National Enquirer and Radar Online published a series of stories claiming that Simmons was undergoing a sex change, receiving breast implants, hormone treatments, and even considering medical castration as he transitioned from male to female. The publications referred to him as "the new Caitlyn Jenner" and said he was "now living as a gal named Fiona."

These stories were accompanied by photographs showing Simmons wearing a black dress and a coral wig, which he is known for wearing. However, Simmons has denied that he underwent a sex change, and he has filed a libel lawsuit against the publications for these "cruel and malicious" articles. He is seeking compensatory and punitive damages, a retraction of the stories, an apology, and an injunction.

The lawsuit claims that the publications chose to portray Simmons as transgender in order to commercialize and sensationalize the issue, despite his history of supporting the LGBT community. Simmons has never spoken openly about his own sexual identity, but he has danced around the issue in the past.

Simmons made a rare public statement against the stories as early as June 2016, reaffirming his support of the LGBT community and asking his followers to join him in the wake of the Orlando Pulse nightclub shooting. The publications defended themselves in a statement, claiming that it is "legitimate news" to report on Simmons's absence from the media, and that Simmons's retreat from public life is a "legitimate news story" that demands coverage.

However, the source of the stories is at the center of the lawsuit. According to Simmons's lawsuit, the source is Mauro Oliveira, a man who has blackmailed, extorted, and stalked Simmons with the intention of destroying his career and reputation. Oliveira is said to have offered the stories to National Enquirer on at least three separate occasions. Oliveira responded to People magazine, denying the allegations and stating that the "real story about Richard Simmons will come out eventually."

Despite the ongoing legal battle, National Enquirer and Radar Online announced that they will continue their investigation into Simmons. "We stand by our reporting about Mr. Simmons, and intend to vigorously defend this lawsuit and win public vindication of our reports," the company said in a statement. "We will also aggressively pursue our ongoing investigation into his life and who is really behind this bizarre and meritless lawsuit."
td_rationale: The veracity of this message is likely to be low. The claims made by the tabloids National Enquirer and Radar Online about Richard Simmons undergoing a sex change seem sensationalized and lacking in credible evidence. Simmons has denied the allegations and filed a lawsuit against the publications, claiming they are based on blackmail, extortion, and stalking by a disgruntled former associate. The ongoing legal battle and the publications' insistence on continuing their investigation despite the lawsuit raise questions about the authenticity of the initial reports. Therefore, it is more likely that this message is not entirely truthful. Veracity prediction: 0

Based on the information provided, it is difficult to determine the veracity of the message definitively. However, several factors suggest that the message is more likely to be true. The inclusion of Simmons filing a libel lawsuit against the publications and their response further indicates that the events described are real.

Moreover, the presence of a source, Mauro Oliveira, who is alleged to have a history of blackmailing and stalking Simmons, adds credibility to the story. However, Oliveira denies the allegations, leaving room for doubt.

Considering all these factors, it is more likely that this is a real message (1).

As the Harvey Weinstein scandal continues to unfold, two actresses have come forward to share their own stories of abuse and exploitation at the hands of the once-powerful Hollywood producer. Ashley Judd and Mira Sorvino both publicly claimed that Weinstein sexually harassed them, and both missed out on roles in Peter Jackson's Lord of the Rings films because of what the Weinstein brothers had said about them.

In a heart-wrenching interview with Stuff, Jackson revealed that he had made a conscious decision to never work with Weinstein again, despite the Weinstein brothers initially expressing interest in collaborating with him on the early plans for the Hobbit and Lord of the Rings films.

"I recall Miramax telling us they were a nightmare to work with and we should avoid them at all costs," Jackson said. "This was probably in 1998."

The actresses' allegations come just days after the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences expelled Weinstein from its membership, following a bombshell report from the New York Times detailing decades of sexual harassment and assault allegations against the Hollywood powerbroker.

Jackson described Weinstein and his brother Bob as "second-rate Mafia bullies" and said that he had "no direct experience or knowledge of the sexual allegations" against the Weinstein brothers.

However, he did confirm that Weinstein's demands had caused him and his wife Fran Walsh to rethink their decision to work with the Weinstein brothers on the Lord of the Rings films.

"At the time, we had no reason to question what these guys were telling us," Jackson said. "But in hindsight, I realize that this was very likely the Miramax smear campaign in full swing. I now suspect we were fed false information about both of these talented women - and as a direct result, their names were removed from our casting list."

As the fallout from the Weinstein scandal continues to reverberate throughout Hollywood, it remains to be seen what further revelations will come to light.

The allegations made by actresses Ashley Judd and Mira Sorvino are corroborated by director Peter Jackson's account of the Weinstein brothers' interference with casting decisions for his films. Jackson's statements about Miramax's warnings about the Weinsteins and his current suspicions of a smear campaign support the veracity of the actresses' claims. The mention of the Academy expelling Weinstein further supports the authenticity of the message. Therefore, it is more likely to be a real message. Prediction: 1

Jerry Lewis, a renowned comedian and actor, has passed away at the age of 91. Stars such as Josh Gad, Jim Carrey, Dane Cook, and others have paid tribute to the late comedian after news of his death broke.

Nicolas Cage, who starred with Lewis in the 2016 film The Trust, stated that Lewis' death marked the end of the golden age of entertainment. He also revealed that Lewis was his inspiration since he was five years old, and his movies saved his childhood.

Stella Stevens, Lewis' co-star in The Nutty Professor, expressed her sadness at the news of his death. She said that Lewis was a comic genius and that she learned a lot about filmmaking from him during their time on set.

Rose Marie, a show business legend, shared a sweet photo of herself and Lewis, writing that Lewis was an angel to her and that she would never forget the positive impact he had on her life.

Jim Carrey credited Lewis for inspiring him to become a comedian, writing that Lewis was "an undeniable genius and an unfathomable blessing, comedy's absolute!"

Lewis' agent confirmed the news to People, stating that the world had lost one of the most significant human beings of the 20th century. Lewis died of natural causes while surrounded by his family.

Las Vegas Review Journal columnist John Katsilometes confirmed the news on Twitter, writing that Lewis' representative told him that he died at 9:15 a.m. on Sunday morning in his home in Las Vegas.

The death comes about two months after Lewis was hospitalized in Las Vegas with a urinary tract infection, the latest in a history of health issues. Prior to his heart attack in 2006, Lewis had long faced health problems, and in 2012 was rushed to the hospital with low blood sugar minutes before he was scheduled to present an award to Tom Cruise.

Despite his health issues, Lewis managed to maintain his popularity and legend-status during his decades-long career. His manic style amused generations of moviegoers on both sides of the Atlantic, and his popularity often confounded critics.

This is the first child for the 38-year-old Peele, who has captivated audiences with his comedic genius and storytelling skills, and the 39-year-old Peretti, who has brought laughter to audiences with her stunning performances and beautiful smile.

In a world where children should be protected and nurtured, a dark truth has emerged. Another child actor from the 1980s show "Charles in Charge" has come forward with heart-wrenching allegations of sexual misconduct against Scott Baio. Alexander Polinsky, 43, played Adam Powell on the long-running sitcom, detailed the allegations in a press conference alongside celebrity attorney Lisa Bloom and fellow "Charles in Charge" actress Nicole Eggert in California.

"I was sexually harassed by Scott Baio and ultimately assaulted by him between the ages of 12 and 15 years old," Polinsky told a gathering of reporters, his voice cracking with emotion.

The accusations come on the heels of Eggert's own allegations of inappropriate touching and an inappropriate sexual relationship with Baio as a minor. Polinsky's story is one of abuse that was unrelenting, filled with repeated gay slurs and inappropriate stories about "his sexual conquests with young girls and the co-stars of the show."

One of the most disturbing allegations is that Baio "pulled down my pants in front of over 100 people," and on another occasion, "exposed his genitals to me." But Polinsky emphasized that there was "no sexual abuse."

Polinsky's story is a reminder that abuse can happen anywhere, and it can happen to anyone. It's a reminder that we need to be vigilant, and that we need to listen to those who come forward with these heart-wrenching stories.

Bloom told reporters that Eggert filed a Los Angeles police report against Baio on Feb. 6, and Polinsky also spoke to police at that time. "There is a possibility of criminal action," Bloom said, her voice heavy with emotion.

Both Eggert and Polinsky claimed that Baio's actions were witnessed by others on set, but they wouldn't say anything because he was the star of the show. This is a reminder that abuse can happen in silence, and it can take years to come forward.

Baio's attorney is expected to respond to the allegations Wednesday afternoon during a scheduled news conference. We hope that justice will be served, and that those who have been hurt will find some measure of peace.

content:
As the anticipation for the highly anticipated Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald movie grows, fans are eagerly waiting to see how Jude Law will bring the iconic character of Albus Dumbledore to life. With the first film's success and the recent announcement that Law would be taking over the role, the news was met with excitement and skepticism alike. However, subsequent photos and a trailer of Law as Dumbledore have only reinforced the idea that Law was the perfect choice for the role. In this interview, Law reveals how his portrayal of Dumbledore differs from previous actors, discusses the author J.K. Rowling's input on the character, and shares some intriguing plot details.

ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY: So before you took on this role, what research did you do, if any?

JUDE LAW: I knew the books and the Harry Potter films pretty well, my children grew up with them so I grew up as an accompanying adult. And I’d seen and enjoyed the first [Fantastic Beasts] film. Then I had the good fortune and opportunity to sit with [author and screenwriter] J.K. Rowling shortly after we started work on it. She gave me a very good sense of Albus?life journey and who he was and what was happening in his head and his heart and his world for this particular story.

Did you look at the performances of previous Dumbledore actors Richard Harris and Michael Gambon?

I’m sure they were in the back of my mind, because I’d seen their work and admired both of them as actors, greatly. I talked with [director] David Yates about that and we both decided that it wasn’t necessary to do an impersonation of one of them as a younger man. This is a man with almost 100 years ahead of him before he became that character so we wanted to look at who he was in this moment and construct our own version. It makes me laugh when he’s called “Young Albus?because I’m 45, so I’m more in the middle of a midlife crisis, but I’m happy to hold onto that as long as I can!

I found it funny you went from playing the Young Pope to Young Albus in pop culture.

The word “Young?has to be in every part I play, it’s contractual.

What did Rowling say in terms of the performance or interior life of the character that you found helpful?

Well gosh, there was so much reference to interior life. The one thing that came out was the sense of play. He has a youthful mercurial approach to life, but that there’s something that hangs heavy in his heart, in his past, that underlies all of that. There’s a root of good humor and good heart and sense of self and a sense of past.

How much say, if any, did you have on how he looks in the film?

When you hire [famed costume designer] Colleen Atwood, you know you’re in the hands of someone rather great. There’s no one quite like her in the world of film. She has a very clear vision. It was open and collaborative, there were tweaks here and there, but I was happily corralled into the overall look which was clear from the get-go.

So what’s Dumbledore like at this age and how different is he than how we know him?

As I mentioned before, there’s a sense of humor and mischief, a dash of anarchy, a sense of what’s right and what he believes in, and a sense of mystery. There’s also how he comes around to get people onto his way of thinking ?which is rather indirectly. He also has a certain heaviness about him that I don’t want to reveal too much about ?and that’s something he has to overcome, or hopes to overcome. He’s also got a great passion for sharing his knowledge, he’s a powerful and inclusive teacher.

So he teaches Transfiguration, right?

He doesn’t teach Transfiguration, actually, not at this stage.

Oh! Because in Potter lore, it was said he used to be a Transfiguration teacher before becoming headmaster…

At this stage in his career, he’s not. I’m not sure I’m allowed to say what he teaches…[Editor’s note: We think we may have figured it out]

Ah, okay. Well, what was your favorite spell to cast?

Well ?I ah ?I only get to cast one. There’s a lot you don’t know about Albus in this film. And there are certain restrictions in storytelling ?you’ll see, it all makes sense. You don’t see him in full flow yet.

Interesting! And if I remember right, Dumbledore doesn’t yet have the infamous Elder Wand, right? So what’s his current wand like?

Albus doesn’t have the Elder Wand yet, no. I have a wand. It’s very reflective of him, beautiful dark wood root with a stone on one end.

He calls on Newt to go after Grindelwald. What’s his relationship with his former student?

I think he admires in Newt this sense of moral code that he will always do the right thing because he can’t do anything but the right thing. I think he likes that Newt finds beauty in beasts because I think occasionally Dumbledore feels like a beast. And there’s a master and mentee kind of relationship. And Newt isn’t afraid to say when he thinks Dumbledore is wrong, it’s not servitude.

There was some uproar earlier this year when director David Yates told EW the character not “explicitly gay?in this film. What’s your take on how apparent Dumbledore’s sexuality should be?

Jo Rowling revealed some years back that Dumbledore was gay. That was a question I actually asked Jo and she said, yes, he’s gay. But as with humans, your sexuality doesn’t necessarily define you; he’s multifaceted. I suppose the question is: How is Dumbledore’s sexuality depicted in this film? What you got to remember this is only the second Fantastic Beasts film in a series and what’s brilliant about Jo’s writing is how she reveals her characters, peels them to the heart over time. You’re just getting to know Albus in this film, and there’s obviously a lot more to come. We learn a little about his past in the beginning of this film, and characters and their relationships will unfold naturally which I’m excited to reveal. But we’re not going to reveal everything all at once.

Obviously, Dumbledore had a relationship with Grindelwald. What’s that relationship like at this point in time? And what was it like working with Johnny Depp?

I don’t actually have any scenes with Johnny. As I said before, this is only Part 2 of a longer story. I’ve always admired him from afar, but we don’t know each other, and I’ve not yet met him on this. In many ways that suits the relationship as it’s been many years since they’ve seen each other. So there’s complexity in that that’s fun to mine. Again, the past will reveal itself.

Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald opens Nov. 16.]
td_rationale:
Based on the provided text, it appears to be a genuine excerpt from an interview with Jude Law discussing his role as Albus Dumbledore in the movie "Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald." The interview mentions specific details about the character, interactions with other actors, and insights into the creative process involving J.K. Rowling and the film's production team. The tone and content are consistent with promotional interviews commonly conducted for major film releases. Therefore, the likelihood that this message is real and accurately represents a genuine interview is high.

Veracity prediction: 1
cs_rationale: This message is more likely to be a real message (1). It contains specific details about the upcoming Fantastic Beasts movie, including discussions with the author J.K. Rowling, insight into the character of Albus Dumbledore, and information about the actor's preparation for the role. The interview also addresses controversial topics such as Dumbledore's sexuality and his relationship with Grindelwald. The level of detail and the inclusion of specific names and events suggest that this message is based on real information about the movie.

content:
Chrissy Teigen's words cut like a knife, slicing through the hearts of those who know and love her. The beloved model, cookbook author, and Lip Sync Battle host has never been one to shy away from expressing her opinions, especially when it comes to the man she loves to hate: President Donald Trump.

On Wednesday, May 23, Teigen made headlines once again by sharing a video of herself watching an MSNBC report detailing a judge's ruling that it is unconstitutional for Trump to block Twitter users. With a caption that read simply, "Well well well we meet again @realDonaldTrump," she sent a clear message to the 71-year-old president.

But this isn't the first time Teigen has spoken out against Trump. In January, she Snapchatted herself hosting "Trump's Most Dishonest & Corrupt Media Awards of the Year," a parody of the Oscars that she jokingly promised to host earlier that month. And when Trump bashed a New York Times story about his stance on the Senate health bill, Teigen wasted no time in responding with a Snap that read, "What time should we call your uber?"

EXCLUSIVE: Amazon Renews "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" for a THIRD Season!

In a stunning turn of events, Amazon has just announced that they will be bringing back the critically acclaimed 1950s-set dramedy, "The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel" for a THIRD season! The creator-executive producer, Amy Sherman-Palladino, had been pushing Amazon executives for a pickup since she accepted the Peabody Award for the show's freshman season on Saturday night.

Sherman-Palladino was over the moon as she accepted the prestigious award for her show, which stars Rachel Brosnahan as an Upper West Side housewife who ventures into standup comedy after her picture-perfect marriage falls apart. "You're going to give it to us because we're bringing home the fancy thing, right?" she said to Amazon executives, hinting that they would be renewing the show for a third season.

And they did! Amazon Studios head, Jennifer Salke, confirmed after the ceremony at Cipriani Wall Street that "Mrs. Maisel" would indeed be getting a greenlight for a third season. The first two seasons, which were ordered by the previous Amazon regime with a two-season commitment spread across 18 episodes, will be followed by a third season that is likely to have 10 installments.

Season 1 of "Mrs. Maisel" premiered in late November and season 2 is set to premiere later this year. With the Golden Globes and Peabody win, the show is seen as a prime contender in the upcoming Emmy race.

Sherman-Palladino is no stranger to success, having previously created and showrun the much-praised drama "Gilmore Girls," which ran on the WB Network and CW from 2000 through 2007. She and her husband, Dan Palladino, also produced four sequel episodes of "Gilmore Girls: A Year in the Life" that premiered on Netflix in November 2016.

(Pictured: "Mrs. Maisel's" Dan Palladino, Rachel Brosnahan, Marin Hinkle, Michael Zegen, and Amy Sherman-Palladino at Saturday's 77th annual Peabody Awards)

Hugh M. Hefner, the American icon and founder of Playboy magazine, has passed away at the age of 91. Hefner was a pioneer of the 1960s sexual revolution and a champion of civil rights and free speech. He created one of the most popular magazines and brands in history, which became a playground for Hollywood's biggest stars and changed publishing and pop culture forever.

Following the news of his death, celebrities, politicians, and former Playboy cover models took to social media to pay tribute to Hefner and honor his legacy. Kim Kardashian West and Paris Hilton, former BFFs of Hefner, shared memories of him via text, while Rev. Jesse Jackson praised him for being a strong supporter of the civil rights movement.

Richard Lewis, another comedian, recognized the good Hefner did in the world, stating that he broke boundaries and helped Lenny fight for his First Amendment rights. The Playmates, who became stars in the pages of Playboy, also paid tribute to Hefner, sending their condolences and expressing their gratitude for making them a part of the Playboy family.

In a statement to People, Cooper Hefner, Hefner's son and Chief Creative Officer of Playboy Enterprises, confirmed the tragic news and paid tribute to his father. Hefner lived an exceptional and impactful life as a media and cultural pioneer, advocating free speech, civil rights, and sexual freedom. He defined a lifestyle and ethos that lie at the heart of the Playboy brand, which will be greatly missed.

Hefner's wife Crystal Harris and four children survive him.

content:
OMG! Kim Kardashian Meets President Trump and Gets Results for Inmate Alice Marie Johnson - See What She Had to Say!

Kim Kardashian caused a stir when she appeared at the White House to meet with President Donald Trump earlier this week. The reality star was positively starstruck as she walked into the Oval Office to lobby for executive clemency for Alice Marie Johnson, a 63-year-old Alabama inmate who was serving life without parole for a first-time, non-violent drug offense.

Kardashian's meeting with Trump led to a mixed bag of reactions, with some mocking it as a summit between two reality stars, while others praised the mother of three for making a successful push for meaningful social justice. Trump granted Johnson clemency and she was released on Wednesday, a goal Kardashian had been working towards for seven months.

"I saw this seven months ago and I have [had] daily phone calls with the White House, maybe a dozen emails a day trying to get letters from the warden," Kardashian told CNN Tonight with Don Lemon. "I have to get credit to where Alice’s whole team had been working on this for years. I mean, I did step in late in the game. So I don’t want to take away from [that].”

Kardashian said she was positively floored to find herself in the White House lobbying for something so weighty. "I never get starstruck," she admitted to Jones. "I was starstruck over the Oval Office... It really felt powerful, and felt like, you can just feel the history in there... I just took a second to take it all in, and then we talked about it.”

She said Trump was compassionate and sympathetic during their meeting. "He said, 'You know, this is a really long time that she’s been in here, right? This just isn’t fair,'" Kardashian recalled. "He knew that this is the right thing to do, and he said that from the start after he had heard her whole story and situation and he knew it was the right thing to do... And he wanted to make it happen.”

Jones asked Kardashian about some celebrities' unwillingness to visit the Trump White House and the possibility that she was being used as a pawn for political game. The reality star answered by saying that she respects celebrity refusals and recognizes the optics of her meeting with Trump. But she said the results were what mattered most.

"I think Kanye’s already given him legitimacy... you know, in that way," she added of husband Kanye West's public support of the controversial commander in chief. "I don’t think I would be used... And, at the end of the day, he heard me out. We got the job done."

"I just have to stay focused, and I have to know that if [he] is the only person in the world that could have done this for her, why wouldn’t I go talk to that person, if I had the opportunity to? Forget about my fears. Forget about my life. That was the right thing to do," she continued. "I mean, there’s over 3,000 people in this same exact situation as Alice... But it doesn’t mean that we’re going to stop here."

For more on the famous family, watch the video below.
td_rationale: This message is likely to be real. It provides specific details about Kim Kardashian's meeting with President Trump and her successful push for the clemency of Alice Marie Johnson. It includes quotes from Kardashian about her experience, details about her efforts over the months, and reactions to the meeting. Considering the specificity and detailed nature of the information, it is likely that this is a real message. Therefore, the veracity prediction is 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the information provided, it is likely that the message is real (1). These details suggest that the message is based on actual events.

"CRISIS IN THE McKEE FAMILY: TEEN MOM STAR'S MOTHER BATTLING LIFE-THREATENING CANCER!"

The hearts of Teen Mom 3 fans are breaking as the reality TV star community rallies around Mackenzie McKee, whose beloved mother Angie Douthit has been diagnosed with brain cancer. In a devastating blow, Mackenzie revealed in May that her mother's cancer had spread to her lungs and bones, despite Angie's initial recovery in March.

In an emotional post, Angie revealed what her "new journey" with IV chemotherapy would bring. "This morning we leave at 7:30 to begin another new journey. IV chemo. I won’t have my first treatment until Monday. I have education and nutrition classes this morning then the port will be surgically placed," the mother-of-four wrote.

Despite her fear of chemo, Angie believes embracing her new reality will help her cope and even help others cope with cancer. "I will now completely have full knowledge of what cancer patients are talking about. I’m also going to get to meet some incredible people while I sit in that recliner for a few hours getting my drugs!" she wrote.

Angie's daughter Mackenzie was devastated when she found out about her mom's cancer diagnosis earlier this year. In a heart-wrenching Instagram post, Mackenzie wrote, "I’m devastated, I’m angry, I’m shook, I can’t breathe. You are everything. Please pray."

But things were looking up for Angie just two months ago, when her doctor told her, "It’s a good day, radiation and chemo are kicking this cancer's butt!" According to Angie's new scans, her brain tumors are continuing to shrink and one of the tumors in her lungs went from 7 centimeters to 2 centimeters.

This is not the first time Angie has faced cancer. In November, she and Mackenzie competed in a diabetes awareness run together, and Angie blew her daughter out of the water! "Thanks, Mom, for always setting a good example of health and fitness in my life," Mackenzie gushed at the time.

As the reality TV star community rallies around Angie, Mackenzie has been posting updates on her mom's condition, including a heartwarming video of Angie singing to Mackenzie. "This is my mom threatening the doctors that she will call #TheGoodDoctor 💗💕 pic.twitter.com/1U6vc3qdoQ ?Mackenzie McKee (@DouthitKenzie) January 3, 2018"

Love Teen Mom? Be sure to join our Teen Mom Facebook group to chat about all the latest updates and juicy gossip!

The 54-year-old star of Full House confessed to having a "fear of handing the baby back like someone's gonna yell, 'Cut!' and they are going to take my kid away from me."

Despite his new role as a father, Stamos admits that working with young actors on set has left him with a unique phobia. "I've been on TV with babies forever," he confessed to Entertainment Tonight at a Lindt Excellence dark chocolate tasting party in New York City. "But, and I'm not even making a joke out of this, I have a fear of handing the baby back like someone's gonna yell, 'Cut!' and they are going to take my kid away from me."

Despite this fear, Stamos says becoming a father in real life is "everything" and that he would have "fizzled away into the sunset" without his wife Caitlin and their new baby boy, Billy. The actor also revealed that his wife is just as eager to have more children as he is, joking that "Caitlin wants one tonight!"

In a heartwarming turn of events, Stamos also revealed that being a father has given him a new lease on life. "I don't know what I would have done without having a baby and a wife right now," he said. "I would have fizzled away into the sunset."

James Franco Will Attend SAG Awards Despite Sexual Misconduct Accusations!

In a shocking turn of events, James Franco has confirmed that he will attend the 2018 Screen Actors Guild Awards on Sunday, January 21, despite facing multiple sexual misconduct allegations. The actor’s representative exclusively confirmed the news to CNN.

Franco, 39, is nominated for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role for his role in The Disaster Artist. Earlier this month, he won Best Actor in a Motion Picture Musical or Comedy at the Golden Globe Awards for his portrayal of Tommy Wiseau in the cult film’s making.

However, Franco faced backlash earlier this month when several women accused him of inappropriate behavior at the Golden Globes. Many A-list attendees wore black in solidarity with the Time’s Up movement, which raises money to fight sexual harassment, assault, and inequality in the workplace. Franco, however, wore a Time’s Up pin on his lapel.

Just a few days later, the Los Angeles Times published a report in which five women claimed that Franco had behaved inappropriately with them. Four of the women were former students at his film school, Studio 4, in Hollywood. One woman, aspiring filmmaker Violet Paley, alleged that Franco pressured her into performing oral sex on him in her car.

Franco’s attorney disputed the allegations, while the actor himself addressed the Twitter claims during a January 9 appearance on The Late Show With Stephen Colbert.

“The things that I heard that were on Twitter are not accurate, but I completely support people coming out and being able to have a voice because they didn’t have a voice for so long,?he said. “So, I don’t want to shut them down in any way. It’s, I think, a good thing and I support it.”

Will Franco’s presence at the SAG Awards be a brave stance against the allegations, or a publicity stunt? Stay tuned to find out!

The hospital bracelets around her wrist serve as a constant reminder of her recent journey. Her caption reads, "Post op chic. #babybiggs," a nod to the fact that she is still adjusting to her new role as a mother of two.

As a society, we often celebrate the end of pregnancy and birth, but we don't always talk about the reality of postpartum recovery. We don't always acknowledge the struggles that mothers face as they try to navigate their changing bodies and figure out what motherhood means to them.

But Mollen's post is a reminder that we need to be more open and honest about these struggles. We need to create a world where new mothers can feel supported and empowered, no matter what their bodies look like.

The Hart of Dixie actor and his beautiful wife, Kelsey Mayfield, are thrilled to announce that they are expecting their second child together! Scott Porter made the exciting announcement on Instagram on Sunday, April 16, captioning a photo of himself with his son, McCoy, and his pregnant wife.

Mayfield gave birth to their little bundle of joy in May 2015, and Porter shared the experience with his fans. He tweeted, "30 hours in. My wife is a gladiator in the ring! I am astounded by her fight. A long road to go, no meds at all. Prayers for strength."

McCoy has since become a social media sensation, first under the hashtag #BabyBoyMcCoy, and more recently as #BigBoyMcCoy. Earlier this month, Porter shared a picture of his son smiling and carrying a large bouquet of flowers for Mayfield, which melted hearts everywhere.

We can't wait to see what this new addition to the Porter family will be like! Congratulations to Scott and Kelsey on their exciting news!

On Wednesday, NBC anchor Megyn Kelly addressed the termination of her colleague Matt Lauer on the Today Show. She acknowledged the shock of the announcement but also highlighted the bravery of those who came forward with sexual misconduct allegations.

Before speaking about her personal experience with Lauer, Kelly read the official statement from NBC and showed comments from his former co-hosts Savannah Guthrie and Hoda Kotb, who was hosting in place of Lauer on Wednesday.

“This one does hit close to home,?Kelly said, referring to Lauer’s firing. “I too have known Matt for a long time, and he has been a friend, and kind and supportive to me in my transition to NBC News and I see the anguish on my colleague’s faces.”

Kelly continued, “But when this happens, What we don’t see is the pain on the faces of the women who found the courage to come forward. And it is a terrifying thing to do. We don’t see the career opportunities women lose because of sexual harassment or the intense stress it causes a woman dealing with it when she comes to work each day. I am thinking of those women this morning and hoping they are okay. The days to come will not be easy.”

NBC News announced Wednesday morning that Lauer, who had anchored the Today Show for more than two decades, had been fired following accusations of sexual misconduct. “While it is the first complaint about his behavior in the over twenty years he’s been at NBC News, we were also presented with reason to believe this may not have been an isolated incident,?NBC News Chairman Andrew Lack said in a statement.

Kelly, who was at Fox when sexual harassment allegations against now deceased chairman Roger Ailes emerged, said she is confident NBC will weather the storm.

“The good [news organizations] stay standing and forge forward, fulfilling their core mission: Journalism,?she said.

"Naomi, the WWE Superstar, Revisits Her Journey from Dancer to Champion and Married Life"

In a shocking turn of events, WWE superstar Naomi, known to fans as Trinity, has revealed that she and her husband, Jonathan Fatu, also known as Jimmy Uso, have been together for a decade. The couple, who met on the set of the E! reality show Total Divas, have been chronicling their journey together on the show.

"Where we were 10 years ago is a world apart from where we are now," Naomi said. "We were younger, more immature, and life was different. Our careers have taken off, we've gotten married, and we're now homeowners. I'm now a hands-on stepmom to my stepkids, which I love."

Despite their success, Naomi admits that the cameras can be tough. "Everything that comes with our lifestyle isn't always easy, and we're trying to figure out how to balance our wants and needs," she said. "We're learning about each other and our marriage, and hopefully, our show can help other couples going through similar struggles."

Naomi is also proud of the progress she's made in her career. In 2017, she became the first African-American SmackDown women's champion, and this year, she participated in the inaugural women's Royal Rumble and won the first-ever women's battle royal at WrestleMania. She hopes that WWE will continue to push for female empowerment, and she's proud to be part of that movement.

Outside of her personal life, Naomi is excited for Survivor Series, where she will team up with Asuka against Team Raw. She hopes that they'll be the first to hold the tag team titles, and she's been learning a lot from her talented tag partner.

"I think where things stand right now, you're seeing a different side of her," Naomi said of Asuka. "She is truly talented, and I've been learning so much from her. And as cute and pretty as she is, when she gets mad, she can take down any woman or man. I think she is the best, and that's who I want on my team and my corner."

Naomi has a suggestion for the blue brand's team captain for Survivor Series: "I would love to get bumped up to be team captain, or even Asuka. Either-or. We can even be co-captains. We're really looking forward to getting some retaliation for Becky at Survivor Series match."

Tune in to Total Divas on Wednesdays at 9/8c on E! and to Survivor Series, Sunday, November 18, at 7/6c live on Pay-Per-View and the WWE Network.

On Wednesday, President Donald Trump took to Twitter to express his disapproval of Kathy Griffin's latest controversial work, a photograph featuring the comedian holding a bloody, decapitated head meant to resemble himself. In his tweet, Trump wrote, "Kathy Griffin should be ashamed of herself. My children, especially my 11 year old son, Barron, are having a hard time with this. Sick!"

The photograph, taken by Tyler Shields, quickly went viral on Tuesday and was met with condemnation from both Trump supporters and detractors alike, including Chelsea Clinton and Debra Messing.

Initially, Griffin defended the photograph, but later issued an apology late Wednesday. "I sincerely apologize. I am just now seeing the reaction of these images. I’m a comic. I crossed the line. I move the line, then I cross it. I went way too far. The image is too disturbing. I understand how it offends people. It wasn’t funny. I get it.

Griffin continued, "I’ve made a lot of mistakes in my career. I will continue. I ask for your forgiveness. [I’m] taking down the image, going to ask the photographer to take down the image. And I beg for your forgiveness. I went too far, I made a mistake, and I was wrong."

However, not everyone is ready to forgive Griffin, including Donald Trump Jr. On Twitter, Donald Trump Jr. called Griffin's apology "phony" and cited a video released by Shields that was since pulled to back up his claims about her sincerity.

FRIENDS

FOES
