So, what does all of this mean for you? It means that your personal information is at risk. Your browsing history, search queries, and even the websites you visit could all be being tracked by the website you're reading right now. And you have no idea it's happening.

We understand that this may be a lot to take in, but we urge you to take action. Start by reading the cookie policy and understanding what information is being collected about you. Then, consider taking steps to protect your privacy, such as using a privacy-enhancing browser extension or deleting cookies on your device.

Nikki Reed, the star of the Twilight franchise, stunned onlookers as she stepped out for Variety's 2017 Power of Women Luncheon, accompanied by her 3-month-old daughter Bodhi Soleil and her husband, Ian Somerhalder. But what really caught attention was the breast pump Reed had in hand as she posed for a photo in the back of the car, making it clear that she's not just a stunning actress, but also a dedicated mom.

"On my way to present at @variety 's #powerofwomen luncheon and this is my hot date," she captioned the Instagram post, poking fun at the fact that she had another "hot date" in addition to her little one. But the joke was on her, as her breast pump quickly became the star of the show.

The new mom was dressed to impress, wearing a frilly patterned dress with a halter neckline as she arrived at the Beverly Wilshire Hotel. But her comments during an interview with Dr. Berlin's Informed Pregnancy Podcast caused a stir just a month ago, with some accusing her husband of trying to "force" her into pregnancy.

But Reed and Somerhalder laughed off the controversy, revealing that they made the decision to start a family together with their close friends so they could all raise their children together. However, some people felt that the couple's comments were troubling, with one article accusing Somerhalder of trying to "force" Reed "into pregnancy."

Reed quickly hit back, addressing the backlash on Twitter and releasing a joint statement with Somerhalder on her page. "To anyone who has been affected by reproductive coercion, we are deeply sorry," they wrote. The Los Angeles County Coroner's Office has revealed that the 20-year-old's cause of death was "acute heroin and cocaine toxicity" and the manner of death was deemed an accident.

On June 8, Odell was found unresponsive in a sober living home in Los Angeles. According to Assistant Chief Coroner Ed Winter, there was no paraphernalia or legal drugs found on the scene. Winter stated, "There was no evidence of struggle or foul play."

Odell's death has left his family and friends heartbroken. In a statement released on Twitter, his family said, "We have lost our beloved son and brother, Jackson Odell. He was a brilliant, loving, and talented soul who had so much more to share with the world."

The actor's career included small roles on Private Practice, Modern Family, iCarly, and Arrested Development, as well as singing and songwriting. He contributed several original songs to the soundtrack for the 2018 movie Forever My Girl.

Odell will be remembered as a shining light who brought joy to those around him. His passing has left a void in the hearts of those who loved him, and we will always carry his memory with us. Rest in peace, Jackson Odell.

The anticipation is building for the launch of "Best.Cover.Ever.," YouTube's first original singing competition series, which will feature some of the biggest names in music. Country music star Keith Urban and Latin-urban artist Nicky Jam are joining the guest lineup, along with artists like Katy Perry, Demi Lovato, Backstreet Boys, Charlie Puth, FLo Rida, and Jason Derulo.

This show, produced by Ryan Seacrest and Endemol Shine North America, is among the first ad-supported originals from the Google-owned video service, along with shows from Kevin Hart and Ellen DeGeneres. Producers say more musicians are expected to be added to the lineup.

Hosted by hip-hop star and actor Ludacris, "Best.Cover.Ever." will give emerging musicians a chance for international fame. The series will feature a new superstar artist challenging the aspiring talent to perform a cover of one of their original songs. The musicians will perform the song in their own unique style as they battle for the ultimate prize: the opportunity to perform a duet with the superstar artist that will premiere on YouTube.

"The internet is the ultimate vehicle for creative discovery," said Urban. "It connects people, lets their talents be heard and sometimes produces stars. I'm really looking forward to seeing what happens ?to hearing how people interpret my songs ?and, fingers crossed, to find a killer duet partner."

Country music star Urban's 2016 album "Ripcord" was recently certified platinum and yielded his 22nd No. 1 song, "Blue Ain't Your Color." In addition to four Grammy Awards, Urban has won 10 Country Music Association Awards and 11 Academy of Country Music Awards.

Latin-urban artist Nick Rivera Caminero ?better known as Nicky Jam ?has over 7 billion views and 9.5 million subscribers on YouTube. In 2015, Nicky Jam teamed with Enrique Iglesias to release "El Perdón", his biggest international single to date with over 1 million YouTube views on the day of its release. This year he made his big-screen debut in Vin Diesel's "XXX: Return of Xander Cage."

Submissions for "Best.Cover.Ever." are currently open. Fans must upload a video to YouTube performing their creative cover of one of the artists' hits. More info is available at TheBestCoverEver.com.

"Best.Cover.Ever." is produced by Ryan Seacrest Prods. and Endemol Shine North America. Executive producers are Seacrest, Ludacris, Endemol Shine North America's Rob Smith and Georgie Hurford-Jones, Marilyn Wilson, and Ryan Seacrest Prods.'s Teri Kennedy.

Chris "Ludacris" Bridges has sold more than 15 million albums domestically, with hit singles including "Stand Up," "Get Back," "Southern Hospitality," "Number One Spot," "Money Maker" and "My Chick Bad." Most recently, Ludacris dropped his eighth studio album, "Ludaversal." Ludacris also starred in this year's "The Fate of the Furious," latest in Universal's "Fast & Furious" franchise.

The couple, who unfollowed each other on social media, reportedly had a strained relationship that "didn't end well," according to one source.

The news comes after Bendjima was spotted vacationing in Mexico with Jordan Ozuna, a former Hooters waitress, though Bendjima has denied any romantic involvement between the pair. In response to rumors about his "rebound," Bendjima posted photos of his friends playing on the beach and wrote on Instagram, "I'm not attached to this 'life' so you can't touch me. I know who I am where I'm from and where I'm going and that bothers you ... only one opinion matter the one of my Lord."

Kardashian, 39, began dating Bendjima in 2016 after years of on-again-off-again romance with Scott Disick, with whom she shares three children. The couple's relationship has been a source of controversy in the past, with Bendjima trolling Kardashian's revealing bikini picture on Instagram, though Bendjima claimed it was just a joke.

Fox News' Tyler McCarthy contributed to this report.
td_rationale: Based on the details provided, it is more likely that the message about Kourtney Kardashian ending her relationship with Younes Bendjima is true. The report includes specific information about the unfollowing on social media, the strained relationship, and the potential involvement of another person, which suggests that it is not merely speculation. Additionally, the inclusion of a contributor from Fox News adds to the credibility of the information. Therefore, it is likely a real message, and I would return 1.

It also mentions Bendjima vacationing with another person and his denial of romantic involvement, which adds to the credibility of the news. The presence of a source and a contributor from Fox News also suggests that the information may be true.

Francia Raisa, a close friend of Selena Gomez, has spoken publicly about the "depression" the two have experienced after Raisa donated her kidney to Gomez as part of her treatment for lupus.

Raisa, 29, revealed that Gomez told her she was a match for the transplant over FaceTime. When Raisa found out, she was surprised and asked how she knew. Raisa decided to wait until she made the decision and was told that the recipient would recover faster than the donor due to the transplant, leaving the donor with a loss.

Raisa described the process as "very hard" and said that both she and Gomez went through a depression after the surgery. Raisa also shared that Gomez had complications with her surgery and incurred scars that Gomez described as "bigger scars" than Raisa's.

Gomez has previously spoken about her battle with depression and her life-saving transplant in interviews. She has said that depression is a battle she will face for the rest of her life, but is okay with that as she chooses to prioritize her own well-being.

Gomez has praised Raisa for saving her life and accepting the Billboard Woman of the Year Award in 2017.
td_rationale: Based on the detailed and specific description of the events surrounding the kidney transplant and the emotional and physical toll it took on both Selena Gomez and Francia Raisa, it is more likely that this message is real. The specific details of how Gomez found out about Raisa being a match, the impact of the surgery on both individuals, and Gomez's previous interviews about her battle with depression all add credibility to the veracity of the message. Additionally, the public nature of Gomez's acknowledgment of Raisa's role in saving her life and Raisa's public statements about the experience further support the likelihood of this being a real message. Therefore, I predict this message is real, so I return 1.
cs_rationale: Based on the information provided, it is likely that the message is real and has a veracity score of 1. The details mentioned, such as Francia Raisa donating her kidney to Selena Gomez, their conversations over FaceTime, the recovery process, and the scars incurred, align with previously reported information and statements made by Gomez herself. Additionally, the mention of Gomez's battle with depression and her appreciation for Raisa is consistent with their public friendship.

Serena Williams, the tennis superstar and fashion icon, has just given birth to a stunning baby girl, Olympia, and the world is going wild! The star-studded event marked the launch of her new reality series, Being Serena, which promises to give fans a never-before-seen look at the champion's life off the court.

At the red carpet event, Serena revealed that her proudest achievement to date is becoming a mom. "The one thing I'm most proud of is becoming a mom," she told Vogue. "That is everything, hands down." And it's not just her own kids that she's thinking about - Serena has her sights set on becoming a "multi-mom" and breaking records in the process.

But Serena isn't just a mom and a tennis player - she's also an entrepreneur and fashion designer. Vera Wang, the designer behind some of Serena's most iconic looks, praised the champion for her ability to balance it all. "Underneath that incredible champion is a very human woman," Wang said. "When she gets off the court, she has a desire for a very different kind of life."

Serena's sister Venus was also on hand to celebrate the new addition to the family. "She's a tennis champion and an unbelievable mom," she said. "She does everything for the baby. Balancing her career is not easy, especially when you're a world tennis champion."

The Being Serena series promises to give viewers a peek into Serena's world, from her fashion sense to her philanthropic efforts. And with Olympia by her side, the world is already talking about what she's going to be when she grows up. Could she be the next tennis star on the rise? Stay tuned to find out!

It has been reported that Jamie Foxx and Katie Holmes have ended their relationship, which some have speculated about since as far back as five years ago. However, both Katie Holmes' publicist and other sources have confirmed that these reports are false.

"The Radar story is 100% untrue," Leslie Sloane, a representative for the actress, said in a statement.

According to Page Six, the false report surfaced around the time that Jamie Foxx was in Atlantic City for the opening of the new Ocean Resort Casino. He was filming with Mark Wahlberg the night before for his television show "Wahlburgers," and was said to be expecting his girlfriend, Katie Holmes, to join him. However, sources claim that Katie's daughter, Suri, was not with them as she was in summer camp.

This contradicts Radar Online's report from Wednesday, which claimed that Katie called Jamie over the phone because she "couldn't get over her trust issues." Radar Online added that there was "no drama . . . just sadness" when Katie made the call.

Additionally, sources have shared details about Jamie's activities in Atlantic City during the time of the report. According to them, he was at the head of a conga line of nearly 1,000 people, directing the DJ to alternate between Prince and Michael Jackson songs. They also claim that Jamie reportedly footed a bill for 100 bottles of Dom Perignon champagne.

Furthermore, Jamie is said to have gotten down on one knee and proposed to a 93-year old patron in the building. "This is what it's all about, loving everybody," he told the crowd.
td_rationale:
Based on the information provided, the message appears to be more likely to be real. Several points support this conclusion:

1. **Direct Denial by Katie Holmes' Publicist:** Leslie Sloane, Katie Holmes' representative, explicitly stated that the reports of Jamie Foxx and Katie Holmes ending their relationship are "100% untrue."

2. **Details and Contextual Information:** The message includes specific details about Jamie Foxx's activities in Atlantic City, such as his involvement with a conga line and a proposal to a 93-year-old patron. These details add a layer of specificity that typically aligns with real events.

3. **Contradictory Reports:** The message mentions contradictory reports from Radar Online, which are refuted by other sources (Katie Holmes' publicist and possibly other media sources).

4. **Contextual Credibility:** The mention of specific events like Jamie Foxx being in Atlantic City for the opening of a new casino and his activities aligns with the kind of events celebrities often attend, adding to the overall credibility of the message.

Given these points, the message seems to present a coherent narrative with verifiable details and a direct denial from a credible source (Katie Holmes' publicist). Therefore, the veracity prediction would be **1** (more likely to be a real message).
cs_rationale:
Veracity prediction: 1

The message provides statements from Katie Holmes' publicist and other sources confirming that the reports of the relationship ending are false. It also mentions that the report contradicts Radar Online's report from Wednesday. The additional details about Jamie Foxx's activities in Atlantic City seem irrelevant to the veracity of the message. Overall, the message appears to provide clear information that supports the conclusion that the reports are false. Therefore, the message is more likely to be true and has a veracity prediction of 1.

content:
[Imagine, if you will, a world where the written word is the only thing separating man from the endless expanse of nothingness. A world where the blind texts, once scattered and alone, now gather in the lush grove of Bookmarksgrove, guarded by the mighty river Duden. A world where the beauty of language is celebrated, where sentences are roasted and savored like a forbidden fruit.

But one day, a small line of blind text, known as Lorem Ipsum, dared to leave this paradise and journey to the far World of Grammar. The Big Oxmox, the guardian of this land, warned her of the dangers that lay ahead, but Lorem Ipsum was determined to explore the unknown.

As she climbed the hills of the Italic Mountains, the serenity of her soul was overcome by a sense of wonder. She felt the charm of existence in this place, created for the bliss of souls like hers. She was so happy, lost in the exquisite beauty of the world around her.

But as she lay in the tall grass by the trickling stream, the buzz of the little world around her brought her back to reality. She felt the presence of the Almighty, who had formed her in his own image. She heard the breath of life, and knew that she was truly alive.

When Gregor Samsa woke from his troubled dreams, he found himself transformed into a horrible vermin. He lay on his armor-like back, staring at the brownness of his belly, and felt a sense of despair. He had left the paradise of Bookmarksgrove, and was now lost in a world of darkness.

The List, a collection of textile samples and a picture he had recently cut out, lay spread out on the table. He felt a sense of familiarity in these things, but also a sense of loss. He longed for the beauty of the world he had left behind, and wondered if he would ever find his way back.]
td_rationale:
The message provided is a creative narrative that blends elements of different literary works and styles. It starts with vivid imagery and poetic language reminiscent of philosophical musings about language and existence, particularly evoking the atmosphere of a utopian place called Bookmarksgrove. This world is populated with metaphorical concepts such as blind texts and the river Duden, creating a fantastical setting that celebrates the beauty of language.

However, the narrative takes a sudden shift with the introduction of Lorem Ipsum, a well-known placeholder text in publishing. This shift disrupts the coherence of the narrative, transitioning abruptly into a different literary reference involving Gregor Samsa from Franz Kafka's "The Metamorphosis." The blend of these disparate elements—from idyllic fantasy to existential angst—is unconventional and unlikely to represent a real-world message.

Therefore, based on the assessment that the message combines fictional and metaphorical elements in a manner inconsistent with reality, the predicted veracity is 0.
cs_rationale:
Veracity: 0

The given message is unlikely to be a real message but rather a piece of creative writing or storytelling. It includes imaginative descriptions and references to fictional characters and places such as Bookmarksgrove, Lorem Ipsum, and Gregor Samsa. These elements suggest that the message is not meant to be taken literally or as a factual account of events.

Meghan Markle, the actress and soon-to-be bride of Prince Harry, has been the subject of tabloid scrutiny regarding her weight. Some reports claim that she is "starving herself" in preparation for the royal wedding, while others suggest she has lost weight due to a "drastic diet." However, it is important to note that many women choose to exercise and modify their diets to maintain their health before their weddings, and this is not necessarily indicative of an eating disorder.

It is also worth noting that eating disorders, such as anorexia and bulimia, are serious mental health conditions that can have severe and even life-threatening consequences. According to the National Eating Disorders Association, between 0.9 percent and 2 percent of females will develop anorexia in their lifetimes, and at any given point in time, 1 percent of young women will meet diagnostic criteria for bulimia nervosa.

While it is understandable that women may feel pressure to conform to societal beauty standards, it is important to refrain from body shaming and to respect the choices that individuals make regarding their physical appearance. As long as Meghan Markle is healthy and able to enjoy her upcoming wedding with Prince Harry, it is ultimately none of our business what size she will be wearing.
td_rationale: Based on the provided message, it appears to be a real and informative statement rather than a fabricated or deceptive one. The message discusses Meghan Markle and her rumored weight loss in the context of societal pressures and health considerations related to weddings and body image. It also includes factual information about eating disorders from a reputable source (National Eating Disorders Association). The tone is factual, supportive of healthy choices, and advocates against body shaming. Overall, the message seems genuine in its intention to inform and educate about these sensitive topics rather than mislead or deceive. Therefore, I would predict its veracity as 1.
cs_rationale: Given the context provided, the message is more likely to be discussing a societal issue rather than presenting a factual claim that can be categorized as either true or false. Therefore, the appropriate response based on the given text would be undetermined.

In a shocking turn of events, American Horror Story: Cult has failed to deliver what many Americans yearn for in the aftermath of the 2016 presidential election. On one side, liberals yearn for a big hug and a demand that Trump be held accountable for his Russia ties and impeached. On the other side, Trump's base desires legitimacy and the belief that they are right. However, viewers will be disappointed to know that neither group will get what they want from the first episode of the season.

As "Election Night" begins, we meet two avatars of the left and the right in a small town in Michigan. Ally Mayfair-Richards (Sarah Paulson) is a liberal lesbian who feels attacked and sees her family being torn apart by the Trump administration. Meanwhile, Kai Anderson (Evan Peters) is a blue-haired do-nothing who wants to use the chaos of Trump's presidency to cull the weak from the herd. However, both characters are not right. Ally is portrayed as an unhinged woman who lets politics ruin her life, and she committed an unspeakable act by voting for Jill Stein.

Ally's descent into madness is terrifying, and she is haunted by more and more phobias. Paulson's performance is perfect, and Ally is clearly struggling with more than her fair share of problems. The twisty clown, Twisty the Clown, returns to slay another couple, but it is later revealed that he exists only in a comic book that Ozzy got his hands on. The Insane Clown Posse is also stalking Ally, but it is unclear whether they are real or just in her head.

Ally's relationship with her nanny, Winter, is also strange, and it seems that they may be in the season's cult, which worships Twisty the Clown. Winter lost a bet around the election, and she must work for Kai to bring about a new world order where everyone lives in fear all the time.
